reviews.review: Lovely place to wander!. The streets of Barrio Alto are ALIVE!!! Lots of nooks and crannies to wander through and locate a variety of stores, restaurants, pastelarias, and small hotels. Seems quite safe at night but watch for the rowdy tourist coming out of the bars!!I loved just wandering the streets....especially the narrow ones. Lots of hills and steps abound.....just let yourself wander... we came upon a Fado singer and sat outside the restaurant to listen.... neat area to explore...especially, at night!
Bonkers but brilliant. A bustling area of an amazing city. Bairro Alto has such a vibrant night life, it seems most of Lisbon visit here of a weekend evening!

Upper city. We entered the neighborhood via the funicular and began the walk recommended by Rick Steves by stRting at the Port Wine Institute just across the street. After that we walked around and ended up at the Convent of Carmo. Very beautiful architecture and churches.
Visiting Bairro Alto. Bairro Alto is always a good place to go for a dinner, bar or walking around on a tapas bar. Lots of people on the weekend, became touristic spot.

Disappointing!. Lead by what guides reffer about this place, we spent an afternoon wondering around trying to find a reason to such a fuzz about.Its a case of "too much do about noting"! Terrible discusting bars, narrow streets not so clean...all in all a place to avoid. Lisbon had much more and much better to offer. Don't loose your time and money there!

An amblers delight.... ...is to become lost walking through the side streets and alleys, enjoying looking at the many shops, restaurants, bars and beautifully tiled buildings, and having a glass or two along the way. A pleasant way to spend a lazy half day or so - just soak up the atmosphere and enjoy.

One of the must visit areas. This is one of the must see areas and our hotel package included a private tour for us. Very interesting but not for the faint of heart. It is either climb up or climb down if on foot, which is the only way to see it. We walked 4+ miles and it was challenging for a couple of seniors but worth a visit. On your own, you might stroll more but not know the significance of the sites. Lots of cafes, bars and shops.

Old historic Lisbon at its best. Use the trolley or funicular to get up to the Barrio Alto to explore the tiny streets and alleys. The food is good and there are lots of little things to see. The shopping is good too.

A very fine visit to a first class Lisbon hotel. We were greeted with beverages upon check-in. Although we were and early arrival for our room we did not have to wait long to gain access which was especially welcome after a long overseas flight. Our Queen bedroom was small but well maintained. Bathroom was exquisite with lovely towels and fine toiletries. The hotel faces a busy square but with the windows and balcony door closed we did not hear a thing and had a restful sleep. The restaurant was excellent - food and service and the roof top terrace bar offers great views. Upon checking out there was a discrepancy between the rate charged and the confirmed rate from our travel agent. Reception let us pay the rate as quoted by our travel agent and indicated that if there was any discrepancy they would charge the additional after verifying. They were very pleasant and non-confrontational which eased the situation. ( In the end the rate quoted by our travel agent was honoured so we were delighted that no additional charges were levied. )
Real life of Lisbon. When you think of a old European city with its daily routine, old center, cultural traditions, small restaurants ,cafes and shops as described in Fados, visit the Bairro Alto!

The most VIBRANT happening area of Lisbon ! You MUST GO. This area is fantastic. Views are unbelievable over all parts of the city. The sunsets are not to be missed. Of all the areas of Lisbon we visited this was by far the most lively.Packed with people, more on the young side. Little cafes & pubs, street vendors and artists. FADO venues tucked in little narrow cobblestone alleys. I think about it and wish I had the opportunity to spend more time there. It was late September when we were there and the University students in their Harry Potter type capes were everywhere! So interesting.

A part of Lisbons beauty..... Get into training cos Lisbon requires enough of your stamina to walk up and down the beautiful cobbled streets...and across one hill to another that make up this gorgeous city.Barrio Alto is just one of the sights ...get your trainers on and get going!

Nice nightclub area. We went for drinks here and had a great night out. There are so many bars and nightclubs to choose from so it's a great place for a bar crawl. The starts here are pedestrianised so people also hang out outside the bars creating a fun atmosphere.

Go late! . Go for a late dinner, drinks, music .... you will work your legs getting to the high points of the city but well worth the ambiance and energy . After 10/11 things really pick up and you will be swept up in the nightlife vibe
Port cellar visit . Visited the Sandeman cellars , very impressive and learned a lot about port. Found the 20 year old Twany to be excellent. Took ride in the cable car , nice view

The best party neighborhood. This is where all the young people, be it Portuguese or foreigners, workers or students, go out to have a drink. I once heard that BA has more than 250 bars. I loved every bar that I visited there. there is also bars with dancing music and small dancefloors for the dancers amongst you ;)
This part of Lisbon attracts everyone.. This part of Lisbon attracts everyone. You are invited too! You get the best views of the city, plus - numerous restaurants and cafes. Outdoors and indoors.

My favorite section of Lisbon. We took a cab to the Miraduro de Sao Pedro Alcantra. It has one of the best views of the city. you can also take the funicular from the Praca dos Restauradores. The Belevedere also has local artisans and painters as well as vendors that will sell you cold drinks and coffee. From this spot to the right of the Belvedere you may take the Cable Car down but first I suggest that you visit the Port Wine Museum which is directly across the street and then visit the wonderful Sao Roque Church. The painted wood, false-domed ceiling is perfectly flat. Also find the St. John the Baptist Altar. It was used once at the Vatican, they dismantled and brought ti this church.

100% on your visit list. You cannot see the City without having been into Bairro Alto. It has some of the best buildings view and photo opps in the whole City. Get the tram from the centre if you do not want to walk all the way or use the elevators hidden in two buildings in the West of the City. There are lots of little bars and shops on every street it is a great area to walk. We did over 18k steps one day.But it is hilly be aware, it will take some doing if you are not good on your feet.

Great neighborhood . My mom and I stayed in an apartment in Bairro Alto while staying in Lisbon. Lots of great restaurants and bars in the neighborhood. Close to metro, shopping, and within a good walking distance to other areas. Great squares to take pretty pictures.

Eccletric area of Lisbon that is a must visit. We first visited the Barro Alto while on a food/drink walking tour of Lisbon and enjoyed the vibe and eclectic nature of the area of the city. We came back one evening to visit the area at night and try out a local restaurant and take in a Fado show. We walked around the area and found a great restaurant to have a light snack in before taking in a Fado show and supper at another restaurant. If you are going to Lisbon this area is a must visit. The only warning is make sure you have the ability to climb up one of the large hills in Lisbon to get up to Barro Alto and if you have limited mobility take the escalator up there or a cab ride.
has it all. this is the No one spot to be. walk and check out the architecture, people, food and drink. you will be impressed. recommended meutermedia

Saturday night here was a great experience!. Although fairly quiet during the week, this area really came alive on Saturday night. Lots of bars & restaurants! Buy a beer and saunter around until you find somewhere you fancy :)

WOW! An energetic and packed place to hang out in old Lisbon!. What a great place to wander through and to really feel like you're in the middle of it all. If you don't like crowds then this is definitely not the place for you, but if you're OK with the masses, then this place will provide you with many options for people watching and for dining.
Delightful lanes to explore. One of the prettiest walks in Lisbon - away from the frantic road works and traffic. Lots of good bars and restaurants in this area.

The place to be in Lisbon. Bairro Alto is the place to be in Lisbon! There are amazing sights, picturesque views, wonderful nightlife and of course delicious food. Highly recommend stopping in at a small cafe and enjoying the view. Taking the cable car (#28) is extremely popular in the area and a good way to see a lot of the town.
History and local flavor. Winding cobblestoned streets that are steeply inclined, not for the faint hearted. Tiled building fronts are very impressive. Surprising views of the sea.
Pictoresque. Go here to take your pics for Instagram. Nice little up the hill walk. On a sunny day would recommend the little cable car.

Best nightlife . Had such an amazing time in Bairro Alto. It doesn't look like much during the day but at night everything comes to life. Very cheap and plenty of places to choose from. A place for every person.

My second choice....but quite lovely. I prefer to stay in Chiado vs Barrio Alto. B/A is fantastic for a younger crowd with all the night life it has to offer. Hundreds of tiny bars and restaurants and also the home of the Park Roof Top which is a bar on top of a parking garage. I know I know sounds weird but it was amazing. Right next to Chiado so you can easily access all the sights but it's definitely a younger crowd and definitely noisier

Architecture. Hilly - where isn't here - but worth the hike around for Art Nouveau, a dash of Art Deco, and lots of tiled facades. Excellent mirador at summit of elavador de Gloria (shorter wait than the lift - and cheaper).

A must do. If you're visiting Lisbon you need to go here at least one of the nights, it's amazing! So many bars and restaurants and such a good buzz around the place. Make sure to get the tram though, it's a pretty steep hill up.

When in Lisbon... Go to Bairro Alto (at night!!!). You are a student? Or just a traveller who wants to feel the beat of the city? Or you enjoy people and you want to feel as if you are still 18 (just for a few hours at least)?Well Bairro Alto is the trendy place you want to go to. At night, it buzzes with people, but not in an invasive way. People love going out in Lisbon, they love to mingle, and because all these little bars are small, people tend to stay outside to have a chat and a good time. A student told us "if you asked me to give you the name of a single bar, I couldn't, not because I drink too much, but because everyone is outside". It's not just for students as many places also have very nice and typical restaurants, some very trendy, some on the classical side with Fado singers that you need to book in advance for week-ends.Don't miss it!!!
Awesome!. I loved the ambience of the Bairro alto, this is the place to party! Lot of bars, lot of mojitos! Yummi!!

"Another place you don’t want to missed it!". This is a really nice neighborhood, very unique and historic. The ups and downs of the roads remind me of San Francisco. The tram is unique so you don’t want to walk. Great place to spend an evening because it is full of restaurants and bars. This is definitely another place you don’t want to missed in Lisbon!

A area worth seeing. Lisbon is a massive city with lots to see, do and eat. Most of the tourist are concentrated right in the centre with all the tourist shops, bakeries and statues. I encourage all to do so (sort of like a right of passage), but then make haste and go to the Bairro Atlo. It was the most spectacular area in Lisbon I have seen in my entire week there. The place takes you back to another time and era where for a brief moment, you let go of all your stress and worries. Just go!

Not really rocking but OK. Was expecting street after street of party central.What I actually saw was lots of backstreets with bars, some busy, some empty. A reasonable amout of places to eat but if you eat outside you are likely to be sat next to an unemptied bin. Prices vary greatly for drink- paid between 7E and 2.50E for a large beer!

Specific athmosphere in Bairo Alto. Either by climbing all the way up to the castello or by taking tram 28; moving though this area is a special experience.The tram is very crowded, most of the time. If you want to make sure that you can enjoy this trip, wait till in the evening. We saw the tram passing by with only one passenger at that time. Mind to watch your belongings when in the crowd.

Another Old and high area in Lisbon. One of the older parts of Lisbon set high on a hill. Rather seedy in parts but full of cheap restaurants and bars. great views. Get her by fununcular or the 'Elevador de Santa Justa' a sight in it's self
Good for the side-streets architecture.. Avoid the tram and walk. It's not as bad as it looks and lets you see more. 2 to 3 hours will cover the whole area. Plenty of cafes in the area.
Lisbon vacation. Great area with lots of expensive restaurant and some very reasonable if you are confortable walking into the ones where the only language you hear is Portuguese.

Seek recommendations . My positive experience of visits to this part of Lisbon was absolutely made by the quality of recommendations I got from friends who had previously visited Lisbon. Full of life at night.
A beautiful overview of Lisbon. It's a demanding climb up a steep hill, so don't wear flip-flops. Better yet, hop aboard the #28 tram and rattle your way to the top.

Bairro Alto. Lot of people, ready to party. best place to have fun and enjoy nightlife in Lisboa.
Differents culture, differents musics everyone can enjoy it.
THE FUNCKY PART OF LISBON. We loved walking through this area. It has very intersting little shops and new pop up restaurants. Very vibey at night and very safe to walk after dinner.

Lovely hotel, lovely people, lovely place. We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise. I've never been to Portugal before let alone Lisbon. The people have been uniformly lovely. I kept thinking 'no wonder the English & the Portuguese haven't been at war-we were both probably saying"after you, no, after you!!) The hotel is in a good position for seeing the older parts of Lisbon. We booked the hotel restaurant 'Flores' for dinner for the first night. It was so good we booked for the second night too. The front of house chap, Felipe, was great and we had good food and good wine. Thoroughly enjoyable stay, all the staff are helpful and friendly. I'd be happy to recommend it to family & friends.

A Must See Neighborhood in Lisbon. Put on a good pair of walking shoes and head out for a walk through this great neighborhood full of delightful shops and restaurants. Guidebooks offer a suggested route to cover, but for me, just wandering around, getting lost, asking directions only to get lost again and discover something new is part of the excitement of walking through this neighborhood. Make sure to have some grilled sardines at one of the sidewalk restaurants.

Fun, enchanting section of Lisbon. My husband and I just returned from 10 days in Lisbon and had the most fun the evening we walked through Bairro Alto. We listened to Fado, had dinner and stopped at several places for drinks. It is a charming, bustling section of the city and this evening is one of our fondest memories.

A trip down memory line. The antique architecture, panoramic view and restaurants around here are to die for. You can walk around for hours, but also get there within 20 minutes. Traditional food is very affordable. There's a lookout where you can buy hand paintings and other a crafty stuff. There will be no bad photos as every corner offers a great colourful chance. We walked from Baixa Chiado but you can drive or get there by the yellow tour bus.

Super cool. This is the trendy part of Lisboa full of restaurants and clothing stores. The streets are narrow and steep (hence the name) but almost a picture can be found in every corner. Lots of small plazas to stop and have a break from the walking. You must see the lookout behind Das Ruinas do Carmo and the Elevador da Justa or wander to the Mirador overlooking Restauradores. Absolutely amazing. You can find the Igrejar Jubilar, a stunningly beautiful church inside (rather simple look on the outside). It sits beside Museu Santo Roque.A great neighbourhood to peruse.

Wow! What a party!. Take a walk through the streets of the Barrio Alto for a delicious taste of local culture late any evening. The streets overflow with crowds of partiers. I've never seen anything like it before. So many people partying in so many different locations. I'm not a drinker myself, but it was fun to watch so many people having such a great time nevertheless. Good nighttime views of the city from the Mirador are outstanding.
great bars. we found lots of great bars up here and a great view over Lisbon. The tram up the hill makes it easy to get too.

Dissapointed . We went up to bairro alto the first time by foot in the evening hopefully to eat there but couldn't find anywhere suitable. Last time I went was 29 years ago and it was a fantastic place bustling with sardine restaurants which are no longer there. There was hardly a soul in sight and therefore no atmosphere! Then went up on the tram during the day and it was a bit better and more people around. The gardens were nice but I wouldn't rush back... it's a shame it has changed so much .
fun shops, botiques and restaurants. This is where the artists hang out; lots of shopping and restaurants available. Good place to find Portuguese items-linens, tile, ceramics, etc.
Must. You should have been there. That is the historical part of Lisboa. Here you see funny things in the street.
Plenty shops.. If you want loads and shops then this is the place to be. From posh to nicknacs it's all here. Plenty of watering holes on the way.

One of the most interesting spots in Lisbon. During our unforgettable summer vacation there we stayed there .. it was really fun to walk in the Bairo Alto small or main streets there are lots of nice shops and restaurants like the one of a kind "sea me"..i strongly recumbent it .

party. We told our cabbie to take us to a place that features Fado music. He took us to 3 places in the Bairro Alto, and they were all sold out! Even after 9PM the streets were crowded on a Wednesday night! The cabbie ended up taking us to the Alfama for some Fado there.

Rented my first Airbnb in the Bairro and was not disappointed. Agree with other comments that it was very quiet in the day but definitely the area was hopping during the evenings. Narrow streets and lots of hills but my apartment was actually toward the bottom so I didn't have that many hills to climb. I was lucky enough to have a grocery store close and also the Time Out to eat many of my meals.
Highly recommended!. A quiet place to sit down and enjoy a light meal with a glass of beer or wine. The trees and scene made the experience unique and memorable.
Busy area. The area is very busy and a bit hilly. It offers all you need including restaurants, small shops and amenities. We stayed close by so we had a chance to walk around.

Another gorgeous neighbourhood of Lisbon. This is of course a MUST GO. The narrow winding lanes, quaint buildings, tons of bars and restaurants serving delicious cocktails and food. Pretty cheap. You will have a lovely time. Go there.
Nice night live!. If you want cheap drinks and crowds in small alleys, this is the place to go! Especially for young people it is great!!!

Great for Nightlife . If you are heading here I wouldn't even think about going before 9/10 at night. We ventured here around lunch time and everything was shut and was a bit of a ghost town. However by evening there are loads of good restaurants and bars to keep you entertained until almost sunrise.

Amazing. Had a stroll on the streets just after lunch, amazing vibe. Tourist all over, happy faces and loads of history.
Wish I could come back to experience the nightlife - am told thats the best
Nice. Nice place to walk. Shops, nice terrasses to have an excellent view. Very friendly people. Lisbon is nice. We will come back

Tons of Fun if your looking for a larty. This area is always poppin! It is a mistake to book a room here if you want to sleep, but it was so much fun the wander the streets having cocktails and meeting new people!

Just wander round and take it all in. The perfect place where all you have to do is walk around at your own pace and take in the atmosphere. It is always buzzing with tourists and locals alike. It is packed with tourist trap restaurants but if you are willing to look, you can find some real gems that will serve better authentic food and won't cost you a fortune either. The architecture in the area is stunning too and there are so many shops to have look in.
Part of the city hop on - hop off bus. We took the green line hop on hop off bus, featuring the older part of town, a nice way to see part of the city at an easy pace
Fun at night. Cool area in Lisbon featuring a lot of bars and restaurants. Good place to hang out at night. Set on hills, so walking around may be a challenge for some.
FULL OF BARS AND RESTAURANTS. A fun area with lots of bars and restaurants to visit in the evening. The street is hilly so it is not good for elder people. But they can take the elevator.

Full of energy. This is a really fun part of town, full of shops, restaurants and bars. Musicians come out at night.
2 restaurants stand out, Cevicheterria for ceviche and Lisboa a Noite for fine dining.

Super cool at night. We stayed just outside the area so it wasn't too loud at night. It's a very cool area with the best place to get pastis de nata (amazing egg tart) and fantastic restaurants and bars. Getting the furnicular up the hill is fun (tickets are half price if bought from shops in advance). At night people mostly buy drinks and sit in the street chatting. There is a great bar on top of the multi-storey car park (called Park) where you can watch the sun go down, though you'll be lucky to get a seat.
This is the place to be at night. Manu bars, clubs, resturants located in narrow streets. Allot of fun at night. If you are into drinking, pubs, anf parties search no more. Nothing much before 2300..

wear comfortable shoes and start the sightseing!. great place with many restaurants and barsbeautiful neighborhood, wear comfy shoes and clothes, lots of walking cool architecture awesome viewmust visit!!

Don't miss this district of Lisbon. A bit chaothic, a bit messy but definitely has a special atmosphere. Small streets, trams everywhere, in the evening pubs are crowded. You will also find nice restaurants here with realistic prices.
Must see . Impressive crowd in the evening Weeds and cocain vendors at each corner, but really a part of Lisbon you have tout see

Take a trip to this part of old Lisbon. Take a walk down into this area starts off the avenue liberdade past the classic old rossaStation with its wonderful facade .Cross the road into the square and walk on down Rua Augusta to the main square under the historic archway where you will find wonderful restaurants and cafes on the edge of the river .From here you can take your first view of the wonderful vasco de gama bridge spanning the river and the wonderful statue of Christ stood on the hill .This is also where you can catch the river cruiser which can take you on a wonderful cruise for a couple of hours to see the sites of Lisbon from a different perspective.

Great place to relax. Area to relax, with many food or a quiet drink, conversation or contemplation. Plenty of bars, restaurants (try the moment on the Rosa Street, 151) and lojas.Visite Bairro Alto and you will find something for every taste and budget. Great nightlife.

Love Barrio Alto!. Lovely to walk around, the botanic garden was very nice. Good neighborhood vibe. We stumbled into a shop that has porcelain irregulars but you can still find some very nice things for very few Euros! Great neighborhood!

Great place for dinner and drinks. But don't go on Sunday evenings when many places are closed. On every other night, you should go for drinks at around 8pm and plan for a dinner to start at 9.30.
Very easy to walk to from the City Centre and is a great place to wander around.
Dinner, shopping and night life. Plenty of bars, restaurants and shops. Walk around and you will find something for every taste and budget. Great night life
Typical View. Get in the middle of Lisbon and feel closely the português culture and typical food from the capital.
Wonderful relaxing area.. Great area to relax,with many venues for food or a quiet drink, conversation, or contemplation. Music abounds and there are many views of the city.
Great locale. This area was next to Baixa Chaido and a convenient area and with the same picturesque buildings as Lisbon has . Has a good night scene .
Best area for eating and drinking. A lot of nice restaurants and good places to have a drink in this area. Many places to get a good view of the city.

Lovely food. Found this area by mistake rather than design and enjoyed a beautiful meal in Stasha and great company in a small bar called Jinha close by. We went back the following evening as we enjoyed it so much.

For dinner, some drinks or party hard. This is a must-go in Lisbon: walk around the neighborhood and choose a restaurant for a dinner. Some of the best wine bars in Lisbon are in this area, so stop by if you are into wine tastings. Around 11PM the party-hard crowds arrive.

So much LIFE. This part of the city is quite vibrant. Be prepared to wear tennis shoes. Lots of hills and the sidewalks are made of small slippery cobblestones. Every few steps has a different vista. Lots of coffee shops, pastry shops and superb ice cream. In the evening, there are a lot of bars open. Primarily for young adults.

Postcard Perfect. Walking around Bairro Alto was beautiful. We spent 6 days in Lisbon and enjoyed Bairro Alto, Alfama and Chiado. Each area was historic and beautiful. We wandered up and down the streets and through the shops. We read restaurant menus and choose a place for dinner each evening. The architecture was magnificent, pictures don't do justice to the enormity of buildings or squares.

Cafes and restaurants come alive at dusk. A nondescript area by day but about 5pm the streets start to fill with tables and chairs and suddenly everywhere is a cafe or bar or fado venue. Keeps going well into the night.

Be Ready to Hike the Hills. Just one of the many neighborhoods in Lisbon. Every street is up or down hill so be prepared, also the sidewalks are made of these beautiful stones that can be very slippery. Fortunately it didn't rain while I was there, but if these sidewalks had been wet I don't think I could've got very far.

An all time nightlife highlight.. Walking around Bairro Alto; in and out of bars on streets packed with revellers is one of the highlights of my life. It's the house party scene, everyone with a plastic cup of alcohol standing around in groups - people talking, singing, dancing, laughing - but out in the streets, outside bars open early and closing late, music thumps away in places - others are quieter, people eat down side streets.What a fantastic place to be.
A Pleasant Surprise. We originally made a Lisbon a stopover on our trip, but was so pleasantly surprised we stayed extra.

Beautiful traditional neighborhood!. A must see place in Lisbon. This location is very close to Chiado and other traditional neighborhoods so with just a couple of hours you'll be able to visit a set of beautiful areas in the old Lisbon town! A must see!
A Severa fado restaurant. Great neighborhood to walk around at night! Wonderful fado restaurant! Authentic show and very good food!
Lisbon by night. Typical Lisbon, wotrhwille to explore, with many interesting bars and small restaurants, some of them open durring the daylight. Visit "Sul".

Hipster place, must visit. During the day it is empty, narrow streets, many street artSo cool.On the afternoon many restaurants open, usually around 7 pm, 7:30. Many nice places, a lot of them where you can hear Fado music.After 11 pm this place comes to life. It is crazy how many people are on the street. Usually they buy drinks and just drink them on the street. Be careful of your belongings as some can steal from you.

A nice place to enjoy during your visit to Portugal. From my Hotel, with my operated knee I stuggled to climb such an uphill, downhill town. It has its own unique view. A gorgeous local bakery would soothe your breath , a good lunch with moderate price would fill your heart good memories of Bairro Alto. A wonderful place with moderate expenses.

wonderful experience. We rented an apartment in Barrio Alto last week at Rua da Rosa and Todi. Beautiful area with good restaurants and cafeterias and gelatto shops very close. A little bit noise during the week ends but we were looking for living people finally and that was the right place! We rented a car and we use that a lot, we visited Sintra, Queluz and Sesimbra from Lisbon. Is hard to find a parking but the landlord recommended us a municipal parking not very far from the apt.

A must see, just watch your stuff. It is definitely worth going to see and ride on the trolley. Just watch your belongs when you are there. The trolley can get pretty packed and several people had things stolen. You will not catch the people who are pick-pocketing because they hand off the items to other people and quickly exit the trolley.

Fun Fun Fun!. If you're looking for a good time, go to Barrio Alto! There's a tram that takes you up the hill, but it stops working at a certain time so you'll end up having to walk down the hill -- don't attempt this in heels, ladies! Highheels aren't needed because this place is unpretentious and tons of fun. We had dinner and then proceeded to have drinks outside with out new friends. Then we went to a bar which lead to another bar and next thing we know it's 5am and running down the hill. Drinks are cheap and you can find an array of bars to suit your idea of a good time. Just simply GO, you won't regret it!

Weekend visit . We stayed in a local apartment in the Bairro Alto. Luckily we were on a side street with just 2 restaurants. It was great to watch daily life from our balcony and see the transformation at night into party central. We will certainly return to Lisbon when it's a little bit cooler to see more of this great city.

Fun area. Lots of bars and restaurants. A fun area with lots of bars and restaurants to visit in the evening. Me and a friend popped in to a restaurant called the red light.Food was good and sitting outside you could enjoy your meal whilst people watching. Not to mention the numerous street acts who come by all the restaurants. We had a great Guitarist by ours and later a violinist, which was cool.Oh, be warned (or be informed) I have never been offered more drugs in my life. Every man and his dog is pushing in this area, but a polite decline was more than enough to see them off.

Old part of the city full of bars and restaurants.. Old part of the city full of bars and restaurants. Very hilly so if you have walking difficulties then make use of the various bars, cafes and restaurants
Fun. Take a fun ride on the funicular to Bairro Alto and look out over the city of Lisbon and have a cappuccino on the comfortable deck chairs.

Great night out!. The massive array of bars and clubs made this a great place for students on a Friday night, too bad two of our party got so drunk on cheap sangria that we had to cut it short at 5am!
Fun. Very unique. Makes for great pics. Reminds you of days gone bye. ..Just do it and smile and take pictures
Hoping area at night. This is a very lively part of town. There are many bars, restaurants, Fado restaurants, etc. It is packed with people every day.

Don't miss this !!. It's quiet a climb if you are not in good shape or when it's very hot (>30 C) . But once you arrive you forget quickly the climb :-)? so nice to visit all the small street in Alto Bairro. Great, gerat .... we loved it . More then the city center

Awesome old town. Of all old towns in Europe, this one has to be the most fun. Lots of elevation changes, so bring your walking shoes. Get on tram #28 and ride around all the good please without having to pay hop-on/hop-off prices. Get a mojito in one of the small bars, you won't regret it.

Must-see shopping district. Even if you are not planning to do any shopping, be sure to visit this famous part of the city. Simply walk around and inhale the special athmosphere and look at the beautiful buildings.

A must see. I visited this area one evening as I had heard it comes alive after dark. So true. I arrived via metro and then took the funicular up the hill. That is an experience in itself. Remember to load a tap card and use this when paying for metro, funicular, trams, etc. As it's much cheaper (and easier). I roamed the streets and found a restaurant (there are many). The view of Lisbon at night is wonderful from up here.Just be warned that some of the metro stops close after 8:30 so you have to go to one of the larger metro stops such as at one of the squares.
Great for a stroll!. Very nice area for a stroll, many good vantage points to see the city from, many shops and some nice cafes and restaurants.

this place is amazing. this place it is very bohemian,you can eat,drink,dance and a lot of thinks ,many restaurant with a fado show that it is a folklore music of Lisbon,be careful with your purses a lot of pick pockets,so if you are prudent nothing happens .many people take to the restaurant and they charge by a cover charge of 5 or 7 euros even if you dont drink or eat nothing.Place it is excellent

Party!. I just love this area. It is so lively. There are several bars and restaurants in this area. This party of the city is where you go to have fun. In my opinion Lisbon has such a great nightlife. The streets are completely packed with people eating, drinking, dancing, socializing. I would go back to Lisbon just for Bairro Alto. Have Capirinhas here. Beware of the drug peddlars.
Great area. What a lovely place, lots of restaurants , bars , cake shops , all very authentic , really hard to go wrong with food choices ! Loved every minute !

Very nice. It's maybe one of the areas we liked most during our holidays in Lisbon. The streets are nice, there are various shops, restaurants and bars. We also recommend you take the elevator (Santa Justa lift) and see the city from the viewing platform.

Night and day. During the day, the alternative stores, restaurants and trends will be found there or close by. The night is ready for us and for all. Great bars, good food, for all prices. Come visit I loved it.

Nice narrow streets a lot of character. You can have a beer or a crepe. Walk around and just enjoy the neighbourhood. Beware that the sidewalks can be a bit slippery I preferred walking on the streets. Nice restaurants and terraces all around. Great food and nice people.

Favorite!. This is definitely a great place to go on a Friday night. So many charming bars and restaurants. My only regret is for not having enough time to go there more than once. Definitely one of my favorite places in Lisbon.

Visit during the day and at night. Though this neighbourhood is often referred to as the "bar district" abundant with nightlife, I recommend checking the areas out during the day and at night. While it definitely boasts a great nightlife with many quaint bars hidden among the alleyways, I first went there during the daylight hours and it was well worth it! You get to see all the street art and typical Portuguese tile work that adorns most of the buildings, which you can't see at night. Well worth the visit!

Lovely. Great area with many bars, restaurants, shops and a mall, metro, streets buskers, nice people. Hreat to walk around although a bit challenging with all the streets going up and down :))) Really dod a lot of workout here.

View to see. First day to town we took a tour of this area on a moped car. Whichever as Great fun to get around the small streets The view from the top is amazing you see the whole city. A must seeGreat area to explore
Can't miss this part of Lisbon. A maze of delightful alleyways, going up and down a very interesting part of Lisbon. Wear good walking shoes :-)
Old town. We enjoy walking to mediaval streets.the castle and old church.Panorama from graça very nice.Esplanades very useful

The place of bares. Its the place to go out at night, every door has a bar, diferente concepts, diferent prices, up and down you can discover a mix of cultures. And by day you can discover some litlle stores and the tipical life of the neigborhood.

Do I love Lisboa!!. Lisboa is a beautiful city, where you can move around in underground, eat the most amazing Rodizios or Bacallao (tipical portugese recipes), You can buy the best coffee (probably) in the world, very unique tea from the only tea plantations in Europe (in the Azores). A walk about the Barrio Alto offers you great jazz places, great bars, even better shops (very good prices), great restaurants (small and large, cheap and more pricy). And Portuguese people are one of the nicest people I have met in my travelings, easy going, relaxed and very friendly. (still, mind your wallet). I am always happy to go back to Lisboa, for business or pleasure.

Loud . It is a very loud neighborhood. Especially at night. It's the party area. If you're not there to party do not get an apartment in that area. In the morning there's the garbage from the night before glasses and beer bottles. A real mess from the drunk party goers the night before. Other then that it's a nice area to visit take a walk. A lot of restaurants and bars. But if you are not there to party do not get a place there! I wish I knew this before.
Lively place . In group or in couple, Bairro Alto is a place of cult. The environment is unique and this melting pot really pleases us. A nice place to start the night.

3 days in Lisboa . I've been to Lisboa many times and his time I stayed in the Barrio Alto. I loved this area!! Stayed in a charming old studio apartment right in the heart of the Barrio. There are a lot of restaurants and bars in the area, which come alive at night when everyone spills into the small narrow cobblestone streets.It can get a little noisy at night depending on he season. E views of the city from e miradouro are breathtaking.

Very nice!. The view from the top of the street with furniculars on their way is something I was looking forward to most when planning my trip to Lisbon. It is as nice as in the many pictures you can find on the internet and the most steep elevator route in Lisbon so I recommend to take a tram, get off on the top and walk downwards.

Local City Sightseeing in Lisbon. Certainly a characterful area of Lisbon, with shops, cafes, bars, restaurants, trams and loads of joyful people. The night life capital of this Portuguese capital. Love it.
It could be beautiful...but. The buildings are in a deplorable state, even the azulejos haven't been renovated in a long long time. There are a few beautiful corners. It was very disappointing.
Lots of fun. Lots of fun, great atmosphere and good food.I would highly recommend going there one evening to check it out.

Alive. Wow. It was eye opening and ear opening. We stayed in the heart of the Barrio Alto and it was rather noisy at night with the chants of soccer fans. It buzzes here all day and all night, might not be a good place to stay with little kids unless you have great soundproofing for your windows. However, if you want to party and go crazy any day of the week, this is the place for you! Don't get me wrong there are also cozy little restaurants and bars for romantic nights out with the hubby. It's rather hilly but that's part of the charm, it's surprising how quickly you get used to trudging up a hill, my calves are definitely better because of it! All in all, great place to stay but not with the kids.
Exercise as you explore. A must see if you are in Lisbon. So much of history and culture. I love everything about Portugal. Was there in Sept '15 with my sister.

Party central. This seems to be the Lisbon area if you looking for bars with music. We made our way into the area at 9pm expecting things to be in full swing but most bars were still very quiet and not filling up until 11pm ish. It was an area we did consider staying in but judging by the banging music being pumped out by some of the bars, there wouldn't be much peace until 2am
Nice place to wander around. . Lots of cobbled narrow streets easy to get lost in. Bring a map. Interesting little shops restaurants and bars.

A must. You should visit this neighbourhood in the evening. It's full of tourists and Portuguese that are trying to offer you the best meals.Also, is a must just to walk around the narrow streets, really relaxing.

From the top to mediocrity. Bairro Alto was one of the most typical districts of Lisbon offering wonderful fado happenings (in the old days) sung and played in different taverns. You could see in the narrow and popular streets small wondeful shops which started the new waves for design and clothes in the early/mid 70s Many bars opened and the popular, cheap "tascas"(taverns) were redone, giving place to wonderful little restaurants serving typical portuguese food. It became so fashionable and hot that it just developed in a very unpleasant place fulled with touristic traps, bad restaurants (with some remaquable exceptions), nasty bars and many rug dealers proposing "stuff"to young tourists and Portuguese. Totally has been

Drinks Drinks Drinks. Perfect place to drink drink drink drink. We had dinner in this quarter. It was not so nice an tourist orientated. This place is better for drinking, but this starts late, after 22.00

Check the side streets and the street art. It's a must see in Lisbon. The area looks poor, but has something of old charm. We wandered the small streets, that are not marked in the guide and it is where you can see a real life, kids on streets, smell of cooked dinner etc. It's not all that beautiful, there's rubbish on the streets, but there's also a lot of great street art and beautiful architecture.
Full of restaurants . Nice location if you want to go for dinner. It's just ful of restaurants. Parking places could be tricky to find.

perfect to go out at night. During the day the streets are quiet and empty but in the evening and at night it gets very crouded. There are a lots of restaurants and bars there. You can sit in the streets and have dinner and afterwards go out. The party takes place in the streets. You get to know a lot of people from all over the world. Unfortunately there are drug dealers everywhere who offer you drugs. It's really annoying.

A must go area . Bairro alto is the area to be visited in Lisbon. Great area to find bars, restaurants, clubs and a lot more. Since Portuguese food is amazing, you will enjoy to eat around here. Most restaurants are small so they set the tables outside in the streets. The service is usually great and the food cooked by local Portuguese chefs. Be ready to walk in Bairro Alto. You will go up and down the streets and everything is so beautiful with a lot of character. By the time you end your day, you will realize that you haven't walked that much for a long time. The streets are crowded. Specially at night time when people go out to eat, dance, or just walk.

Overrated and lots of hustle with dealers. It's a young area and very touristy. People are out drinking on the street but they do that in London too. It is a lovely old quarter and there is a pretty decent if touristy jazz club. There is a lot of pretty blatant hustling going on that I haven't seen in a major city for years, so of coke and weed are your thing you'll certainly get an offer. Just don't be surprised if you get ripped off these type of deals are outside the confines of any quality control.

Loved it in the day loved it more at night. Day and night very different. small boutiques and nothing much in the day. At night it transformed to happening bar area with many places for drinking at low prices. It is a must visit.

Very good walk down to praca do comercio . We start the day with Lisbon Explorer who pick us up in e hotel for a 4 hours walk down the hill.It was a great morning to pass through the small and narrow streets of Bairro Alto.The view points over Lisbon are great stops for pictures. I would suggest the morning time, as in the afternoon the sun would hit the cameras

Awesome Night Life. A great neighborhood to find a party on weekend nights. Tiny bars line the streets and everyone brings their drinks to the outdoors. It's essentially an entire neighborhood that accommodates a party in the streets.

Perfect for partying and meeting people from around the world. This district is definitely the place to visit for any age group, whether you're on a couples holiday or stag/hen party (we even saw a newly wed couple and their wedding party walking through and stopping for a drink), you can buy a drink, take it outside and walk around the other bars. The atmosphere is electric.

Lively at night. Just as Alfama, Bairo Alto is an old neighbourhood in the centre of Lisbon, with steep streets and filled with small restaurants and bars. It's crowded at evening and night. You can get a very nice dinner for acceptable price in many of the restaurants here, as well as enjoy clubbing in some of the local clubs. Don't be surprise if you are offered "illegal substances" on street corners (so take care if you are visiting Lisbon with teenagers).

Lots to see if you follow Rick Steve's advice.. The church of Sao Roque and its museum are well worth the effort. Stop for a beer or lunch at Cervejaria da Trindade and admire the tilework. View from atop the Elevador da Gloria is great.
worth a visit. lots of small bars and eating places, steep streets and polished cobbles, so fine on a dry day but sloppy when wet
Nice neighbourhood. Bairro Alto is a nice part of town and is well worth visiting. There is plenty to see and do. Lots to eat. There are nicer parts of Lisbon, but this is also good.

Young spirit with Old style . Bairro Alto is a nice spot to go to see the old architecture of Lisbon mixed with a fresh and young atmosphere. There are several snack bars, small restaurants and coffee places. Also you can enjoy the diversity of wine that Portugal can offer visiting "Mercearia do Vinho" - Wine Shop.I definitely enjoyed. It is must go place.

Very Nice Walking Area with Many Restaurants. This is a popular tourist area about 7 blocks from the Cais do Sodre train station. It is uphill but should be manageable for most persons.It is certainly suitable as a walking area and is close to another popular touristy area, Chiado. My wife and I visited in the early evening and we found a very good choice of restaurants, some with fado music. My wife and I both agreed that we want to go back and will be taking visitors there also.

Old city center of Lisbon which you must see. We have spend a couple of nights dining in this very charasmatic area. Great local bars with live music, cocktails and amazing seafood. We will definitely go back here next time we visit Lisbon.
Boem neighborhood. The alternative neighborhood of Lisbon. Many choices for food and night life.You have to walk around the streets to discover the area

Better then Alfama. Bairro Alto is a nicer version of Alfama, close by to Alfama. Lovely streets, great to get lost a bit and feel the city.I especially loved the late night walks, when there aren't any tourists.

Street Pubbing. Lots of bars in this area with people ending up drinking on the streets. not many pubs were playing music though and those that were playing were not big places so they got packed real quick. Good for a night out / pub crawl. There were a few places with live Fado but all were on the expensive side (prefer Alfama to listen to Fado).

Must to be seen. if you are in Lisboa you definately have to go here. I suggest to take the funicolar from avenida de liberdade and have a walk in the barrio, nice restaurants, pubs, view, etc...If you want to have dinner in one of the many restaurants in the area i recommend to book it in advance.
A must see. This street encapsulates the whole feel of this fantastic city and gives you a sense of how the city was built. So much to see and all free of charge !
Nightlife/street art. This area of Lisbon is very lively at night and if your interested in street art id recommended having a wonder around here during the day also. there is also a very lively gay.

Over rated, busy and food average. Didn't think too much of the Barrie alto although we only sent one night there. It was very busy and you had to queue to get in anywhere. The food in the restaurant we got into was decididly average. It's ok to wonder through in the day but nothing really to visit. There are better places to see in Lisbon, this placed does not live up to its marketing.

Best place for fun in Lisbon. Bairro Alto is a cool place for a dinner in a great restaurent (see my critique of the Oficina do Duque) followed by a walk in lively streets or fun in the bars with friends until very late at night.
Great atmosphere . This is a lovely area to explore. Less of a tourist trap than eg Baixa. Great restaurants , bars and views.

Party area Bairro Alto. If you want to have fun and meet people go to Bairro Alto. The streets are packed. The area is interesting during the day too although a lot calmer. If you want to rent a place there, make sure that it is not on a ground or first level unless you don't mind the noise for sleeping.
Central. Fabulous place with lots of bars and restaurants. Within walking distance of local attractions. Very hilly but plenty of tuk tuks & taxis & the famous 28 tram. Fabulous buildings.

Cosy neighbourhood. Would advice to visit this place during the day and the evening. Big difference. When we were here there was a lightfestival projecting on the buildings. Great restaurants to grab lunch or dinner and you can sit near the water.

Fun and traditional. Amazing. Lots of ups and downs little streets called "calçada"
Tons of restaurants, bars, pubs, Fado houses, etc, etc.... in summer very alive and full of tourist until midnight and beyond

Perfect area to stay. We rented an apartment here and it was the perfect launching point for the city. You are close enough to walk into the city center, to the train station, and in the evening, all the best / trendy bars and restaurants were right on your back door.

Best Nightlife Experience Ever. Barrio Alto at night is an absolute must-do while in Lisbon. I had so much fun while going around with a bunch of travelling students exploring through the area at night. The atmosphere is just great, and I loved finding little tiny bars and clubs filled to the brim, spilling out onto the streets with all kinds of people, just having fun. I got to go to a number of different places all in one night, which was just awesome. So many cool small little places that I discovered - don't be afraid to ask some of the locals where the best places to go are. Lots of little places that are sort of hidden and such ended up being some of the coolest bars that I've ever visited - not just in Lisbon, but in general. One of my favorite nights while travelling ever. Highly recommend. This an absolute must-do while in Lisbon.

So much fun!. This is the most fun part of the city to go at night with lots of tiny bars filled with tourists and locals, live music, and really cheap drinks! You can't get a better atmosphere than this arty studenty district that is buzzing until sunrise most nights!

Bars and hearty food. Lovely bars in cozy, narrow streets that sort of get alive after dawn. Beautiful place for party goers and people just wanting to enjoy their drinks and food in brilliant atmosphere.

Discovering Bairro Alto. Bairro Alto is a combination of the most bohemian neighbourhood and, on the other hand, the poor Brazilian local community. It is so charming and colourful and each corner has a different story to tell. Talk to the local people,the are so kind and talkative, so warm. Take the Elevator from Baixa, if you don't find a large queue, and look from the view point the amazing panoramic view of the city (best time of the day to visit it, is the sunset). We stopped at the first restaurant as we exit the Elevator, great food and the best white sangria I've ever tasted. Tip for Vegans: there are vegan organic markets and restaurant at Bairro Alto,it's the place to be!
Loud. Loud and noisy area. If you like to drink and party its fantastic. If you are a couple or like something a bit more roudy then stay clear. It is only a place functioning at night

Where to go at night. Whether to sip a drink after a long day of walk upon Lisbonne's hills, or simply stop by an old joint for a glass of Tintu... or Branco or Mateus... this is the definitive place... All pedestrian area, right in the center, with a total mixed crowd : ages, genre, ethnicity...until late at night....
Exciting nightlife! . Hustle & bustle of Lisbon at night time! Definitely somewhere to experience when in Lisbon. Small streets thronged with groups of people (mostly young) outside bars.

The party area with lots of restaurants. The area has a lot of bars and restaurant ehich make it a great location for Friday and Saturday nights further you're free to take your drinks from bar to bar

Super atmosphere. We spent 5 nights in Lisbon and unfortunately we didn't know about this place on our first night. Hundreds of people out on the streets drinking beers and cocktails, wonderful restaurants with seating outside, live music and just a general holiday atmosphere. We were there until the end every night and we saw nothing in terms of drunken stupidity. Really friendly and safe and great for all ages. Great spot!

Great hike!. Heart of Lisbon! Great restaurants, Fado Music, and of course the night life. I would recommend walking over to Pink Street for a more mature crowd and local crowd. Instead of taking the tram one should try to hike up all those stairs! Great work out!
Ferniculars versus feet. The Ferniculars and old trams attract everybody's attention. They are fun to watch, fun to travel on and graffitied within an inch of their metal frames!!
The heart of Lisboa. Everyone should spend a night there ... to drink beers and caipirinias and sit in alleys!!!I love this area!
Nice.... Worth a visit for the church and park.Be prepared for hills.Quaint windy backstreets give a new complexion to lisbon.
walk it!. lots of stores to eat, shop and see the local flavor....must go up and down to really get a feel of the area.....must do!!

Charming area. We were fortunate to book our apartment in this area: so charming, so lively, packed of great local restaurants on every corner. Perfect spot to feel the Lisbon essence... But be ready to walk up&down all the time, so let's use appropiate footwear.If you come with your car this area is a nightmare. Street parking is quite regulated at daytime, only drop off or neigjbours are allowed. Best option is to find a Parking (there is a big, good and cheap one in Calçada do Combro for 13€/24h) and move around with public transportation.

Lots of people, lots of bars, lots of restaurants and lots of drug dealers.. Bairro Alto is a really happening place. Lots of tourists and locals alike. It's basically several blocks of bars and restaurants. Generally, everyone is packed out on the streets enjoying their drinks and smokes, basically just hanging out. Seems like most people just go into the bars to get their drinks and then head back out onto the streets. Feels kind of like Mardi Gras but on a smaller scale and much less music. No need to tip the bartenders as tipping is not a thing in Portugal but if you're feeling generous, go ahead. Some of the bartenders were quite surprised I had even left them a little extra.People tend to flock to the bars with cheaper drinks. I started off at one bar when mojitos were 6 Euros and a large glass of Super Bock beer was 3 Euros. Only as I walked around Bairro Alto did I realize that other bars were selling cocktails at 2 for 3 Euros with 1 Euro beers. So if you want a cheap drink, prepare to wait, otherwise, head to one of the lesser crowded bars where likely the drinks will cost a little more.It can get really crowded at night. Like shoulder to shoulder crowded so secure your wallets and bags as we all know how pickpocketing is such a rampant crime in Europe. Also, a lot of drug dealers will be going around trying to sell you their wares. They're harmless but the constant touting gets a bit annoying. I was pretty surprised at how open they were about selling. Turns out drugs are illegal in Portugal but it's been decriminalized meaning you'd likely just get slapped with a fine.
Lovely. Old city part, charming streets and charming views. Enjoy these little streets by day and by night. Wear good shoes to feel comfortable !
A place to visit. You will find lots of restaurants and bar. Nearby there is the Bica elevator (must see). For a cheap and traditional good meal go to 109 Barroca street, it´s very good.

Great Area to Stroll. We stayed at a hotel in the area and spent several evenings just walking through the streets. Very quaint cobble stone areas with lots of outdoor eating options. Also very safe. There are many shopping opportunities as well. If you are looking for authentic ceramics and other wares, I highly recommend Arte Rustica on Rua Augusta. Beautiful shop and affordable!
wonderful. i love Bairro Alto.there are many turist there. The streets are typical streets of Portugal...you can find friendly people there.Everything is beautiful there

A trap for tourists. The old atmosphere of the Bairro Alto has been partly lost because of the myriad of touristic restaurants, where Fado singers play during dinners. Very often the quality of food in these restaurants is low.
Avoid them.

Somthing for everyone. We have been wandering the Bairro Alto on and off for over 20 years now (not continually) and although much has changed many of the old bars remain. Namely the bohemian Portas Largas. Always a varied crowd in there. We avoid the fado venues and prefer the Alfama for that

Soul of Lisbon. The whole city has this amazing vibe with it's narrow streets and lots of bars and places for the young people to hang around. Barrio Alto have all of that! It is famous for its nightlife with lots of clubs and bars. But also you can visit it during the day and enjoy the lovely architecture!
Bustling, busy, great central location . First visit to Lisbon with teenagers,more at district, very centrally located, super bars and restaurants, access to all main attractions, would recommend
Food/nightlife . Barrio alto has loads of great restaurants and bars,the prices are good and bars open late!!definitely recommend 😎
The heart of Lisbon. Interesting, full of life, a reflection of Lisbon atmosphere. Many bars and restaurants, nice also for a night out.

Over rated. We were recommended to visit this vibrant area which comes alive at night! Probably because we're older this doesn't appeal! It's a place for youth at night! Restaurants galore, but prices reflect the popularity! The food we ate wasn't exceptional, quite disappointing, however the are gives you a great vista of the city from a different side to Castle St George!Catch the tram from Restaurades it takes you to the top, saves your legs! There are nice shops and plenty of antiques. There are teams dotted around Lisbon which take you to the top.

Old city, buzzing. No way you visit Lisbon and miss Bairro Alto - literally everything is here. Walk around the area checking out old architecture, get a drink outside, try some great traditional bread at surrounding modern bakeries, stay for dinner (and prepare to stand in line until late hours).

Nightlife. great place to browse after dinner. tons of tourists, bars, sidestreet restaurants, and very social. You must go here if you're in Lisbon. however, SOOO MANY COCAINE dealers that's is constantly harassing you to buy cocaine. I feel like they need police in this area (for cocaine trafficking only) but it is safe area to walk around.
Old Town and city centre. Good for a hangout , fine restaurants around . Require atleast half a day for this location and good place for the younger generation

Lovely areas, full of bars and street cafes. Walked to this area from the main street, up a huge hill, but so many lovely bars and street cafes and little shops. Well worth a relaxing wander along the little stone clad streets to enjoy the sights.

Only at night of course.. Cheap beer, lots of people and socialising.
Not fun if you can't handle drinking while moving from bar to bar.
The night dies at 3am but there are still some discos open at the time.

beautiful city. you will feel the taste of local Portugal deeply if you really would like to see real Portugal
Small restaurants are lovely and the real one to go
you hae to be in good shape. beautiful typical place with small narrow Streets, but you have to be in good shape to do the walk. here you can se the old Lissabon, not the commercial side.

Love. Love this neighbourhood. Cool, trendy, scenic everything you want in a neighbourhood. Good restaurants cool shops and a beautiful look out point over the city and Sao Jorge castle. If you are in Lisbon this is an absolute must. If you don't visit you'll be missing out big time. check out taberna da Rua dad Flores for a delicious Portuguese fusion meal. But be prepared to wait for a table.
Night out. This area is famous for all the bars and great place to on a night out, with loads of bars where you can enjoy a nice local beer.

Love this neighborhood. My husband and I spent a lot of nights wandering around this beautiful neighborhood. There are so many pubs and restaurants and cafes. It's a really lively place. Do not miss it!
Did it with a stroller!. Nice little street, lots of sights and good training so you won't be shamed after eating those Natas!!
Top Top Top. Best air open party town in Europe. All types of offers available, since drinks to music, to people. Its the definition for the "All together now". Try it during summer - the best.
A walk up and down cobbled streets. A must see bit of the old city. Weave your way round the cobbled streets, up and down the hills. Don't think this would be good on a rainy day though!

Where it happens. Get the thrill of Lisbon's nightlife and experience great foods, fun people and the best free view of the city ❤️ packed with bars and discos of all types. Enjoy your dinner in the late hours before hitting the bars for wine, cheap beer and strong drinks

Splendor of the Streets. This neighborhood is lively and colorful. It lights up at night with bar-goers spreading out into the streets since the bars are too small. Being from New York, I thought that this would mean roudiness and that I'd feel uneasy. Instead, people were smiling, laughing, and friendly. And the food in the restaurants on these teeny streets was great. Live fado, too! Wonderful.
Nothing to do and dirty. Dirty area. Didn't feel safe. Nothing to do there or see apart from small streets and filthy pavements etc.Food places all shut during the day.

A cobblestone Magaluf?. We visited on a Friday night from reviews saying it was lively and busy. It definitely was that. However, had a bit of a club 18-30's vibe...lots of cheesy music and learing. But definitely busy.

Cute buildings but really reeking day time. This is the party district in town, so if you are into heavy and loud drinking on the street, this is the place for you. For all others, it will be mostly recognised as a reeking part of town with beer, puke, cigarettes butts and other lovely things on the street the following day.

Lisbon's special district. Bairro Alto in my opinion is the district that characterise the most Lisbon ! Its good to walk around its streets but for people with limited mobility... its almost impossible with the big tilt ! Like the most district of central Lisbon, you get an unsafety feeling with the drug dealers around.

Great for resturants . Lots of choice. But choose during the day as you will be hounded at night very good fare available. Nice area to wander about felt safe . Metro station very close and great to explore city and get to airport. But be aware if flying ryanair u need to use airport courtesy bus so add 30 mins to travel time.
Nighttime haven. The area of narrow streets encompasses some great bars and restaurants with the sound of local Fado music easily heard coming from the locals favourites.
Great for drinks . A nice area for drinks and the pubs are cozy and simple, drinks are mostly cheap and the people are welcoming

Over-Priced, Touristy Restaurants. Nice bars, but many of the restaurants serve tourists over-priced, bland food. A nice place to visit once or twice, but it doesn't compare with the drinking and eating centers of many other major European cities.

Buzzy part of town . Bairro alto is a great place to stay in lisbon. Its relatively quiet during the day, but lights up at night especially from Wednesdays to Saturdays. Lots of good little bakerys and restaurants nearby. While here go to SPOT bar to get some excellent live music and Esteves bar for a KILLER well priced shot of vodka + beer for only 1.75 euros! Pavilhao chines is also worth a visit.

Interesting, Eclectice. This is a funky, eclectic part of town, with many bars and restaurants, classically European narrow streets, and hills. We visited at night on a weekend and it was young, loud and rowdy, and some folks were a bit, shall we say, sloppy. If you are in Lisbon, you definitely should visit this area.

Every One Must Experience!!!!!!. This are called Bairro Alto which is known as the knight life in Lisbon for it's bar and restaurants is an experience that must be made.Come visit it between the hours of 22:00 and 04:00 from Friday to Sunday.

Beautiful part of town. . We stayed at the Bairro Alto Hotel. It is a must stay. If you cannot stay here be sure to come to the terrace bar. The view is spectacular. The neighborhood is not touristy and a bunch of wonderful places to eat.
Such a fun Place. Had a great time bar hopping here till the wee hours of the morning with friends. Such an open, fun atmosphere.
Narrow beautiful street. My family took a tram through this area of Lisbon. It was narrated so we were able hear about the architecture and see the pretty views from atop this hill of narrow streets.

Funicular ride. We took the Santa Maria funicular to the top. Gorgeous views of all Lisbon once once you reach the top. Funicular ride is just a few minutes uphill but is fun through the narrow streets for families with kids.
Great vibe at night . We really enjoyed strolling around Bairro Alto, and ate here a few times. Nice bars, and views out over the city. Steep hills, so it can be a bit of a work-out!!

Good neighbourhood. I didn't go to Bairro Alto at night so may be missed the party atmosphere...during the day, it looked like an old town which is not unpolished and touristy...a bit like the lanes of north Kolkata.

Night life. Nice restaurants and bars open until 2 AM. Great place to start the night. Explore about 12 tiny streets that Bairro Alto haves. Muslim arquitecture buildings. A must go place if you visit Lisbon!

Great place for a wander and drinks at night with friends.. Night-time drinking haunt, mainly an outdoor attraction although there are wine bars and other small bars you could sit in and have a drink. Basically a block of small cobbled streets loads of bars, with music. grab a drink at soak up the atmosphere... Similar to Temple bar in Dublin but with much less rain and more attractive people. One downside is all the street vendors trying to sell you junk and drugs..
the heart of the Lisbon nightlife. lots of fantastic little bars and wine places. Great area. Very lively with loyts of people and music. A fab place to be in when in Lisbon.
Step back in time !. This area was so quaint and full of eateries and pubs and nice little shops. Definitely worth making this a stop on your trip to Lisbon.

Fun night out place with lot of energy. Lots of bars and good music. Must place to go and party all night. This is a must go. A lot of energy and fun. The bars are open are open all night and it is better to visit the place post 1 am.

open minded & chick. very busy during the day and early evening, for lunch or shopping or wine. late night it turns into the gay village, and its very open minded , from affordable to expensive as you wish
Whatever you want!. This little "bairro" is great for many many reasons. You can find everything there. You want to listen to a good jazz, fado, rock..... You can find it everywhere.Just amazing!!
Fun and charming!. Delightful strolling in this friendly and interesting neighborhood. And you will get your exercise going up and down those steep streets. Pick your shoes accordingly!!
Was hoping for more!. There are some cafes and shops, but I didn't think there was as much of a vibe to this area as expected!

Incredible night life thriving place!!!. My boyfriend and I love social, drinks, music, dance, just fun scenes lol This was one of our frequents and favorite places ! If you just chill w the crowd, make friends w locals, just enjoy cause Portuguese are sooooo chill. THEY LOVE FUNNNN !

Crazy nightlife and lots of good restaurants and bars!. Lots of action in this part of town in the evenings. Walking area with few vehicles. Very hilly and lots of partying going on in this part of town.

Funky, alternative, edgy and fun.. It's such a quirky area. Gentrification has begun and is rapidly happening. But there are still plenty of streets and alleys that haven't changed in years.Great little coffee/ tea spots. Interesting blends of architecture. Little boutiques with genuinely edgy and alternative goods sprouting up.Had lunch at FlowerPower and loved it. A little bit hipster but isn't trying to be! The salads are excellent. The Bica and Gloria ancient elevators are fun and sort of run every 15 minutes.

Lively and interesting neighbourhood. Bairro Alto is a lovely area of Lisbon where streets are filled with small cute cafes, bars, art shops etc. It is best to visit late in the evening as the street comes alive then. :)

Having fun on the street. In Lisbon, we can enjoy the good weather,and at night there's nothing better than go from bar to bar trough the streets of Bairro Alto. During the day is also interesting with a mix of traditional and older shops and restaurants, with some hipsters hangouts.

Another great place to explore. I enjoyed strolling around the streets of this interesting neighborhood. Not everything you see on a trip to a new city can be nice and perfect - this doesn't bother me. Not all of it is fixed-up and pretty, but that adds to the charm. We went with no expectations, simply to look about and see what was there. It's teeming with life, for which the good people of Portugal have a true zest.
Nightlife in Lisbon. After the typical sightseeing it os Nice to dwell the narrow streets and to be surprised by bars, viewpoints or bars. The is a place for every wish or taste!
Go here for the bars and restaurants. This is a great area for lots of bars and restaurants, there is a huge selection all with their own particular style. This also a great area for street art too.
Trendy section of town. Boutiques and wine bars, perfect section of Lisbon!!!Love this section of town, easy to walk through and very happy to visit here.

Okay- Interesting But a Bit Depressing at Times. Lisbon is a strange city. There is not much to do in the city as a whole We went to Nos Alive an stayed in this area in a real apartment where the real people live.. Many buildings are abandoned and run down. The streets are narrow and dirty. People and kids live in these tiny streets where it is hard to see the sky, It seems wrong to make a tourist attraction out of it.We stayed here for four nights during the festival and I was so glad we could leave. Made me appreciate home! The trams are pretty and so are some of the building but it is not a theme park or tourist attraction.
Vibrant area. A lovely area to explore day or night. There several good restaurants and bars where friends or families can have a nice time.
Bairro Also. Even though it was very hot it was an excellent experience. A bit crowded but of course it is tourist season

Bairro Alto. Perched high above the city, this area is the swinging area of Lisboa. There are so many restaurants, bars, and shops that it is hard to keep track of. Ride the Tram up and walk down. Beautiful place for a Kodak Moment.
Bairro Alto. It's one of the most emblematic neighbourhoods in Lisbon! Interesting atmosphere with loads of places to have a meal or a drink... meet someone and enjoy Lisbon's nightlife!!
Get lost in Bairro Alto. Whether it's food, drink, shopping or music, you'll easily spend hours wondering through these streets

Charming and authentic. To walk the streets of Barrio Alto in Lisbon is to see authentic Spain at its most charming, the narrow, cobble locked streets are both beautiful and dangerous (wear comfortable shoes). To get lost in this city is easy but you are never far from a helpful local who will point you in the right direction, the area is full of little restaraunts and shops that you can spend hours browsing around. Altogether a lovely part of Lisbon to visit

Good atmosphere. Good atmosphere during the nights. You will find tourists but many locals go out at night in the area too. Some nice terraces to sit outside, and some cool bars for indoor partying, about which the Portuguese know a lot. Don't skip it.

Fun, trendy and casual . We stayed in a B&B (Casa Balthazar) on the edge of Barrow Alto area. Great area. Lots of restaurants, shops, and nightlife. Would recommend staying in this area since there's so much to do within walking distance at night.

buzzing and pretty. We stayed just off Bairro Alto, and walked around the area both during the day as well as at night. Being with family I was a little apprehensive at first, but it was a great experience. Always felt very safe, the area is well lit, and there are always people , tourists, walking around. Streets are steep, so be prepared to exercise those legs. My twenty year old children stayed out by themselves till past midnight, and came home without the slightest worry. It was early May, so there were not too many tourists, and the weather was lovely. Lots of great bars around, with historic places too. Recommended.

A nice place during the day, but full of dealers at night. The neighborhood has a nice architecture and is a good place to go during the day. At night it is very crowded with people outside the bars. The music is in general very bad and you are likely to find a lot of drunk people, but also a lot of drug dealers in every corner always asking if you want to buy something. I am very disappointed with this place.
Great streets. This is nice part of town while you see lovely shops and food. The streets come alive in the evening full of bars.

The place to be. We stayed for five nights in Barrio Alto and wouldn't have wanted to be anywhere else. Loads of restaurants, pastry shops and bars around - our fave was Rua de Rosa €15 buffet of authentic Portuguese food, chocolate mousse to die for!The surrounding streets and alleys very picturesque, wee park and plenty to see. Of course, incredible views and plenty transport connections. Down the hill to the Metro, the yellow and red tour busses drives through it also. The viewing platform with the €4 mojitos was our favourite evening spot full of live music and wee stalls.
Went for Stag. Great mix of bars, it's perfect for a good bar crawl, closes at 2pm so have a plan of club to visit afterwards.
Alive at night!. Bairro ALto is one of my favorites to visit. Loads of theme bars comes alive especially at night. must do whilst in Lisbon!
Casa dos canairos. Great local bar,Sergio and his colleagues welcoming and attentive relaxing atmosphere , a little gem within Bairro Alto

Great area in Lisbon. The Barrio Alto area of Lisbon is definitely worth visiting. There's loads to see and most importantly a large number of bars and restaurants to satisfy everyone's taste.Definitely recommended

Nice neighborhood . It is simply amazing walking around and stop in the many "tapas" bars and excellent restaurants! The price are very affordable and the food and atmosphere unique. Only con is thF when I went (late April) really few people was around before midnight! So plan to go quite late if u really want to live the area!

Nice neighborhood, but obnoxious bars. We were looking for somenice bars to have some drinks. Something with a nice atmosphere, nice music, and great character. But all bars here are obnoxious turist based bars. Avoid at all costs unless if you are broke and (max) 20 years old.

Interesting but --------. Had a few interesting nights in this area including getting lost the first night and finding ourselves in some pretty dodgy streets - keep to the main lane ways. Lots of restaurants & bars with food of varying standard, but fun. Beautiful park near the top of the "Gloria" tram with views over Lisbon - visit early evening on your way to dinner

Another "Must Do" in Lisbon. This area is atmospheric night and day but it really comes alive in the evenings. You will hear live music from nightclubs and Fado bars as you walk around the area. Highly recommended!
Fav!. My favourite area in Lisbon! You should visit it during the day but at night too as there are plenty of restaurants and bars ! Loved it !!!

MUST GO. Just walk in the alleys and every building has its own character. Day time its normal but in the evening the place transforms into a Buzzing zone, with eating joints and pubs of various kinds and taste. One can Catch the Famous Tram 28 and reach the mouth of Bairro Alto and walk up. Dont miss the spot where one can a grand view of Lisbon.
Night time . Great area to visit at night. Our if you want to stay where all the action is, this is where you should go. Good views over the city also.

Cool, hip and fun area of Lisbon. This is the area to go if you're looking for late night drinks and music.There's a great stretch of bars on the road leading up Bairro Alto. By day, the bars with the shutters down make the cobbled streets seem calm. But once evening comes, the shutters are up and there is a plethora of bars to choose from, with live music playing in some. You walk past bars and restaurants with their drinks and meal offers and the place is just alive. In Lisbon, you'll spend every night you're there by making a visit for a night cap in this area.
