Wonderful, atmospheric locality with many bars and restaurants. We stayed down the hill in Chiado and it was great to be on the doorstep of this wonderful area - especially as Portugal moved relentlessly towards winning the Euro 2016 football tournament; We watched both the semi-final and final up here in a bar and the atmosphere was a blast, with crowds of happy folks thronging the street, though it never felt overcrowded. Bairro Alto was probably once a working-class area with many narrow streets but it's now become arty, trendy and filled with small bars and eating houses. It's a big enough area to absorb substantial numbers of visitors so rarely feels crowded in the way that Alfama can. A great area to visit, and to eat and drink.
the true face reveals at night. the first time we came by day, we didn't see the big deal of this high neighborhood. The real face reveals when dark, with street restaurants and typical atmosphere.

Trendy. This district is one of the trendiest neighbourhoods of Lisbon. It is a great walk for us. In the small streets we found a great variety of shops, from hip and happening concept stores to romantic Portuguese restaurants.

Must to been here when you are in Lisboa. A walk in this area is a must if you go to Lisboa, special during early evening night / nice bars restaurant a lot of people both local and turist / old and young. TIPS to come up if you are in city go though the Metro station Baxia/Chiado the escalator take you easy up the hill. For free!
Must vue. All Lisbon is a must see,and everywhere you look is something interesting and different.You have to try tram 28,lift,and funiculaires,are 3.
Nightlife. Lisbon nightlife at its best. Nice (and cheap) bars, good restaurants, open air and no cars around...
great walk. Just to see the houses, and to climb down towards the sea on a summer night... It has a very romantic touch...

Daily living in a chameleon of a neighborhood.. You walk around and it's quiet and sober. You'll find incredible restaurants visited by the locals and leave with your stomach bursting with incredible food. Try some of the all you can eat sushi lunches...umm, umm. Have a few beers and you'll think you're in culinary heaven.

Night life. Most of the people are teens
Most of the places are full of young guys
Sometimes strange and not secure
But defenity a place to see

What a terrific neighbourhood. I had been to Lisbon many times before but it was only now that I discovered how beautiful and charming the city is. The best part for me is Bairro Alto, a neighbourhood that changes by the hour. I can't wait to go back.

Favourite place to hang out . Went with my partner and two friends to Lisbon last week. We ended up spending the majority of our spare time between activities hanging out at the various bars and restaurants in Bairro Alto as we loved it so much. This is a beautiful part of the city with a great vibe and some really nice yet reasonably priced places to eat and drink.
Great for Bars . Great at night can just drink in the street very nice area slightly hilly but good views. Get a tuk tuk or tram to experience it better.

great for "in-shape" travellers. yes, we have loved the bairro alto and alfama. it's not very accessible for one with disabilities or for older people. but for young people this maze is really nice. it was one of preferred places in Lisbon
A night in Bairro Alto is a must!. The most vibrant part of the city during the night. Get a drink and do the best bar crawling ever! So fun, so many people, so good prices!

STAG. Great vibe! lovely place to visit and would highly recommend...locals were friendly and we did not have a single issue apart from a coach company we used which I have entered in another review...would suggest reading...company is specialimo

Nice Hilly View. Had fun on this hilly site of the town, touristy especially before and after sunset , good place to walk too and browse for your favorite restaurants, avoid crowds and have a dinner a bit late.

Booze, food, booze, drugs, booze, drugs. Great to place to over indulge in all things good. Don't buy drugs in the street. Although they are decriminalised in Portugal it wouldn't matter as they are all fake. Enjoy the party!!
Hilly. This is an interesting neighborhood to walk through but be forewarned it is incredibly hilly and the stony streets get really slippery when wet.

Post dinner wine. Just perfect for that night cap after a long summer evening.
Great choice of excellent wine, friendly and helpful staff
Great restaurants. Little gem of a place. Lots of lovely restaurants and shops. Best meal ever in a small Italian restaurant hidden down an alley. Explore and you'll be amazed at what you discover!
Hilly alto!. Spent a few nights here, nice old part of town. Ladies, take care on the paths/roads as they are very uneven! Lots of nice independent restaurants and nice little bars.
Fascinating!. I did love this neighborhood! Excellent for walking and talking. Don't forget your camera, cause it's a lot of picturesque environments!

Charming. Great neighborhood for restaurants, Fado performers, Tapas and taking in some city vista views. Pick you restaurant before 8:30 pm to ensure you will get a seat and avoid crowds. Plenty of bars to visit also! Take the tram ride from Avenida Liberdade up to the top or make the steep climb yourself up the hill! You can use your 6.50 Euro per day metro/subway card to use this tram also! Be on the look out for pick pockets. Pleasantly surprised by the amount of police patrols in the area. Fun neighborhood worth a visit or 2!
barrio alto. the original Lisbon , culture and history , the old town area with pedestrian streets leading to the water . nice cafes and shops
Busy, buzzy & fun!. A fun & characterful district, with lots to look at & take in. Lovely to wander through the streets & squares, also very atmospheric in the evenings.

Missed chance. We stayed locally but more towards central Lisbon, managed to visit but only in daylight and ran out of time to return in the evenings due to euro lounge distraction. Steep walk from Rossio station area but worth it for the city views alone.
The best area!. Stay in this area as it is central and a very lively area filled with bars, pubs and restaurants. The inside lanes are also very interesting.
Interesting. Lots of interesting things to see and the shops are very reasonably priced. Nice atmosphere to sit and have a coffee and enjoy the view.

Where it's at!!. Stayed in Bairro Alto for 3 nights. It's a good location if you like nightlife.
The rest of Lisbon is easily accessible from Bairro Alto, however this place has lots of really good places to eat & drink and if you stay in this district you can walk home at the end of the night.

Get Off the Main Streets. Full of incredible architecture and well preserved/maintained/refurbished buildings, Barrio Alto is a delight to explore. There are countless restaurants, cafés and bars, along with shopping opportunities in the form of boutiques as well as numerous museums, churches and parks to explore. One of the best viewpoints overlooking Lisbon is Mirador de Santa Catarina.
You'll like it if you like bar hopping . It's an area well known to it's charm after midnight. For me, it's an experience of having been there during my visit.
Break. This area takes away from Lisbon, it's dear, it's messy, it's like temple bar in Dublin or soho in London, money is their God, not like old historic Lisbon Henry the navigator etc

Great atmosphere . So many great little bars. Love how you can buy a drink and then be on the streets or the main square drinking.
A really great atmosphere and very friendly and welcoming tourists and locals. You don't get any trouble

fun place to hang out. as we walked down this quaint area with many restaurants, bars, and hangout joints, it seemed like the insides of many places were on the streets.
it had upscale Fado performance restaurants, and family joints, and bars for young adults.
we watched on of the Euro Cup matches from the street, as we walked along, at multiple bars and restaurants.

The streets that never sleeps . For especially young people but also elderly folks Bairro Alto is the' place to visit at evening / night time.. at daytime it's deserted but around 6 pm the place wakes up.. street after street with bars and for the elderly folks a Lot of good restaurant's where you can find cosy well places to have a nice meal.. don't try the first you find but give it a chance and you will 100% find the right place For especially young people it's the' place in lisbon... Remember to wait some good shoes cause it goes up and down and you can become very tired in your legs of you explore this place...The prices can go from very cheap and the opposite. .. Very recommended
Average. Again nothing special in fact this was less special than Porto or San Sebastian or many other places we have visited.
Lively Area. We spent a wonderful afternoon and evening walking, shopping, drinking, & eating in this energetic area. We look forward to returning in the future!

Some nice places. The area is nice and has some really good places and winerys. Either than that I felt a bit unsafe and me and my boyfriend got offered both marihuana and cocaine several times! So we didn't want to walk around in the streets too much, and I would be careful with drinking too much!

Great to stroll the area and its many shops/restaurants, etc.. Ride around on the trams (beware of pickpockets) or take a guided tour on one of the trams (safer) and explore the inner city for the best experience of Lisbon.

Great narrow cobbled streets to explore. This area is best at night, the later the better, it is buzzing. Beware of the odd street where you are offered drugs, although a polite decline and they leave you alone. Apart from this the area is full of wine bars and restaurants all of which are very inviting. We sat in the open window of a wine bar and people watched, taking in the atmosphere. Well worth a visit.
Good day and Night. Good to walk around and apreciate the architecture. GOod for hanging out with friends and to drink around!

Fun spills over into the street!!. Bario Alto is a very charming neighborhood in Lisbon. Just a short walk or train ride from Chaido. There are several small restaurants and bars here. We went on a couple of different occasions during our visit and had a great day. We were there on Portugal Day (June 10th) and several restaurants were grilling sardines on the street. The people were very friendly and almost everyone spoke English. We stayed out very late (almost 3 AM) the party was still going and we felt very safe. If you are looking for some great food and lively nightlife, this is the place!!!

Super hilly area of Lisbon. Nice little part of Lisbon with many historic churches and trams to go up a hill with a paranomic view of Lisbon just behind the main obelisk. Streets tend to be on a slightly better condition than the alfama region but still contain the same Barrie lanes and heavy traffic. Not a pleasant place to walk without taking the team or taxi but doable . Would be able to cover the area after 1.1.5 hours just to take on the atmosphere .

Quiet by day, extremely vibrant party area at night. This is a truly fascinating run down shabby-chic part of the city which changes from night to day, by day this is a sleepy place locals and tourists going about there daily life, lots of interesting shopping down Rua do Norte. Made up of narrow streets, just wide enough for a taxi to pass, this bohemian area is full of artists, antique, great designer shops anything that is unusual you will find here. Great views from the top overlooking the city from a viewing park, easy to get back into the main part of the city by jumping on the funicular railway and within minutes you will back down.If looking for a great restaurant, do you homework first and grab a taxi otherwise you will never find it. Well worth severals visits to this extremely vibrant area of the city.

magical.... we went few years back with my sister as her bday surprise and could not choose better place to go...small streets full of character and vintage style mixed with modern touch...this place has it's magic <3 still on top of my list in one of the best cities in europe !!! a must to visit for all travellers!
Another wonderful stroll. Stroll down and go along front - see shops buy cake and coffee and ice cream XX wow nice day to wander and see the people
Wonderful.. Fun area to walk around. Have afternoon lunch and stay around for good night life!!! Up the hill, thus you will get great views of Lisbon below.

The place that never sleeps. We went to Lisbon in June when the city celebrates its patron, Santo Antonio. On Saturday night we were walking around the city looking for the famous parties everybody warned us about...Only when we entered Bairro Alto we understood the Portuguese spirit and what party really means in Lisboa: everywhere around people were dancing, talking, staying in line to buy drinks, sardines, bifana (pork steaks on bread, sauteed with garlic or spices), at each corner there was somebody putting music for the masses, DJ-ing, turning sardines on the grills that made the whole place smell delicious...it was amazing!

Lovely district of Lisbon. Here you find tons of little eateries, bakeries and shops. The streets are narrow and it's a steady walking up and down hill. It has a lot of flair and is great for discovering Lisbon's history and interesting architecture.

amazing place with a good night life. as a reviwer says hub of the young - it is true. a must visit for youngsters. streets filled with pubs, restaurants and everything you'd wish for. a must must visit for all who go to Lisbon.

Hub of the young. Amazing crowd centers around these areas. Tons of cafes and little shops to keep tourists and regulars occupied. The steep street and narrow lanes are a challenge for not only walkers but cars as well! Some unique finds are a treat, so keep a look out. The colourful homes are great for a photographer. Even the occasional rains can't dampen anyone's spirits.

Lots of posh shops and interesting little alleyways. Great place to shop but intermingled with little lanes with bars and restaurants great place to explore and spend some time can miss some of the very steep slopes by taking the lee adores or the elevator built by Eiffel behind Rossi station

Nice to walk through at least once. It is worth taking a walk through the streets of the Bairro at some point while you're in Lisbon. Not as great as the Alfama, but still good. If you take the Elevador da Gloria up, there is a great little park with a fantastic view over the city just to your right and up a few steps from the top of the funicular path.
Best area to stay in Lisbon. We arrived in Lisbon and stayed in a B&B Casa das Janelas Com Vista. Love, love, love this place. The are is very hip, great restaurants, sights and near trains.
A nice neighbourhood. This is a very relaxing area to visit and wander around in. There is much to see and do and enjoy as this is what traveling is about.

The best neighborhood. This is definitely the best neighborhood in Lisbon. I think that locals enjoy it and prefer it while they are out for lunch or dinner. There are unique clubs, pubs and restaurants, making this area to prevail over other spots in the city.
Fun neighborhood full of small surprises. We walked up and took the best elevadoor down to and from this district. Lots of street cafes and high end shopping. Great city views. Worth the climb.

The place to stay in Lisbon. Lots of hills to climb, so prepare well and bring comfy and grippy shoes. The marble inlaid sidewalks get slippery when wet. But the whole area is absolutely magical and atmospheric by day and night. We felt safe even late at night.

Plenty of bars. A nice place to go on a bar tour with friends. you never get bored because there are plenty of bars for different tastes. you can do karaoke, dance salsa or just have a conversation with friends in a cosy bar. you can find drinks for cheap prices
Old Lisbon at it's best. No trip to Lisbon would be complete without visiting Bairro Alto. Small cobbled streets, authentic cafes and exceptional views await you
Great vibe. Wonderful place to hang out and have a beer/wine al fresco. Great vibe in the evenings with locals and visitors alike

Disgusting. What a dump. Don't be duped by the positive reviews. We made the bad decision to make Bairo Alto our home base - what a mistake. It is dirty, dingy and full of drugs, rubbish bags and dangerous looking people. Especially at night, I feared at all times for my safety constantly. Completely not the kind of stay we had envisioned.

Great area for nightlife. We send both of our nights here around this area as we saw in the guide book that it was the best area for nightlife and it was very good. There are lots of bars, cafes, restaurants. It really come alive at night
Fun place to stroll, shop and eat. A fun place to stroll, shop and eat. This area is full of hip bars and restaurants, as well as shops and parks

Place to be for going out. Bairro Alto is the area in Lisbon you would like to turn to when you want to go out. Many terraces, lovely streets, jamful of restaurants and bars. The atmosphere here is great, with the streets being crossed now and then by the famous yellow trams. Can't miss this area and don't forget to take a drink at the Cafe Brasiliera, to my opinion the best terrace in town for spotting tourists and locals alike!

Fantastic location. We stayed in an apartment in Bairro Alto and we were so pleased with our choice of location. We were so close to wonderful bars, restaurants, public transport, unique shops, banks and markets. There were so many things to do and see in this area and it was also well located for other areas in Lisbon. Definitely worth considering when looking for where to stay.

Bars at night, nice by day. By day this place has some nice cafes, but by night it turns into one giant outdoor pub. The actual bars are cramped so everyone takes their drinks outside, making the streets a local hang out spot. The alleys can reduce airflow though so if you're susceptible to cigarette smoke you may want to be careful.
Cozy neighborhood. We stayed at a little loft there and it was totally worth it, it's full of very nice restaurants, bars and shops.

Unique!. I really liked barrio alto, I think it's one of the most beautiful neighborhoods of Lisbon full with character colors and flavors! Better use a taxi to go up then walk your self around and down , walk the whole deal if you are brave enough !
fab location to stay in. great restaurants and bars would recommend staying in this area lots of live music too. Everyone very helpful.

Great area for a buzzing nightlife, but not the real Lisbon. This is definitely a place to come if you enjoy a lively nightlife, but if you're adverse to stag dos, over priced restaurants and drunk tourists, you might want to give this area a wide berth.This place really comes alive around midnight when you can find people lining the streets, chatting and drinking. You'll also find a great many street pedlars touting their various wares with a great mix of locals and tourists alike.Too many restaurants here take advantage of the high foot traffic, charging high prices for cuisine that can be found for better value and higher quality outside of this area. The staff in a number of the bars here also seem to be impatient of the tourists and don't reflect the friendly attitude you'll find everywhere else in Portugal.

Bairro Alto, the high quarter/neighbourhood. You can't go to Lisbon without going to the Bairro Alto, specially at night because a lot of the best restaurants and historical sites like the Church of St. Rocque are situated there, plus there are a number of look-outs called "miradouros" overlooking the city.
The place to be. Friendly and warm place to meet and spend time just wondering around. Amazing shopping for locals and tourists.
Fun nieghborhood. There is so much to see. The important thing is when you go. Go after 8:30pm. That's when people come out of the wood work.

Charming, vivid, colourful. I believe all visitors to Lisbon find themselves at one point walking around this charming lively area. It is full of restaurants and bars, narrow little streets give it a special feel and I absolutely recommend visiting it.
Amazing night life. This is a great place to enjoy the night and for food as well. The party was running very long. The best place for you who seek night life and bars

Cool spot in Lisbon . We spent an afternoon wandering around the backstreets here, very pretty and old. Imagine this was how old Lisbon looked, very charming and quaint. Walked so far through we ended up right down at the TimeOut Market which was a great spot too

What a place!. I was on a stag weekend in Lisbon and a local lad we knew took us to the Barrio Alto on one of the nights we were there. Full of unpretentious bars and restaurants and full of atmosphere. This felt like the real Lisbon and I absolutely loved it as did all my friends. As another reviewer has said, this is a must visit place in Lisbon. Yes, there are a few 'dodgy' types offering various types of 'chemical enhancements' but a polite 'no thanks' mostly did the trick. I suppose that was just another aspect that added to the character of the place and I could imagine it being a pretty 'moody' area before it became a tourist attraction. I and all of my friends loved it and so will you.
soul of lisbon. bairro alto is the mostly visited place in lisbon and you should visit bairro alto on the weekend and it is must visit place in lisbon if you want to enjoy the nightlife.
Streets reminiscent of old Lisbon. This part of the Lisbon is peppered with good restaurants, both expensive and the inexpensive, a must-visit if you are in Lisbon
Walk and chill. Great place to walk and chill with picturesque buildings and monuments and very affordable coffee places where the locals go.
party area. Come here at night if you want to party. They have apparently the most bars per square than any other city in Europe. Most are tiny but very lively and fun
Picturesque area. Very picturesque area on a hill. From here there are wonderful views to the rest of Lisbon. There are many shops .

Interesting authentic but hilly neighborhood!. Lovely decorations for upcoming celebration festooned restaurants and local meeting places. Walking is on steep streets, but if old ladies carrying food stuffs can do it, so can you!

Good place to go to . Went here on holiday. It's a good place to visit. Loads of pubs and clubs to go to and they are at good prices aswell. Everyone is friendly. It's a good site seeing place. Happy to go again

One of the best cities ever to walk. Walking around Lisbon old historical town is just inspiring, the life, the light, the views of many "miradouro" is incredible. For me the best time of year is June, with all the festivities and decorations, music, sardines, lots of fun.

nr 1 of the popular parts of Lisbon. Chiado and ALfama are impressing in their own way, and Bairro Alto is also impressing for being different then the rest.... another atmosphere than other popular areas. different places to go out, shops, musea.....you don't want to miss this area when in Lisbon

If you seek for Lisbon as on postcards, here you go. Tiny picturesque streets with steep climbs from the river Tejo to the top of the hill, historic trams, historic buildings with pretty tiled facades - all of this you will find in Bairro Alto. This neighborhood in the heart of Lisbon used to be somewhat abandoned by locals and run down. Now buildings get a facelift and are converted into luxury property. However, if you seek for the typical Lisbon as on postcards and in travel books, here you go. Bairro Alto is still and will stay picture perfect.
Love love love this neighborhood!. You will love the cobblestone streets, the sweet natas, the incredible food, the views, everything about this neighborhood.

Nice in the evening and at night. During the daytime the area offers ample shopping possibilities. It is crowded, hot during the summer months with many standard chain type shops. Some hidden squares that offer some relief from heat and crowds. However in the evening it all changes. It's cooler, street bands appear from all corners and there is a very pleasant atmosphere to enjoy a drink and listen to dome music.

Buzzing . We are visiting during a festival week and the whole place seems to turn into a giant street party at night. Seems very friendly and safe. The one thing it isn't is quiet. Lots of bars and restaurants. We'll be back
The most charming corner of Lisbon. Old world living among a modern city's many delights. A quiet, sun-drenched trip back to an era gone by.
Cobbled Backstreets of Lisbon. Bairro Alto is just off from the centre of Baxia and offers a range of Cafes & Restaurants as well as Museums & Churches that are worth a visit
Mrs. Everywhere in Bairro Alto it s a party, joy, music and dance,many people good time and happiness,I just live it!

Beautiful perk in sunny Lisbon. Enjoy the neighborhood you can experience the city life. You can see the Elevator, the yellow funicular and many boutique shops around. Our hotel was nearby and it was a great trip on foot. Recommended for every age.

Awesome neighborhood . Super pretty bohemian neighborhood to walk around, full of bars and shops. This neighborhood used to be where all the intellectuals and artists used to live before, and you can somehow feel how they were inspired with all beautiful views.

Great Buzz!. Try not to do this on a Monday night (as we discovered!) as lots of places are closed. But Saturday and Sunday, this place rocks! Lovely cobbled lanes going uphill and downhill, chock-full of bars, restaurants and Tapas places, Fado, Jazz and people spilling into the streets with their drinks. Great vibe!

Beautiful area!. I could spent all day wandering the streets and alleys of Barrio Alto! It is such a gorgeous area full of shops, restaurants, and bars. By night the area awakens with lively music and good drinks.

City life. It's the neighbourhood you can experience the city life. You can see the Elevator, the yellow funicular and many boutique shops around. Our hotel was nearby and I strongly recommend you to stay here if it is your first time in Lisbon.
Lives up to reputation . Quiet by the day lively in night. Visit this place after 10 to be part of the energy and the vibe that goes past midnight

Enjoyable walk. One of the many delights of Lisbon, is to take a stroll up or down the many beautiful streets of this district. It's absolutely breathtaking in its views and also for just looking around or just window shopping.

They call it a lift, but it is a tramway.. The best way to get there is through the elevador da Bica, which is located behind the Mercado da Ribeira. At the top, you get the historic rua do Seculo to the end, you take a rest on a bench in the beautiful Praca do Principe Real, you visit the National natural history museum and the attached Botanical garden. When coming back you may offer yourself a comfortable glass of fine aged porto at the elegant and inexpensive Solar, rua Sao Pedro de Alcantara 45.

Lisbon's funicular - the cable car of the City. This is a steep walk, but for 1.40 euos the cable car brought us up on the hill. A 180 degree view was exposed from the park on to the City and the river. On that Sunday, we found many vendors with typical goods and foods of Portugal. Probably unique are items made from cork, a local product, harvested from the many cork trees in the north. It is also a good place for a lunch stop, where you buy from food stalls and sit at the many park tables and benches. Quite relaxing.

Romantic Vistas Gr8 Dining Options. You'll enjoy the funicular ride to Bairro Alto after strolling the beautiful Ave Liberdade. The contrast of majestic architecture & tree lined paths of the Ave give rise literally to roof top views, fabulous small meals like amazing "A Cevicheria!" But lots more to chose from in either direction from the Plaza at the end of the Funicular ride.

Loved Bairro Alto!. My family of 4 (including two young kids) stayed in Bairro for 4 weeks in May. We loved Bairro! The neighbourhood takes on two different vibes - by day it has a very local vibe and is fairly quiet. By night it comes alive with a lot of tourists and a young local/student crowd. Bairro has a very lively bar scene and the neighbourhood really wakes up in the evening. There are lots of excellent restaurant in Bairro. There is a very nice park nearby called Jardim do Princip Real (including a great kids park). There is very good shopping. We loved having the small local 'frutarias' around (aka corner stores) which seem to have everything that my superstore back home has but in the tiniest of spaces! Many have very fresh produce and the prices are great! The hardest part of staying in Bairro was that you are "alto" which meant that at the end of each day we had to ascend a big hill with kids in tow to get back to our apartment. The upside of this is you get the great views from the nearby miradouro (lookout)! Subway access also is not available in Bairro, you will need to walk down the hill about 10-15 minutes walk to get to the nearest station. Of course, tuktuk, tram and taxi access is also available for those who choose not to walk to their destination.We did not want to leave Bairro Alto - absolutely loved it!

Nice walk and views. With my girlfriend we went around the Bairro Alto for a few hours, enjoying nice little corners, great views over the city, lovely spots, and the good food and coffees that numerous places offer over there. It's certainly worth a visit if you are in Lisbon for a few days!

It's interesting. . My hotel is on top of avenue da liberdade. So instead of taking the Metro and then an elevator we took a cab to the Miradouro which is in barrio alto which costs just around 7 euro. This is the best way to start to see barrio alto and a way to Chiado. And if you start here you walk down to Chiado which is easier than starting from Chiado to barrio alto. There is not much here but it's interesting to walk through and see the apartments and the cobble stone narrow streets. So cool. You walk down to get to Chiado which had great shopping and great outdoor restaurants. It's pretty cool.
Busy nightlife . We had an excellent night out in this area. Many little streets with lots of bars. All age groups will enjoy the many variety of bars.
Great place to eat and drink!. Bairro Alto is a great place to eat and drink! The night life is amazing and the party doesn't stop until 2-3am. The taxi is cheap-

A place to absolute see/experience. As part of a group tour we visited a restaurant in the Barrio Alto featuring Fado- a bluesy, melancholic folk music for which Lisbon is famous, traditionally sung by a woman accompanied by two guitarists. Barrio Alto would definitely be the 'happening place' with tiny side walks, many bars ( the Fado restaurant was across the alley from an Iriah pub. Vital fun place full of many young and olders just having a fun evening with a gorgeous view.

Love hotel is a must. There's a place in Bairro Alto that's called the Love Hotel (or something like that.) It was an old brothel and now it's a cool bar. I was there twice, during the day and at night. Both times it provided a different vibe that were equally cool. The interior design is spectacular and the drinks are on point. They do have different prices for the drinks depending on if it's night or day, which is a little ridiculous, but what can you do, right?Try the corpse reviver, it's to die for.

Start your night here. Barrio Alto is where many of the bars are located, and where most people will start a night out before heading downhill (quite literally) to the area by the river where most of the clubs are. Barrio Alto is definitely a great place to take in Fado as well, argubably probably the best neighborhood for Fado. Add this to your list!

A jewel in the city of Lisbon. Hote Bairro Alto was absolutely gorgeous. The hotel was very lavish yet homey and the rooms were large. Location was the best. We stayed there for four nights in May, 2016 and found that time of year was the best time to visit Lisbon. The weather was warm and sunny and no crowds. What I liked best about this hotel was the staff, the fabulous buffet breakfast and the hotel itself. There was nothing about this hotel that I didn't like.
fun area of Lisbon. Noisy at night, quiet all morning, family area during the day! cobbled streets and great restaurants!
On discovery in the alleyways. After every turn you discover interesting small shops or taverns. There is always something special, it's art's or good food.

the neighbourhood for Fado and bars. With Alfama, this is the neighbourhood that has kept the most authenticity and character. the perfect destination for those looking for a dinner with Fado singers or simply stroll the cobblestoned streets and hop from bar to bar for a brilliant night out.

Busy, popular area comes alive at night. You must visit Bairro Alto if you visit LisbonQuaint old town area of Lisbon with little streetsGood to wander around and rake in the atmosphere. Walk there or catch a tram.Lots of little bars and restaurants. Comes alive at night and is a very popular area. Restaurants get very busy so advisable to book in advance if you want to eat at night.
Best location to stay. Very nice location to stay. If you re aiming to a hostel, the Stay Inn Hostel is a very good one just one block away from the centre.

Great place. This was real fun part of town to visit. There are many streets that are blocked off to traffic and so there are only for walking. It is a lot of fun and a lot of great restaurants to visit. We were not there at night but it is clear that at night this turns into a real party destination, and so if you're a family you may not want to come later in the evening.

A great place to walk around. This is a great area to walk around to experience what life is like in Lisbon. Take it slowly as there are hills to walk up, although you can take a tram or bus to ease the effort!

Pretty narrow streets in a lively area. This area comes to live after sunset, making for a good night out and meeting new people. It is full of quirky bars and little shops and it is very charming. A bit dark during a cloudy day as the streets are narrow but still lovely.

Visit at night. Very interesting place to visit at night, we just walked and good hear fado from restaurants. A lot of places have fado at night around 8:30 starting time, do your research first before restaurant selection for fado.

Barrio Alto area. This was exciting place to eat the walk around and party. Loved the area and the people. People in Lisbon party late. But this area is a little earlier I would guess till around 3 then people go to clubs. You can just walk the differnt streets and bar hope drink and just gave a good time. Loved it.
Fascinating streets, bars shops and eateries. A great way to while-away a day in Lisbon. Plenty to see from great views across the estuary, steep streets, trams plenty of shopping and eating.
The place. If you want to go outside to drink, to eat, to views and music - Bairro Alto its mandatory. In my opinion not good for kids at night.

A bit of Lisboa's heart. Bairro Alto is one of the most typical neighborhoods from Lisboa (it is also very old as many parts have survived to the 1755 massive earthquake). During the day it is actually a quiet place with mini markets, small shops, galleries and "cafés" and during the night it gets transformed into an important night scene with a lot of different bars.

Spend time hre. Start at the park and soak up the atmosphere. See the rooftops of Lisbon and the gardens below. See the trams trundle up and down the steep hills. Take a ride also. Visit the shops, cafes and church all close by.

Put your walking shoes on. Get ready to walk. Combinations of steep and narrow streets lead you through a very diverse set of buildings, shops, stores and restaurants. As always, take your time and dawdle in the many shops and chat with the owners.

Fun neighborhood. Bairro Alto is a fun place to walk - be sure to go to the lively Miraduoro de Sao Pedro de Alcantara for panoramic city views. The historic Gloria Elevator is adjacent to the park, a unique way to descend to Praca Restauradores!

A fun night life area. It's a fun, happening place at night where people go to a lot of different interesting bars, get cheap drinks, and wander around socializing and drinking in the street. Just ignore the guys trying to sell you fake drugs.
Beautiful neighborhood. Typical and pretty neighborhood. If you are looking for a place to stop for some drinks, go to the Park Bar.
Really Nice. Really nice place in Lisbon with great pubs! There are so many people in the streets going in and out from the pubs! It's very nice to chat with friends and walk in the hit nights.

Portuguese culture at its best!. If you want to get involde in the Portuguese Culture this is the place for you. The restaurant at night come alive with the FADO which is a tradition Portuguese music.

Authentic area of Lisbon. We stayed in this area and loved it. A little bit like travelling back in time. Lots of lovely local bars and restaurants. We also felt very safe wondering around the narrow streets at night. Don't let the graffiti out you off - in Lisbon it is all about artistic expression!
PARTY!!!. Drinks drinks drinks everywhere. Buy beer for one Euro and the other store next door is even cheaper. This old part of the city is very popular by young people.
The Bohemia of Lisbon. Lovely area with lots of quirky little eateries and shops. Least of all the awesome BA Wine Bar is in this area. Most definitely worth a visit

District worth a visit!. One of the lovely areas of Lisbon, narrow, cobbled street, trams, lovely little local restaurants and lovely buildings. Close are 2 of the famous Tea shops - where there is always lots of activity.
the high neighbourhood. the best location to be in! lovely cobblestoned paths.....live music, wine and dinner.....small mini markets closeby and Rua das Gaveas the best place to stay!

The nights begin around 10pm and continue late. Quiet by day the old town comes alive at night. The only negative is the hard drug sellers who openly tout their wares early evening. The bars are packed from 11pm onwards and people wander from bar to bar carrying their drinks in plastic glasses

Best in the evening. Bairro Alto is most beautiful when it gets dark. Then you can really see the beauty of the small streets and stairs lit by street lights. Restaurants (hip, traditional, small, big), small cozy prazas, viewpoints. Worth spending a few hours.
Visit for some great views of Lisbon!. There is a great park at the top of Barrio Alto which offers excellent views of Lisbon. Take a hike up from the base of Rossio Square.
fun vibrant historic neighborhood. i loved walking around this historic atmospheric neighborhood. i liked looking at the churches and houses covered in beautiful tiles.

This is the place to go, with amazing views. Stunning areas, old but character full buildings, and more of the feel of an old city full of history, and indeed art. Turn of the squares to go to here and live a different experience of the city. Cautious with taking items with you, money dress down a little and lessen valuables visible on you.
So pretty!. Great views and many wonderful shops and cafes. Don't miss it. It was one of my favorite spots in Lisbon.

Worth a visit. A good place for restaurants just to relax and enjoy the ambience. Near the Chiado. Enjoy the tram, a must when visiting.
Wear comfortable footwear as there are a lot of hills.

nice after hours mingle. we went here the first night we landed in Lisbon,such a cute area, from the main road where the taxi left us was much ore tourist pruned bars but 3-4 streets inwards are where you find those authentic Portuguese bars and small clubs, it was well worth it, unlikely for a holiday destination to close at 2am but if you get there like 23hrs then you can enjoy yourself quite a bit, and if you are feeling nostalgic after that, they recommended the #Jamaican Bar, there played only 70´& 80´s music..

Beautiful area of the city. We walked around here for a few hours; there is a lovely view point up the hill at the top of one of the vernaculars where you can city, all the way to the castle and around. The food market here was excellent, lots of nice port and food, and nice gifts for home :)
Very nice quarter. We liked this quarter most as it is newer with nice shops, restaurants and cafes. Much better than Alfama.

Gorgeous Area. This is a wonderful area to go on a stroll and take in the beautiful scenery of Lisbon. There are lots of little outdoor bars to stop at and have a drink, and lots of lovely sights to see.

Mad party place. Visited 1 night for a few sociable ones, a great mix of drinking establishments from Irish bars to local bars, many with live music.1 thing to be aware off, I was offerred cocaine 3 times before I even made the first bar so I'm guessing the drug culture is rife in this area but it didn't spoil a fun night

Heart of Fado in Lisbon. The Fado soul is here! In this old part of the city, there are situated a lot of world well known Fado houses. No any hearing of HiFi system can even be closed to experience of one Fado night!
Nice walk around, nice shops. After a night in the Baixa it's nice to walk up to the Bairro Alto and Chiado for nice restaurants and book shops.
Nice area. Great place for a stroll and to do some shopping.Lots of interesting things to see and places to stop and have a drink and people watch

A big difference at daytime & nighttime. This area is @ daytime really quit and nice to walk trough. Nice buildings, nice architecture, everywhere the old tiling on the walls and people that are hanging there clothes to dry. Cool to see and you can make amazing pictures here. You can take a little lift from the top as well. We thought it was a nice thing to do. At night time this is the place where the magic happens. This is the place to be. There are a lot of bars/pubs. A lot of people from other countries, so you meet a lot of new people.
Lovely Area. Excellent area to stay at. The hostel I've stayed in was in this area. Near sightseeins points, bars, restaurants and lots of shops. Enchanting little streets. Definately going back!

SO MUCH FUN. Everywhere in the Barrio Alto is a great time. I literally wish I was able to spend more nights here but the couple that I did spend were unforgettable. The streets are full of food, bars and fun. It's a must experience part of Lisbon.
The old Lisbon. It is a particular quarter of Lisbon, on the seven hills, its 'labyrinthical' narrow streets, and its orthogonal blocks, full of bars, specially during the weekend.

San Francisco's Nothing Compared to This. The seven hills of Lisbon are really steep with narrow streets up or down at every turn. Lots of life, lots of shops and lots of people. The ups and downs of San Francisco are nothing compared to this!

Interesting area. If you are having problems with your hips or knees or recovering from any of the above surgeries, this is not the place for you to go.!!!! However, it is a truely wonderful place to walk if you take it slowly. Interesting alleyways and bars and cafes. We got an appartment through Air B&B and it was fantastic. Had a lift to get up to the flat at the top of the building. Make sure there is a lift at your accomodation if you stay in this area. If you have to walk up the the steep hill to your appartment you don't want to have to carry your bags up the impossible narrow staircases.
Lovely area. This is a lovely area and, so far, my favourite area in Lisbon. It feels somewhat away from the main tourist hustle and bustle.

Tourist trap. Very tourist-minded part of town. Many very commercial and non-authentic bars. If you are a student looking to party, this might be your place to go. If you're looking to experience the authentic Lisbon, don't even bother.Do go to Miradouro de Sao Pedro though. Very nice small park with a great panoramic view!
Fantastic to go out. Fantastic to go out and hv a beer. You will enjoy the movida of the streets and the pubs in general.
A small street. Bairo alto a small street of arround 10 pubs with no activity during working days i heard that it is better during week end
THE Restaurant/bar area of the city. This area has great arty/foody vibe! You can just get lost in the streets walking up and down and exploring the shops and restaurants.
cute in the morning and at night. great little shops and snacks in the day and lovely at night. a must see when in Lisbon . Came here a few times and was great always

Quirky district . Well worth a visit around these cobbled streets to see all the off beat shops, bars and restaurants. Great wine bars and interesting graffiti adorn the wallsIf you are looking for something a little different it's a great area

Bars, bars, bars. Even on weekdays this area is busy with people out drinking and partying but at the weekend it gets crazy.
So many places to check out from tiny dive bars to big modern places. Just wander round and see what takes your fancy. It's loud and chaotic but fun and friendly.
Party Time. If you want Lisbon nightlife in a maze of cobble-stone streets with quaint small bars and a fun energy then this is the place for you!

Great place to saty. Take Tram 28 and choose to stay at House Sao Bento. A great area, a great House where you get a good sized room with private bathroom if you choose the suite, and a shared kitchen with some supplies provided. Close to a good selection of restaurants within waking distance or by the tram.

Good choice is you are under 30. Good bars! Drunk people everywhere...
If you are looking for a bit of "crazy" this is the place to be... (Great place if you are in your 20's)

Where you go to drink!. Bars bars bars as far as the eye can see.
This is where you go to party!
You can get pretty much get anything you want drink wise, beers, wines, cocktails.
Busy seasons you tent to buy a drink and move outside and by the time you're ready for another, you are already at some other establishment.
Bairro Alto for the good times. Nice area to have a drink at night. Lisbon nights are quite easy going and calm. The cocktails are affordable. Bairro Alto is the address to have a good time.

Definitely visit or dine here, possibly stay here. This neighborhood is funky and interesting but quite touristy. Very hilly like all of Lisbon. There are loads of restaurants and bars - far more than they need to service the demand, so you'll find good deals and lots of people asking you to look at their menu. Practically all the restaurants have the same standard Portuguese menu of meat-and-french-fries or bacalao, which is very fishy-tasting cod. Many people comment that it's too loud to sleep at night but we did not find this to be a problem at all and my bedroom was directly on the street. There's a really nice viewpoint on Rua de Santa Catarina that most tourists never find. It's a great spot to sip a cheap beer in the afternoon.

Wonderful to explore during thur/fri/sat nights. So great to walk around here when it's at its peak with people. The place comes alive and little bars and restaurants are heaving with people. Thoroughly recommend exploring this part of town in the evening.

A nice area for shopping and walking around. This area, in the downtown and not far from the big plaza, is one of the nicer areas to walk around. You can do some shopping, and from a few places you get an excellent view of the rooftops and the downtown area.

Not of interest to young children. Hiked through Bairro Alto from the train station with three children10 - 5. It was a long wet walk in the rain and I was amazed they kept their humor with the steep route. There were loads of shops - the area is known for its tiles, antiques, and interior design shops in the day and a sophisticated/chic/bohemian night culture. At the top we stopped at Miradouro de San Pedro de Alcantara which gave a rather impressive view. The Natural History Museum can also be found in this area. Overall, it was pretty and we had a nice view, but I would say had little of interest for children and for us it was more a route to another destination than a place to hang out or shop. I won't drag the kids up the hill again and would not recommend it as a walk for young children.
Enjoyable Stroll. We started at the top of Barrio Alto and walked down. Shops and restaurants are everywhere. We had a good time window shopping and enjoying the neighborhood.

A great night out!. If you a re looking for great bars and restaurants, a night strolling around the streets, trying different places, this is the neighborhood to be! Lisbon night comes to live here. It can get really crowded though so be prepared for the noise, cause here everyone drinks out on the streets. Chat on the streets. Laughs on the streets. Its like a big open bar :) not the place you want to be if you want to sleep at night though, local experience :) well i did lived here and got used to it but if you are here for just some days it might be something to consider. Now really, my favorite part of the day here is really late afternoon. The light hits the street in a different way, the esplanades come to live, you can feel the neighborhood waking up as the others start to calm down. And its the perfect timing to discover the great shops around here!! If you walk through rua do loreto, look for Adamastor, a great viewpoint to the river with esplanades and an incredible chill out mood to it! The best disco in town is a bit down bellow, Incognito bar. Great place!
Feels very trendy. We felt like we were in the centre of the universe! This place is hopping with street entertainment, restaurants, music. So much life! Wonderful place
Great/lots of restaurants/ nightlife/ bars . Great place to grab a drink, lots of beautiful people, restaurants and bars. Nice view of the city and good transport....

Special place. Wandering around this portion of "Old" Lisbon is very attractiva and appealing mainly to those who are oprn to new places, simple yet sophisticated streets and cafes.Please note that walking through this part of town to the ocean is the easy part of the alk. Going back is an uphill walk and for some it may be not that eay.In any case, do not miss it!!!
Nice place. Food, fados, bars, coffee. If you are an outgoing animal (of the party tribe) the Bairo Alto is the place to be.

Amazing. This place is amazing Already missed it. With so many bars and so much going on, you find everything here, during the day is a neighbourhood full of small shops, during the night looks like is transformed in a neighbourhood that doesn't sleep full of bars around and music for all the tastes. Great place to repeat every time I go to Portugal.
Nice place. Narrow streets and a lot of bars, durring the evening and night people getting frendlier. But never agresive the atmosfare stays frendly.

Crazy Sunday Madness . A rollover from the night before.Bars galoreGood atmosphere Don't wear heelsVery few chavsAll nationalities ...melting pot Some live music venues All sorts of peopleLively with a good vibe Wouldn't eat down here There's a roof top bar somewhere Great place for drunken antics

Food and Fado!. During the day, this is a place where you will see locals going about their business as well as tourists looking out of curiosity.At night, this area comes alive with restaurants expanding out onto the streets in front with tables and the aroma of food and the distinct sound of Fado music emanating through the narrow streets. Any restaurant is a good choice as long as they offer Fado, because that's the real joy of the experience. Not to undercut the food, you must try the green soup (Caldo verde) which is much more delicious than it looks. If you have enough wine, you will find yourself trying to join in with the locals as everyone is encouraged to sing the local Fado traditional songs that every local resident seems to know.

Not crazy about it still very nice!. It's up on the hill from avenide libertade. We took the tram bus to bring us up the hill from Avenide Libertade, there are shops and lots of restaurants and cafes. Lots of homeless people around asking for money (in Lisbon) and be aware of many men walking close to you and offering all type of drugs while you are walking around. Some streets seemed dirty and seedy other streets were good,we stayed where the stores, cafes and restaurants were.
Good central point. Beautiful. Views and lovely little bars and restaurants .Some typical traditional music venues .Fado music .Plenty of hotels nearby .Good. Prices .

A WONDERFUL FIND!. Barrio Alto was a really first-class hotel to stay. Everyone is so pleasant, polite and helpful and cater for all your needs. Location is superb for all restaurants, bars and shops and is so convenient for the metro and trams conveniently situated a short distance from the front door. Thoroughly recommend using them both. Very economical and a great way of discovering different parts of Lisbon

Great area, stylish and eclectic mix . Lots of live music and bars for all tastes. Accessible by tram and on foot. Comes alive at night. Safe and friendly neighbourhoods. We walked around a lot in the early hours and there are lots of tourists, music and a good vibe.
Walk around. Take it in . Lovely part of Lisbon to take a walk around. The streets are clean and there are lots of shops and restaurants for when you need a break.
Best spot for evening. Barrio alto is probably best place in Lisbon to go for evening drink. Loads of wine and tapas bars with great selection of drinks.

Wining, dining and Fado!. Bairro Alto is an area in which restaurants and bars are very concentrated in every little nook and cranny. On weekend nights, the area is swarming with people. Here, you find traditional portuguese dining, cocktails, jazz bars, wine bars etc., and many places offer Fado as well. Don't be surprised to be offered drugs on the street, however, a firm no is respected. Leave the stillettos at home, all streets are cobble stones and very steep.
Buzzing at night. Great place to stay as we in city centre and close to trams train station good pubs and restaurants def recommend

Craziness after dark. Besides being another beautifully authentic part of Lisbon, this is also where one goes out at night and party in the streets. The nightlife most of us are not used to takes place in the streets and is utterly great. Cheap drinks and tons of places to go.
Lovely little streets, beautiful views. A great area well worth a visit, lots of shops, cafes and restaurants. close to the tower. Easy access to all areas including a short walk to the sea.

The life and heart of Lisbon. What the East Village is to NYC, Barrio Alto is to Lisbon. It's where counterculture begins. Where vibrancy lives. It is where one goes to enjoy life. It is where the heart of Lisbon beats brightly. Bars, clubs, shops, restaurants are all hidden in the grids of tiny streets located in this hilltop neighborhood. So if you want to experience the true Lisbon be sure to head to Barrio Alto.

We were in the Bairro every night. Every night we just wandered around and found two great restaurants, and one mediocre but friendly one... by hit or miss. The last night we happened upon a fantastic old mansion converted into a shopping co-op, Embaixada at edge of Bairro Alto. There we discovered a bar for aficionadoes of alcohol... called "Gin Lovers" where a young mixologist, who concocted a drink with artistry and drama; he even toasted rosemary as a garnish. It is right next to the University of Lisbon Botanical Garden on Praça do Principe Real 26.
Nightlife . Great place for hanging out see lots of people eat, drink .. Feel happy The only thing is - come by taxi !! So no problem with parking or drinking

In a world of its own. Like the other old parts of Lisbon, its like walking around in a time gone by.Lots of narrow streets with cafes, shops, bars and restaurants.And like the rest of old Lisbon it casts it spell on you
Best bars and music! . Fun! Good music & cheap drinks! Small Streets and lot of interesting People from all over The world. still not a place to eat best food

Bohemian Lisbon. Small cobbled streets in Lisbon. One of my most beloved districts,shows the history of its past as the center of the city's intellectual life.The famous tram,number 12 is worth a ride,pop over to Baixa,squares with coffee shops.
Mandatory!. If you're going to Lisbon, you should go to Bairro Alto, amazing streets and shops, besides having a knowing a typical portuguese village.

Fasntastic and beautiful place to get lost. Feels like you are walking in a film set. Very relaxing area with lots of places to eat and drink. great for photos and to have a peek into the lives of the locals (well, their houses and living rooms as they walk in and out of their houses).

Engrossing and lovely.... But wear stout shoes!. Fascinating old Lisbon, winding, narrow cobbled streets, quite steep, so exhausting to explore, but there is so much to see and do. Quaint bars, restaurants, shops, lovely churches & castles.... And if you get too tired, there are always the ubiquitous tuk-tuks offering tours or quick transports around the old city. Recommended.

late late night!. Left for dinner at about 9PM to find these streets kind of empty. I thought it was odd... but hey. I was hungry and went. AFter dinner, walking around, at about 1AM, this place was amazing! All the bars were packed, people walking around... great place to go and jump around between bars (no entrance fees), just be sure you go late late night.

Definitely worth visiting!. Would definitely recommend visiting the Bairro Alto district - it has some lovely buildings and old cobbled streets - lots of little restaurants to visit (during the day especially). And by night there's the opportunity to get involved in pub crawls and immerse yourself in the Portuguese Fado genre of music
Amazing views! Love those little trams!. It's a great way to get to know Lisbon and it's Bairro Alto. I usually take the tram up, then enjoy all the amazing views, and walk back down.

Center of the life with lots of cafes;bars and restaurants. In the narrow streets of Barrio Alto; you can find lotz of stores; restaurants and bars. Most of them are very well designed. Dont miss the life of entertainment.

Lots of nice bars. Went out for drinks here several times during our holiday. Lots of lovely little bars (I would love to right individual reviews but I can't remember the names). Reasonably priced drinks. Only negative is that there are many street sellers in the area trying to get you to buy bracelets etc which is a little intimidating at times. Otherwise we enjoyed the place

Barrio Alto - where to be. wonderful place...so much to see and do....stayed at wonderful Bairro Alto Hotel...met owner of Let's Rock Cafe...lively atmosphere w/foks relaxing in square and experiencing the nice cafe's...have fun!!!
Fun Atmosphere . This area was great fun. Everyone is in for a good night, street is jammed and the vibes are all about positive times. Always busy at nights.

A must see when visiting Lisbon!. By far the most picturesque part of Lisbon, with it's beautiful cobbled streets, the views of the bridge and sea, the famous trams that make getting about so easy and let's not forget host to some of the best rooftop bars in Europe. One not to be missed is the Santo Antonio festival in the early summer. A definite first stop when heading to Lisbon!

Try to visit during the day. It’s not just party and booze.. It’s known for it’s night life, but it’s lot more than that. During the day Bairro Alto has the carisma of old Lisbon combined with the new generation of families and young people who’ve chosen to move into the neighbourhood. The community is reborn and there are a lot of good restaurants and shops filled with nice people who will always make you feel welcome. I live in Lisbon for 13 years and this is my favourite place for a walk, take pictures, have dinner with friends and a drink.

Not only for very fit people - feasible by foot for "normal" people too. Although I have read a lot about this Bairro Alto district that it is very demanding to discover by foot; but indeed it is far not that tiring to walk by foot if you choose your route carefully however it is not effortless, of course. The neighborhood is a must to visit, but as other old towns it is also a bit ruined and some streets are not that much welcoming or d not offer very much. Anyway, on the top of the hill, around placa reial you can find some very cheap coffees or eating places, e.g. at the end of Rua de Rosa, and also nice panorama a bit further away.

The 'High' Neighbourhood. Take Gloria to the top - it's steep to walk. It's lovely when you get there a lively neighbourhood, a small market, live music and many people relaxing. Great little bars and restaurants too!

Historic Neighborhood and the center Lisbon's Nightlife. Bairro Alto is a neighborhood of Lisbon that you must visit. It full of restaurants, bars and cafes. It gets really alive at night, with tourist and locals hang out on rhe sidewalk. Lots of bars sells super cheap beer. Lots of other stuff to see besides the bars. The vibe is so relaxed and cool.
FABulous views. This is a lovely place to visit the views are breathtaking there are plenty of eating places and on the whole it is a lively vibrant place

Wear comfortable shoes.... ...and walk, if you can, rather than taking a tram. Lots of little nooks and streets you can follow, to discover the hidden restaurants and tiny little stores where the locals go. Bring a map.
Charming. This is a charming neighborhood with little streets and lots of things to see. I recommend a visit with a guide followed by wandering around on your own the days after if you have the time

Having fun and good foods in Barrio Alto. Barrio Alto is a very special and different place in Lisbon. in order to get there you have to go stairs up, or using the differents elevator. Try to get the 7 Colinas daily card, for $6 dollars and you can move so well in Lisbon using all the differents transport. It is better than the Zapping, because for example, if you use the Gloria elevator to get to Barrio Alto, it is $3.60 each way, you are being deducted that amount of money from your zapping card, if you use the daily pass, you for $ 6.00 you can use the elevators, metro, buses, etc and it is very easy and convinient.
Characterful. This is a genuinely beautiful and characterful corner of the capital. Trams, steep narrow streets, brightly coloured buildings and the sun... what's not to like?
See It At Night. A warren of little streets that comes alive at night when people spill out from the bars and restaurants to drink and chat. Buzzing with atmosphere.
A food adventure and cultural adventure.... Fado, fado, and more fado.... a traditional Portuguese style of folk music that predominates the old town.... and 1,000 ways to cook cod.

A very good hotel in old part of town.. We stayed 3 nights in this comfortable well placed hotel. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Rooms very comfortable and quiet - particularly given its position. Would stay there again.
Night time it comes alive. Go here at night for great Fado music in lively bars; we wandered through the streets and loved the atmosphere.

Must See. Just like the Plaka in Athens this whole area of traditional narrow, cobbled streets is full of bars and restaurants, and very busy. Many have traditional Fado singers (great if you like Leonard Cohen) but a little plaintive for my liking, although very Portuguese. Highly recommended, if you haven't seen Bairro Alto then you've missed one of the best bits of Lisbon.

Historic neighbourhood. Bairro Alto is a neighborhood of Lisbon you cannot miss. It is an astonishing area of the city, quirky and bohemian. In terms of its place in time, stepping into its sonorous but bewildering mazes of endlessly winding streets, we are incomprehensibly thrown into a realisation that we are suddenly deposited at a place somewhere not quite detached from the medieval times.In Bairro Alto you can find the strange admixture of experiences as far as sights and pleasurable little journeys are concerned: the old and the trendy, the ancient and the upcoming, an abbey, old churches, fantastic restaurants, smoky local taverns, fado houses, the botanical gardens, a university, limitless cafes, tiny fruit stands, beautiful open parks, old bookstores and much more.

Food-lovers' delight. The narrow lanes are no deterrent to lovers of local, European, Oriental and other cuisines that the area dishes out to you. Easily accessible from Avenue de Liberdade on foot, tram and taxis, the heights of this hill are a treat you cannot deprive your tastebuds on a trip to Lisbon.

One of the "don't miss" areas. We followed the Rick Steves walking tour starting with the funicular. The church is beautiful. Please read about the Vatican chapel. Stopped at the Port Wine foundation and toured the convent ruins. Then back down through the department store.

Well worth a visit!. We took the return Gloria Tram to the top of this very picturesque area.It's got some great views over the city, towards the river and the castle, is very bustling and buzzy and is well worth the visit.There's lots of cafes and shops and restaurants and it's a very popular district of Lisbon.

Night life paradise. This is not the typical bar/nightlife quarter. It's nothing you can imagine. Portuguese people are super friendly and they are turned to each other. Having that in mind it will be easier to realize why is all their nightlife happening on the streets of Bairro Alto instead in the bars there. The bars are really small so they just buy the drink inside an step outside to sing and talk to each other. From midnight till 02.30 or 03 am the streets of Bairro Alto are crowded with people so much you can barely walk. The best days for visiting are Thursday, Friday and Saturday. But other days are fine also.Most of the bars are super cheap, We drank cocktails of 0.8L which are really good for only 6 euros. Here you can find bars that sell beers for only 1 euro. I can't remember all the bars we visited because we visited maybe 7 but I can remember the great atmosphere and the energy.
Take Gloria to the top. Went up to the top on Gloria the vehicular tram. Beautiful view at the top and plenty of restaurants to choose from.
Perfect location. Perfect location. I stayed here and it's centrally located to mainly all attractions and nice places in lisbon. Also, it has a very vivid and safe nightlife
Simply brilliant. Lots to see and do, with links via Metro to other parts of Lisbon.Must see for those who love their old-town architecture mixed with modern vistas
Wander around for ages. Great to just stroll around. Go at different times and you'll find different things going on. You'll need some comfortable shoes.
Great part of the city to walk around. Plenty of laneways, small bars, tapas... Reminded me of Spain and Melbourne mixed together. Friendlier and safer version of Barcelona..

The place to be. This neighbourhood is really the place to be on pretty much any night when in Lisbon. The vibe is so relaxed and cool that it really is impossible not to have a good night. And like the rest of the city the prices for food and drink are crazy cheap. Must do neighbourhood

Great place to amble. Bairro Alto is upper town part of Lisbon, best accessed by 131-years operating fernicular tram. Great views over city. Complex of narrow streets quiet during day but exploding into bars & restaurants at night. Check Trip Advisor before choosing where to eat.
Busy and vibrant. So much to look at and the free views over the city are a treat as you don't have to queue like you do at the castle on the opposing side of the city.
Real Lisbon . Great part of the city is very much a must see for anyone visiting Lisbon, full of narrow streets and local shops. Some nice cosy wine bars on the way!
Experience of old Lisbon. When exploring Bairro Alto, you'll be able to see the old Lisbon. Wander around the alleys, climb the steps and find your place for a perfect sunset.

Good but they look for tourists . Good area lots of crazy bars but be careful...often what they may try to charge you is more than the menu...when u question unless you push they 'forget' their english

Comes alive late night. Bairro Alto is cool neighborhood with lots of bars, shops and restaurants. Great for a daytime stroll in and out of the narrow streets. We went to a great Fado restaurant one evening, and got out around 11:PM. Wow, did the neighborhood come alive! Mostly a younger crowd, socializing and bouncing around from the various bars. Definitely the place to be for the night life crowd.

Roof top bar drink . I was told by a friend that in Lisbon the one thing I must do is take a gold lift to the bar here - it was a by disappointing, the bar is very plush but quite small, the drinks for Lisbon are expensive and the view is okay but not amazing (it doesn't help there is a building site next to it at the moment - although it was very interesting to watch the crane operator!)

Authentic . It is very nice to go out there in summer. You can go from bar to bar. People stay outside in the streets to talk to their friends. It's a very different way to go out then what I am used to here. Bit I love it!! Been there several times with my Portuguese friends!

Nice walk across the district. With small alleyways and good parks, this district makes it possible to walk in a somewhat more relaxed city than was expected in the centre.
Take your time, walk around a bit, sit in one of the smaller parks, very soothing.
Shopping and food. If your looking for a bit of shopping followed by a nice lunch then this is the place for you. Take slow stroll down all the alleys to get the best of the area.

Awesome. Stayed at the barrio alto apartments and this is definitely the place to be for bars and restaurants. Gets a little loud and messy but strangely civilised! Locals and services come round each morning and do a deep cleanse of all beer cups and rubbish so it looks spotless by 10am!! Weekdays much quieter
Lovely View. best to join the top and the view is lovely, unfortunately lots of graffiti on the car itself but definitely worth a visit
Shops, Fado & Restaurants. Get lost in the streets of Barrio Alto and explore. Every street offers a new adventure. So many sites to see, so little time. Slow down and enjoy!
Bairro Alto. bairro alto is the best place for backpackers. it is the full of bars, restaurants and disco clubs. i enjoyed this place on weekend.

Worth the huffing and puffing. The Bairro Alto makes for a good home base if you're staying in Lisbon for more than a few days. There are lots of good, inexpensive apartments to rent in the area, and the small streets and old buildings have a lot of character, with hidden bars and restaurants on every street. Yes, you will be walking up and down a lot of stairs, but the views are worth it.

The real centre of Lisbon. Spend a day or two or three on food discovering this piece of magic on the west edge of Europe. Lovely coffee houses, great eateries and delicious wines. Comfortable walking shoes are needed, no high heels!

interesting area in Lisbon. This is an interesting area to walk around in Lisbon, with some interesting shops. The sidewalks are narrow though and the traffic can be heavy. I would not recommend walking around these streets with young children or elders. The architectural details are beautiful, so better to walk than drive to see all of the details.
Great area. Little streets lines with restaurants, bars, and pubs. Lot of energy. You wouldn't want to go to Lisbon without visiting Bairro Alto.

Visit it twice: by day and by night!. Old quarter of Lisbon. Small streets. Look for boutiques of contemporary fshion, ateliers of designers and artists, bars, discos, restaurants, fado houses. Admire the 18th architecture. At night there are lots of people on the streets. Loose yourself in the labirint of alleys.

excellent for shopping and fotos. lots of nice shops
nice pubs & bars
lots of nice corners to take unique fotos
will go again
it´s very nice in the evening!
Party district. Well worth a visit, especially if you are looking for the party. Lots of street with bars and restaurants on them. Can be a noisy place to stay.
Quirky . A visit to this area is a must, plenty of cafes bars and restaurants tucked away within the cobblestone streets, you could get lost here exploring for half a day.

Cool place to walk around at night . If visiting during the day, make sure you visit again at night time to see the difference. Everything opens up and the buildings you thought were abandoned turn out to be nice bars and restaurants. There's 2 or 3 streets where most of the action is. However, it's gotten to that stage where it's attracting stag do's and the teenage backpackers looking for cheap drinks and a drunken night.

Good Night Life. This is a great place to go for a night out. Lots and lots of bars, café and restaurants.Its the in place to be for a good night out. Quiet in the week, but from Thursday onwards, its a hive of activity. Restaurants - many from Indian to Portugese menu`s. Prices are reasonable.
wonderful place. wonderful place to be. love the outdoorsy cafe's , restaurants and slow paced lifestyle... definitely worth a visit
awesome place to get lost.... beautiful little gems to discover... can't wait to revisit and try another group of the restaurants.

Unusual. This area is very authentic, and not super touristy. Did not get accosted by lots of waiters with menus consisting of large photos of Pizzas etc!! It is very hilly, so lots of steps to climb. The area seems very original and unspoiled, and there are countless bars and places to eat. We were there in the late evening, and it does not seem at all edgy or threatening. Will probably go back tonight and find another restaurant with music, of which there are lots. Best area we have found to spend the evening.

A place to visit in Lissabon. One of the parts of Lissabon that is a must. With its small streets with typical old portuguese buildings and churches. Full of small businesses and cafés, it is a lively place that should be visited anyway.

Jaw-dropping masterpieces amongst the hordes walking with their cheep booze in plastic cups. Lisbon has a common, but unfair claim....that it is a budget traveller's dream spot.... Be that as it may, we listen intently to our guide who points out the spindling tower of of the basilica at the end of the park. He quipps-on... "i am not going to force you to go into a church... we have about 180 of them, but if you wish to visit, it's free. Chugging around the city in the back of an ancient pseudo-jeep, built by the Portuguese, the emphasis is on sharing local knowledge rather then traipsing through a predictable highlights reel. We are given a rundown on where the best bifanas are... those greasy, but naughty pork sandwiches and see impromptu fado music performances without tourist-trap entrance fees..... the guide carries on... don't buy drinks from a bar, just get cheep beers from a convenience stor and pour it into a plastic cup as you wander the streets. Count me out of this cheep option! But the reason why we all come here is the hedonistic lifestyle, its novelty transport including trams and funicular railways up the steep hills. Transport is essential but what a bonus en route... Metro Art, specially commissioned tile art inside them turning a trip into a gallery hop. My favourite is The Parque and my femm's.. The Oriente..... this love of tiles leads one to The Museo Nacional Do Azulejo for the world's most extraordinary collection. It covers the history of Portugal's signature artform with a church built around the museum that is jaw-dropping masterpiece. For us, the wine tastings on Praca do Comercio, Lisbon's main square is a highlight, testing samplings, at about 75 cents of the countries best vino regions. Who can resist a flee market? this place called Feira Da ladra is more about socialising then serious shopping. The quality is iffy, but people watching gets five stars. There is no getting away from it, Lisbon is a sponge for the youthful spirit of everyone

A must in Lisbon. Cool place with a lot of life and streets to explore. My hotel was located elsewhere but it was within walking distance and I found myself ending up there often during my stay in Lisbon. Recommended!

Bairro Alto. Bairro Alto is a central district of the city of Lisbon, the Portuguese capital. Unlike many of the civil parishes of Lisbon, this region can be commonly explained as a loose association of neighbourhoods

Great stuff. our hotel was locatel at the tram stop up to Bairro Alto, what a great place to explore, great panoramic view over the city too. good lively fun place to be at night, great wee bars and restaurants. Will be back.

Part of the old town in Lisboa, charming. Bairro Alto must be included in a trip to Lisboa, it is recommended finding a hotel here.It is easy walking to many of the most interesting sights of the city from here. Very close is perhaps the best fado restaurant O Faio, in an area bustling with life in the evening. Also near by is the fantastic church Sao Roque with its chapels., and the Elevador, the Eiffel similar (much smaller) tower. The shopping area around Garret street and the famous café Brasileira are also here.

Lively nightlife, great music and cocktails. Narrow, cobbled streets that are deserted during the day are teeming with life as they come alive after dark. Countless bars and restaurants appear out of nowhere in the pulsating heart of Lisbon's nightlife. Beers and cocktails aplenty and all the competition ensures that the pricing is very fair. Try a Fado bar while there, unmissable.
Lovely old quarter. The people are so friendly. Not a good place to stay as there are always queues for the lifts which need double the capacity. Full of good restaurants.
See the old city. Amazing streets - narrow and steep in places. Gives a reflection of local life as it has been and still is. Gets under the skin of the city.
A "Must" in Lisbone. You can't miss this area if you are in Lisbone, full o nice bars and restaurants, full of life. Everybody can find a place no matter your taste!

Bairro Alto. Went to Bairro Alto last night for dinner. For Lisbon it is clearly where the action is. It is a beautiful neighborhood filled with restaurants and bars, trendy shops, nice architecture, and noisy night life. It is easily accessible by metro, taxi, tram or bus. You can easily walk from the commercial area but beware, it is on a hill and you may want to take the elevator up. Many attractions, food, drink, shopping, nightlife, music and theater. Highly recommended and not to be missed in Lisbon.

Bar Hopping All the Way!. This is a must for night life during your visit to Lisbon. It is important to do so on Saturday. You will find all kind of places to visit. From live rock to bachata. You should bar hopping to plenty enjoy the area.
