Shops and restaurants are wedged into odd assortments of doorways. Graffiti and tags cover some walls. Bunting loops across streets. The buildings themselves will sometimes stun you with their delicacy or details, bright pastel walls or tile work, popping up unexpectedly as you walk up and down the hilly passages. Because this is a university sector, occupied by foreign students, too, during their Erasmus year (exchange program), rents are kept very low by law and prices in shops and cafes can be substantially lower than down in the Comercio or Rossio areas. While up in the Alto, visit the Praca Luis de Camoes then cross over to the Chiado section to Largo de Carmo, a pocket park offering absolutely stunning views of the old city, the Alfama hills, and the castle.

where party and history blend in. oh it's an amazing district of old Lisbon, you can have some great views if you choose a nice hostel. The ancient alleys at night become full of young people having a great time, people come here to connect... to dance... to enjoy!! and now some copies of paintings from the national museum of ancient art lay hanging on some in occasional venues, just to give some history to the people... so they wont forgetVisit both day and nighthave fun

Fantastic Place to Stay... Great to Explore. My favourite district. There are so many bars and restaurants it's very difficult to be bored and then there's the views. A simple must visit when in Lisbon...
Nightlife in Lisbon. Here you find nightlife and party... Also a lot of restaurants. If you seek quietness you should avoid booking a hotel here :)
Bairro Alto. great night life but bad drug area Would not recommend for couples or families. A young mans weekend though maybe.

Amazing at night, beautiful during the day.. Some very nice shops and cafe's to look at during the day, and nice to walk around and enjoy the sights. Great little bars at night, a must go for anyone looking to enjoy nightlife. Watch out for several guys hanging around the intersections selling cocaine and weed. At lest the leave you alone as soon as you say you're not interested, I never felt in danger
Intresting to explore!. A lot of restaurants and shopping streets. Nice to explore and go around by foot. Many intresting and hidden ways!

Good walk round if your legs are up to it!. As 'alto' means 'high' you know what to expect if you go for a walk in this area! Quite a few nice plush streets with high end shops but you can walk up and down main and side streets and get lost to your hearts content, discovering small squares and nice vistas almost by accident. Plenty of up hill and down hill but at least not the steps as found in Alafama!
Fun neighborhood. This is a great place to walk around as the sun goes down. Lots of places to eat, drink, and people-watch!

Youth place. Definitely a place for all kinds of youth, from the extremely vulgar to the utmost queer rainbow dance kids. I don't know if the elderly tourist could fit well in this place; though it's definitely very attractive to all ages because of its huge carnaval sphere which nonstop takes place. Rio de Janeiro in Lisbon!

The warmest welcome. Everything about the Bairro Alto is comfortable, classy, and made to serve you but what sets this excellent hotel apart from others is the quality, thoughtfulness, friendliness and overall charm of the staff. As one concierge said to me when I expressed my gratitude at the service we received with an amazed "wow!", "Wow is our middle name." The terrific location and beautiful rooftop bar are added attractions.

Trendy shops and bars. There are many trendy shops with design furniture, accessories, etc. At night it transforms in an outdoor fiesta place with a lot of people drinking and partying on the street. It's a noisy part of the city.

find the right place. great bars and lively place although the first night we didnt quite find it and strolled into an area we probably shouldnt have been.....but second night found the streets and had a great time, people watching and drinking in the street even though its was october evening.

Great evening outings !!!. Loads of bars and restaurants.
Be prepared to walk UP HILL.
A great place, loads of buzz! Young and old all tastes catered for.
Highly recommend.

The place to go for drinks and dinner. Our host suggested we walk from our hotel on the Avenida Dal Liberdade to the Funicular to go up the hill to Bairro Alto for dinner. We skipped the funicular (a little crowded and pricey at €3,60) and climbed stairs and steep narrow roads to the top where we were rewarded with beautiful views of the city and dozens of restaurant choices. Start looking in windows at about 8:15 pm and go in the restaurants that are crowded with locals. Don't worry about the menu, worry about the crowd. You'll be glad you did.

Loved the bars and trams and funiculars.. Bars and views plus the trip down on the Gloria funicular - runs late at the weekend. Best to have your green travel card topped up - only €1.40 a trip. Otherwise it's €3.60 to pay on board - although that does cover 2 trips. Just love the trams!
A must-see part of Lisbon. Between Bairro Alto and Baixa, you will never have to worry about where to spend your nights in Lisbon. The area is such a charming and beautiful part of the city.

Great neighborhood . A very well known area since it is in every travel guide. Still the area deserves a visit. There are multiple restaurants where you can enjoy Portuguese food before you'll enjoy the drinks in this area. Keep in mind that most locals and tourists come later than Western Europeans are used to.
Very Cool. Awesome place to shop, walk, eat and drink or just sit and watch the world go by. Gotta try the chorizos!
food !!. Narrow winding roads..Narrow steep roads. takes you back in time and loaded with Restaurants offering all kinds of cusines

I like it in the afternoon. Bairro Alto doesn't look like part of a big capital. Rather it has the charm of a nice village. In the morning it needs time to wake up, then in the afternoon shops open and people come to the streets. It's quite pleasant walking around the small, colorful streets. Sit in a bar and look life going by. I enjoyed the afternoon atmosphere of this "barrio". It is said to become very lively in the evening until late, but I didn't try that.

Stroll through the alleyways and discover your own favorite places. You might walk along some of the main streets in Bairro Alto. But to truly experience this charming neighborhood, stroll through the cobbled alleys and stop into any of the myriad of little restaurants or bars. In the evening, you'll hear Fado through open windows and doorways. Steer clear of any place that opening advertises the music, though, and trust your own ears. We happened to stop into some nameless joint at which the singers, when finished with their sets, also waited tables. A truly memorable evening.
trams. if you like trams this is the place to be ride all day and lot to see hop off have some food hop back on great fun

Exciting part of Lisbon. Such a variety of impressions! Just walk around, watch buildings and people, take a coffee or a ginjinha, inhale odors, listen to the sounds ...
Go there any time of the day, but make sure to come when the sun is about to or has set.

Lovely old toen, pity to haver to share it with the tourists ;-). it is worthwhile to take a walk around this area, and enjoy the views. Unfortunately, everyone knows that! So if you are looking for something off the beaten track, among the locals, then give it a skip. There are more than enough other lovely neighborhoods to explore.

Winding narrow lanes. Find any amount of restaurants and small shops with this area,great place to visit for food in the evenings and to wander around during daylight hours,metro to BAIXI CHIADO and then cross the road into this warren of streets.
Lots of hills. Great area great for walking downhill to the harbour, really interesting shabby chic buildings. Bit hard on people who have trouble walking up hills but worth it

Closed the air. Taking the tram no.28 at La Plaça del Comercio you can go to Barrio Alto. A nice typical potuguese neigborhood although a little dangerous cause the pickpockets, also for foreign cars. A nice view of Lisbon from a viewpoint, and you can find the old Castello de San Jorge walking between narrow streets.Lots of bars offers you food and drinks out the street.

Center of the city. Love this city. Barron Alto is surrounded by shops, cafes, restaurants and night life. You can walk pretty much anywhere pretty conveniently, or take the metro, trolley or bus. I found the city pretty safe to travel around. I walked alone a lot while here and felt very comfortable. The Portugese Police really take pride in making tourist feel safe, their presence is known for sure.

Great to Wander. Take the old funicular tram to the top and admire the view from garden terrace. Take a leisurely walk towards the river. Visit wonderful churches and admire the tile facades of many of the buildings. The style is typically Portugese. There are numerous historical sites and museums that can be visited. The area is also a magnet for night birds with numerous clubs, cafes and restaurants, many of which stay open into the small hours. Whatever the reason for your visit, be sure to take your time and enjoy the walk.
recent visit. Good area, got lost but was able to see local house, people, unexplainable experience. Lots of up and down hill ( more up hill then down).

Place to eat dinner in Lisbon. Ride up to Bairro Alto with Elevator da Gloria and then you have mostly downslope. Bairro Altos tiny streets are full of restaurants with or without fadosingers. We ate there several times dinner without disappointment

New Orleans on steroids!. Super fun, party in the streets but felt safe. Ladies beware, wear comfortable shoes it's cobblestones and going down hill my wife almost slipped a few times. Yes she was drinking but even in daylight it was slippery. She ended up going barefoot down the steep hills. No heels for her the next night.
Barrio alta. Took the tram to the top. Daytime lines too long. We went at6 pm. Short wait. Saw the sunset on top great views of the city.

Cheerful drinks and atmosphere. Unmissable nightlife in Lisboa! Cheap, quality drinks, simple and jolly area.
Were with omo friends and enjoyed around!

Climb the hill to get there. Lisbon is full of hills. They have funicular trains, elevators, and tuk-tuks to help you defeat the hills. We walked up, and the walk was worth it. We found lots of great little restaurants and sampled some over the next few days.

Grab a beer and walk the streets!. Amazing vibe, amazing people, gigantic hangover!
To do and repeat. Be mindful of some dark corners where you should avoid entering.
Cheap beer, cheap cigarettes, one of a kind party!

Lovely neighborhood!. Lisbon is amazing and so is Bairro Alto, a little more touristy than other parts of Lisbon for the right reasons. Great architecture, amazing places to eat and drink, great to walk around, interesting street life and all around cool neighborhood to be in if you're in Lisbon.
Night time outing. Some great bars to check out, old and new live music and cocktails as well as beer on offer, something for everyone

Powerful and beautiful.. I do love this part of Lisbon. It is amazing and beautiful. I would advise to visit it very early in the morning, you will avoid unnecessary crowds, and you;ll enjoy how serene it can be.

Loved Barrio Alto. we ate in this area on a number of occasions. Superb food and drinks, good value and terrific street entertainment. Guide books say not to stay in the streets after the bars close, but from what we could see the bars are open well into the early hours.
Old town. Great area, easily accessible. Wonderful bars, restaurants and quaint shops. You could spend a half day just wandering.

Great for bars and reasonably priced drinks. Bairro Alto is great for a night out. Wind your way through the little streets stumbling across bars with no real plan in mind and have a great time. Drinks prices were surprisingly cheap too compared with other European cities.
Great for bar hopping. Great for bar hopping. Lots of choices and ambiance. Put on some good shoes for the up and down walks!

What you're going to Lisbon for, afterall!. People watching people looking at shops, restaurants, history, culture, strangers, all nationalities, and more. Take comfortable and sturdy shoes and be in no hurry..see and be seen. Go into shops and be dazzled. Stop and eat at a funky outdoor cafe. Drink wine at 10:30 am and not worry. Enjoy this little piece of Lisbon.

Very lively area. Beautiful place to visit and a great night life, full of bars, restaurants and shopping, a lot of walking, hills and cobble stones so no heels, flat shoes all the way :D Day time is fine for children but I wouldn't recommend bringing kids out at night time as it is very busy and a lot of people wondering around eating and drinking, loads of music and entertainment. Public transport very cheap and so is the food and drink. We had a great weekend with a group of 10 ladies.
A lovely shopping and party area!. Bairro Alto is a nice 17th-century quarter of Lisbon with a lot of activities; high class shopping, wining, dining and partying. Take the time to explore!

The tradition still goes on!. If you like to have a walk around of one of the most historical "bairros" of Lisbon, you will never regret to visit Bairro Alto. Try it at sunset, have dinner over there and after go on walking and socialize with people... It´s a new sensation that you will love!...Just go there!
Nice place to visit. For those who like night life nothing like taking a glass at bairro during the weekends, until 2 a.m. .

Bustling part of Lisbon to shop in.....certainly NOT live in!. You could walk and walk and never tire this lovely up and down hilly enclave of Lisbon! Lovely shops, piazzas, restaurants, musicians...and plenty of bustle and noise in those narrow streets, signify this area! While it's great to shop and browse in, for mementos ranging from Tiles to curios, I can't imagine living in the midst of all this hustle and bustle when there are so many quieter leafy neighborhoods just a couple of Metro stops away! The stuff you buy here you can bargain for and the quality often is just about average. Local specialities like Tiles are unique but other curios only of average quality. They are so colorful as indeed is the whole area. Catch anyone complaining?
Great Place. a touch of tradition marks this place, you sense the beautiful architecture merged with history and modern tourism,

nice. Bairro Alto is lovely but we went to visit during the day on a Sunday and found it very quiet with very little open,it took us a while to find a restaurant for lunch,we returned on the monday for another tour around and dinner and the place was much more alive.

The best place to stay in Lisbon. One of the best areas to stay in Lisbon. As well as being very close to all other areas, you are in the middle of the most happening places in Lisbon. In the morning you can sit and have coffee in the most amazing bakeries. Afternoon there are tourist attractions within walking distance.At night the place is full of small restaurants. Midnight the party comes alive and goes all night long.Plus points- Short distance from all areas - Walking distance from tourist attractions- Next door to the fashionable area- Great accommodation availableLow points- After midnight it could get rowdy Recommendations:- Get yourself an apartment in this areas

GREAT SPOT. We stayed in this area and although the night life on most nights goes on till the wee small hours it was a great lace to be. Our accommodation had double glazed windows so the noise did not bother us. This area has a great vibe, lots and lots of interesting places to eat. Would recommend anyone visiting Lisbon to visit this area in the evening. In the day time it is lovely too but really comes alive in the evenings.

A tourist magnet get me out of here!. All a bit too crowded for my liking (my husband and I stayed in a residential apartment for 4 nights). This having been said it was full of history, pop up bars and many restaurants - definitely the area for night owls!An idea location to see many of the numerous sights Lisbon has to offer - we really only returned in the evening, in the faint hope the streets were less crowded and easier to navigate.

Dull and Grim. Little to recommend it unless you enjoy being ripped off in slightly grubby places. Few notable sights, no eateries or bars offering value-for-money. Transport is chaotic, unreliable and charmless.

Friendly, Crowded Neighborhood Filled With Possibilities. Very active and energetic neighborhood, away from the tourist bus destinations. Crowded but in a friendlier way. Lots of choices for food, beer and shopping. Use the 22 tram line to get here, or walk like we did. Lots of uphill to get to the area, but worth the effort and you can replenish the burned calories at one of the many cafe/bakeries.

The heights of elegance. Up above the central Baixa area the streets of Bairro Alto rival those of Alfama in their choice of places to eat and be entertained. Be sure to walk along the Rua Da Trindade to the Largo Rafael Bordalo Pinheiro and admire the amazing tile facade of the house there.

Head here for restaurants galore !!. This is the place to head for everything food related in the evening, every type of cuisine you wish for is here, it's a bit of a winding maze of streets with a few steps added in for good measure, but it's well worth it,

Gone downhill in the last 2 years. Lovely bar area but when i visited this time I coukdnt get over how seedy it had gotten. Constantly being asked if u wanted to buy drugs openly and then followed aggressively. Not nice at all. There are much nicer and welcoming areas for bars in alfama etc.

Every corner revealed something new. Really enjoyed strolling around the streets of Lisbon especially in the oldtown interesting buildings little shops and markets - I always believe the only way to see a city is to put on the walking shoes and explore
Keeps going and going and going. Take the time to walk the streets of this neighborhood in the daytime and the evening. There are many great bars and restaurants and you can find all kinds of fun.

Cool place to visit at night. This is the place to go for night-life in Lisbon. It was buzzing, with lots of clubs & bars - we managed to find a nice live music venue with a nice atmosphere...but just wonder & you'll be sure to find something that appeals. A little bit run-down but quite authentic & didn't feel too much of a tourist trap.

Good view. Your tourist map of Lisbon won't give you an idea of relief. The heights and lows of this port city are best appreciated from these streets. If you are young and looking for the life at night it's good fun. During the day it's a stroll and perhaps a coffee.
Comes alive at night. Good for night-life, a bit run down during the day. Watch your step for dog poo though! Many bars and restaurants, well worth a visit.

electricity in the air. wine bars,pabs, ,restaurants, stairs, and music every where.
the right place to be whether you are young or old as long as you are young in your heart.

Another old quarter of Lisbon . Great place in Lisbon with old slightly down run buildings, small coffee shops to have a sip on foot as you go, many cosy restaurants. Nostalgic face of the city, upbuilt by the old window less trams
caution do no eat at Lisbon. Saw a review on here and tried it. Excellent food are service. Friendly restaurant. We've booked again for tomorrow. M u Christmas the best food we've had in Lisbon.

The best spot in town. If you are coming to Lisbon and want very central area from where you can easily walk anywhere in the city then this is the spot . It's centre and meeting point of Locals and tourists . Many small bars and bigger bars restaurants and small shops . Bare in mind music shuts at 02:00 and people drinking out on the street which also makes an ambient very unique . If you rent an apartment generally they have double Windows to keep noise down indoor. I would definitely return back into this neighbourhood. Be aware of drug dealers and pick pocketing as well as everywhere else in centre of Lisboa. Try to eat in smaller local places worth it to reserve table for next day in case is too busy night u want to go .
Great Food and Entertainment. Great Varity of local cuisine , Fado singers, Jazz Music , buskers. Good Value for money and a friendly vibe in the streets.
Great for nightlife.. Great area to visit. Livens up at night. Great bars and restaurants. Get the no.28 up and walk back - very hilly.
Great time!. Only experienced this on a night out, but it was such a great time! People everywhere drinking and enjoying the atmosphere!

Center of all nighlife. Bairro Alto is the neighborhood to go at night and have a walk among the many many bars that exist, you will find always one that suits you more than the others but the choice is plenty and on fridays and saturdays night till 3AM this is the place to be. None of the bars will give you the most well prepared cocktail but if you are looking for a place full of people and full of noise and nightlife... Bairro Alto
Very beautiful. You can walk for hours, beautifully colored houses and very nice streets. Together with Alfama is a dream day walking and shooting great photos. Enjoy.

A very good look at how the Portuguese built their town to make it very difficult for invaders to get a foothold. I suggest that the place be visited with a knowledgeable guide who could answer the many questions of visitors. A very interesting place to visit.

Authentic and full of character!. Full of character and tradition with cosy wine bars and lively night life! This area is full of older style book shops, old trams! Have your walking shoes ready as it is really hilly!

Worth seeing, but has its faults. The famous Bairro Alto drew us in on a Friday night. It was certainly lively with a huge range of choice of bars, restaurants and more.However, it reminded me a lot of Dublin's Temple Bar in that a lot of the bars had gone down the one route - in this case, tourist traps with loud and brash drinks promotions. As such, large swathes of it didn't feel at all like a "local" scene.Perhaps with a bit more research or local knowledge we would have got more out of it, but it was worth seeing all the same.

Place must see. The Bairro Alto is situuated in the sea front, walking along the street placed with the stone was amazing. There is a ramp go up hill to see a castle. If you don't want to walk up hill, you mat take tram to travel around there.

Best mistake !. We stumbled across this area if Lisbon by taking a wrong exit out of the underground - but that is the best mistake I've made in a long time.There are too many good things to write about the area so all I can say is go see for yourself - I will be surprised if your disappointed.
Beautiful place. Try a drink at the Terace of Bairrt Alto Hotel and you will not regret. One of the best views of Lisbon

Miradouro park and gardin at top of hill in Barrio Alta. This lovely park in Barrio Alta is at the top of the incline on the Elevador da Gloria. It is also accessible by walking. The neighborhood is interesting and lively but the best part is a cafe in the park with wonderful views of the city and music being played by some really good musicians. While I was there a group from Cape Verde Islands was playing every day. Lovely to sit in the shade and hear good music and have a beer and lunch on a hot day!

5-days break in Lisboa. Here we had the best evening in Lisboa Adega MachadoFado and food at rua do Norte.We have also went with Elevador da Gloria up to Barrio Alto.It isa beautiful walkingarea,BUT you need to have good shoes

The real Lisbon. Listen...You can and you will wisit a lot of things in this worm, crazy, beautiful city.But, if you wont a taste of real, pure Lisboa- go to restorant " O Cantinho do bem estar", on Bairro Alto. It is in the Rua da Norta. Small place, suggested by locals. Unbelievable great dishes, energy, quality. We went there 3 times- first we ate a fish- so fresh and so gooood! But, we wonted to test this little worm place with meat! Belive me- it is the taste of heaven! Don' t forget good house wine!! And the price? Hey! Crazy, but true- it is unexpectedly cheap!One of the first thing I'll remember from Lisboa.
Really good sight to make beautiful pictures.. Really love the walk around the streets. There are a large number of stores and places to eat. The view is fantastic.

Dissapointing, seedy and lacking in charm.. Did not live up to my expectations. Found it a little seedy, and lacking in charm or character. Bags of rubbish and lots of graffiti.Full of touristy restaurants, the nightlife is probably great if you want a good night out on the town at the weekend but overall it just didn't do much for me and I found other places in Lisbon more to my liking.
Happy place . Is such a festive area, food and fado are very popular in this area. A must visit if you are in this area.

Typical Lisbon. This typical site in Lisbon located in the Chiado area is a must go in the Capital, with well preserved small buildings (although with some graffities) and lots of good restaurantes, many of them with Fado concerts.

Another rundown place in this depressing city. I did not like Lisbon. At all. So many people recommended it, and I just don't understand why. Everything is rundown, it's depressing, there's barely anything to do culturally speaking, except drinking I guess.Skip Lisbon. The food is terrible, it's dirty and the people who live there don't even seem to like it.
food and entertainment. this is the place to go in the evening, one restaurant next to the other, but go early, later will be queus outside
Great place for food, drinks and nightlife. Excellent variety of restaurants and bars. Particularly fun for nightlife, when the whole neighborhood is buzzing with people.

was better some years ago. The most popular night disctrict in Lisbon. It used to have lots of great public some 4-6 years ago. But then came up the new rule: the bars are opened only until 2 a.m., which is absolutely reasonable. Though, Bairro Alto lost its greatness afterwards a little bit. Mostly a turistic place right night, though it has great places for dancing, drinking, food and fado...

Great at night. Excellent nightlife and places to eat. Really good value for drinks, and food prices are pretty good. There is also a great view of the castle from the edge of Bairro Alto. Definite place to come if you want to go out at night.

Visual feast. The delightful combinations of old, really old, and new are fascinating. The tile work and the wrought iron,much of it undergoing or needing restoration, are endlessly intriguing and make for terrific photos if you are patient with the crowds and lighting. People watching becomes the activity of the day what with so many cultures mingling...some for the day and others for everyday. Cafes and pastry shops provide ample variety for the quick pick-me-up.
touring Lisbon. All was great to see and visit. Enjoyed venturing this interesting city. Wish we would have had moret ime to visit.had
Deppressing. About the only thing worth seeing in this deppresing city. Avoid a "Fado" show at all costs, go to a funeral and listen to better singing

Lisbon's inner heart.. The perfect place for you to get lost in Lisbon's aura. This is the centre of town, the place you want to be during the day (as you find tiny flats and a surface tram amongst many other neat perks), and during the night as well (as it is the hot spot of Lisbon's night). At night, you find hundreds of bars for you to have cheap beer (for 1 euro for instance), and the city's pounding heart personified in every single one's eyes.
Night life in lisbon. This place is full of fun. Here you can find everything from bar to dance clubs. It is must visit place in lisbon
Fun night out with amazing wine and some good food. Excellent night out. We had dinner by having a glass of wine and a small dish at different bars and it was a success!

Put Bairro Alto High On Your List!. The Bairro Alto in Portugal is great fun to explore. Be sure to wear comfortable shoes to walk in while you explore and be sure to stop along the way to take in all the beauty.

Worth visiting bars area, with a special aura, umique and colourful. One of my favourite spots in Lisbon. Has a great variety of bars that for sure satisfies the needs of the most picky ones. Many nice decors, arts people in the streets, stylish youth and successfull business people. This place has its own uniqur aura. Eorth seeing while in Portugal!
Fun place. Barron alto is the fun place in Lisbon. All fun is here. You will get to know about how Lisbonese live their life with full fun and entertainment. From bar to disc everything is here.

Party district of Lisbon - full bars, clubs and stairs to climb!. The party district in Lisbon - bar after bar, restaurant after restaurant, all hidden on the tiny streets, which are very steepy ( no highhill shoes, ladies!). Lovely views, but can be very challenging if you dont like climbing hundreds of stairs, narrow streets or you dont like thousands of drunk people - party is all night!

Don't miss it!. Bairro Alto is a neighbourhood that you need to explore. I recommend to just explore it by going through it, no need for any booking. My experience was just to look around, see what looks interesting and went in. It was worth it, I found nice place for food, just I don't remember the name of the place.

Warren of Small alley like streets with great food and entertainment. Great place to explore. Lots of options for food or entertainment. Could be rowdy on a weekend I expect. Had two great meals there and lots of fun walking around people watching and exploring. The streets with flags overhead have restaurants and bars. those without seem to be where people live for the most part. Take the elevator or a funicular up to save walking up all of those steep stairs.

Exploring. If you are going to Lisbon, then there is no excuse.. You need to pass by Bairro Alto during the night, try one of the restaurants, maybe a "naco na pedra" and the stay for a drink. Explore the small streets as there are bars everywhere. If you are staying late i don't recommend to be alone as you can find some crazies. Bairro also is nice to explore during the day with some nice out of the ordinary stores.
The most beautiful neighborhood. A lively place, full of colours and people. You can spend a whole day strolling around Bairro Alto. Nice shops and cafes! Don't miss it!

A fun evening out. A very lively place to go at night, lots of options for food and drinks, and great prices. Just be warned you will get asked if you want to buy drugs many many times. But not in a threatening or pushy way, just say no thanks and smile.
Seeing the real lisbon. Nice area to stroll around and see all the local sights. Quaint side streets with plenty of cafés and of course pastries

quaint. So much to see and do .A lot of shops, eatery's ,bars church's....You can grab a small snack, have dinner,go for coffee or drinks or desert lots of pastelaria's and ice cream.If you want to bring something back for some one lots and lots of pottery and items for the house.Evening stroll are very nice and recommended! Just Beautiful as all of Portugal is!
A lovely experience to be part of. You could spend a lifetime exploring this and the Principe Real area next door and never get tired of it. It's so full of life and character

Lovely to visit. Although we only spent one evening in the Bairro Alto, it was wonderful to walk around the old streets to get a flavour of the old Lisbon. The funicular is apparently the best way to get up, although we took a cab. Worth a visit.

Great Party Spot! . Be aware that the prices can be a little inflated around this area, still amazing in comparison to most European pricing though!If you're looking for a party, a dance, live music or great tapas, this is the spot.
Get the funicular. If you are in Lisbon get the funicular up here . It is an interesting place with excellent views and great coffee shops.

A must see. Loved this area. Cool by day, fun by night. Just stroll around and you'll find loads of interesting shops, bars and restaurants. Yes, it's very touristy, but you can't help enjoying the atmosphere. Be picky about where you stop for a bite, as there are little gems to be found just around the next corner.
Go for the Fado. Make sure you spend some time getting lost in the hilly little streets here. A great place to find Fado, while most may be tourist orienting, there are some hidden gems here.
Nice area for anything. The centre of Lisbon, plenty of things to do, see, restaurants, bars - loads of them at night, fantastic night life till very late. Worth checking out
the best Night Spot in Lisbon. It is impossible to know the Bairro Alto in one night, so many bars and places to discover for all types of customers.

Comfort in the heart of the city. Right in the heart of the city a wonderful and warm place with great staff. The hotel was nice and the rooms were of decent size but the best part was the attitude of their staff. The staff was friendly and warm and eager to help. It was a good experience and highly recommended.
The best area to visit. This is by far the best area to visit in the evening. Go to the Old Pharmacy to taste Portugal's great range of wines. Even the most expensive ones are reasonably priced.
Great Area. One of our favorite areas of Lisbon. We saw it while on a tuk-tuk tour and it looked amazing. Must be in good shape if you're planning to walk up and down the hills.
Quaint neighbourhood.. Quaint neighbourhood with interesting surprises around every corner. Lots of steep inclines and descents so wear good shoes.
Pleasant stroll for a late afternoon. Pleasant stroll when not too crowded & hot. Best take taxi to the top and walk down, particularly if visiting in the summer.

Best viewed at night.... A great, trendy little neighbourhood set up a hill overlooking Lisbon's Baixa. Really beautiful little streets, interesting eateries and funky bars.You can easily spend an evening getting lost and exploring but it is certainly better to visit during the night when it comes alive. In the middle of the day it is fairly dull and if you choose to walk up the hill through Chiado it can prove tiring.

The Lively Active Center of Lisbon. Lots of nightlife, chic stores and restaurants, fine architecture, lots of history, yet prices are very reasonable. I have stayed in the area during my three latest visits.

Awesome neighborhood. A must if you are young and want to experience a relaxed type of nightlife. Plenty of bars to enter and exit. Like all major cities beware of pickpockets. If you are not young and enjoy nightlife this is still the place for you. SO many options and excellent ex excellent dining options.

Take it all in!. Visit the Bairro Alto and make sure to walk along the 'river' front which presents as if it is the sea. The architecture is beautiful and there are many authentic eating places-you really can't go wrong. Don't forget your camera.

Great for shopping. This is the high area of Lisbon. Loaded with shops and restaurants. There is a Funicular Rail that is fun to take up to the area and ascends the steep street with ease. The cobblestone streets and sidewalks add to the ambience of a time gone by. There's a former convent turned monks brewery turned restaurant that is a beautiful example of the Portuguese tiles.

All night party. We were lucky to stay very close to all of the action of the Bairro Alto. The area is a busy meeting spot of young and old and the atmosphere is great. We picked up a couple of take away beers from one of the many kiosks in the area and took in the sunset from the lookout over the city. There were plenty of others doing the same and we enjoyed the background music from the buskers. After that we chose a restaurant for dinner. there is an amazing chhoice of restaurants and we ate at one that had a seafood bar facing the street. After dinner we found a bar "Atascadero do Chico" and had cocktails and listened to traditional music. A great night out in a very vibrant area of Lisbon.

A maze of small lanes and alleyways, haunting fado music and inviting tapas bars and restaurants.. We got lost and found ourselves again, and wandered in this alluring district watching the world go by and ended up eating seafood and listening to Fado. Don't leave Lisbon without visiting the Bairro Alto.

Great ambience with a lot of charm. Just walking around Bairro Alto is a fantastic experience. The restaurants in this area are unique. We visited atleast 10 of them. Have a beer in one , vinho in the other, chourico in yet another, bacalhau ...., thats what this area is about eat , drink and soak up the surroundings. It leaves you in a melancholy state, the world just stops here. Lovely.

Great nightlife. We went there a number of nights. Great atmosphere and very cheap. No nightclubs though - more small bars and take-away buckets of mojitos. Only annoying factor was the drugdealers on every corner.

a taste of old Lisbon. Enjoy walking and eating your way around this colourful part of the old city. Take a bus or even the famous No28 tram through the narrow cobbled streets. Visit the churches and coffee shops and bars and enjoy the views.

Heart of Lisbon. I hope every visitor to Lisbon has the chance to immerse themselves in the vibrancy of this neighborhood in Lisbon. It has so much charm and character, filled with little sidewalk restaurants . The neighborhood wakes up after 12 noon, and is bustling til late hours of night. We loved getting lost in this neighborhood, and constantly finding new shops and cool stores. A must visit!!!

Amazing trip up the hill..... Coming from California, I had experience of cable cars and street cars. This was a totally different experience! Wedged into the narrow confines between the old world buildings, definitely a great way to get back up the hill after a long walk down.

interesting experience. Old charming strets and buildings ,cozy resturants with fado,good food as always in Portugal, nice people it"s what you can find in Bairro Alto.If you want to listen fado you must know that you must eat in that restaurant, otherwise is impossible to be recived as a client.

Typical Portugese party district. This is the party district of Lisbon with narrow, steep streets and small, lively restaurants.Highly recommended for a party night, but be careful, lots of drug dealers will try to sell you drugs there.

Up and down streets - restaurant and bar area. Up and down streets, very steep, with restaurants and bars all over the area. Buildings are now very beautiful after being restored even if some still need to be restored.
Best place for going out at night. Many bars and clubs and great Fado Music as well. Drinks are quite cheap and the entry to the clubs is for free.
Awesome!. Another of my favorite places in Lisbon! Lots of restaurants and shopping...live place and fun both during the day and at night!
Loads of nice restaurants in this quarter. The narrow streets of this quarter make it fun to walk around (take tram or bus up and walk down. ...) and stop a few times in bars and restaurants

Exciting neighbourhood. One my businesstrip I stayed in an amzing appartment in the rua da rosa an while strolling the streets of the barrio I really got to appreciate its beauty. Although at firsf glance some street seem a bit shabby, it is worth getting lost in the strets of barrio alto.

wonderful neighbourhood. the quintessential Lisbon experience - colourful buildings, narrow streets, fado, good Portuguese food and neighbourhood bars! be prepared for crowds over the weekend (Fridays and Saturdays)!

Unique Lisbon neighbourhood. One of the neighbourhoods in Lisbon that is worth spending time whether you are young or older. Yes, this is party central for natives of Lisbon and for visitors. It stays open until 3 or 4 in the morning for partying. During the day, it is very charming. It is hilly so wear good footwear. Lots to see and experience here. Get a good map of this area of central Lisbon as you can get lost easily. It is connected to other areas as well and easy to find with a good map. Very old area and hip.
Beautiful place!. The views from the park in Bairro Alto are amazing you could take great pictures in sunset. I loved all these people at the park selling street art of the view.
Nice ballad. Nice ballad to be made in particularly in the end of the afternoon to discover some typical restaurant and discover some prado singers or not
Picturesque. Such a great area, really old school, picturesque. It is definitely worth walking around the streets and just get caught by its flair.

Charming and lively in the evenings. Small, cobbled streets and a large selection of small, friendly bars and restaurants from which to choose, this is a lively area to explore and have a bite to eat or a few drinks. Well worth a visit although if you go on foot, wear practical shoes with rubber soles and be prepared for a climb!
Best bars!. Trendy area full of bars and restaurants. Lots of small nightclubs that are open till early morning. A few bakeries and small restaurants serving late dinner.
Nice hill. Hill with narrow street, cleaned and decorated area. Accessible by walking. Very crowded at night with many restaurants and night life. Must visit place especially at night.

High Bar set for Lisbon. Bairro Alto is the area of Lisbon between the port and the pedestrian shopping streets. For people who like to city walk, it is a wonderful area, with steep narrow streets where you sometimes are sharing the road with cable cars. The buildings offer that essential Portuguese image of decorative tile fronted properties, that give it a kind of fantasy feel. While there are many small, tucked away eateries, offering traditional as well as modern Mediterranean menus. Whether you are visiting Lisbon for a day or a few days, the Bairro Alto offers a lots to see and do, while giving a real feel of old Lisbon.

Scenery of a Large and Great city of the south.. Great view on the city and also great atmosphere on this old town with the nice rooftop colors, see the Baixa later, try the streetcar and use all senses to smell this great city of the world.

FUN!. Bairro Alto (at night) was filled with people but the crowds weren't rowdy. Everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves and the company they were with. My friend and I walked around and visited neighboring bars, taking shots of Jameson at each one (they cost 2 euro each!) and stopped at one of the quieter bars to have a snack. Good food, cheap cheap drinks, friendly and vibrant atmosphere. Don't miss this while in Lisbon!

Bairro Alto best of Lisbon. If you ever feel like going to Portugal and you like to be in the middle of the action stay in Bairro Alto. Air bnb has loads of options at various prices.Bairro Alto is where the party starts with bars and restaurants giving cheap deals for you to get your pre-party started, after its closed at 2/3am head down to Cais do Sodre or Docas for amazing night club venues.During the days you can take the tram 28 and embark in an historical journey through lisbon's narrow roads of old houses and castles.

Charming!. Lisbon has a lot to offer and Bairro Alto is a part of this city which is nice to see. There is a super nice view at one place and nice shops on the way up, good restaurants in the narrow streets and charming streets and street art to see... What bothered me was the waiters in front of the restaurants who nearly pushed you to go to their restaurants, I don't like this at all! I like to first see the menu IN PEACE and read the reviews on Tripadvisor and then decide if I eat there. When waiters call me to go in or else, I don't even look at the menu, I just pass by!
the area of entertainment. This is the entertainment district with a lot of clubs, pubs and some restaruatns. Depends what are you looking for - if loud music and drinks - it's for you.
Better places in Lisbon.. Do not waste your time. There are plenty of other areas in Lisbon that are full of character, lively and enjoyable.@instabuilt

My kind of place!. Over two hundred bars(according to the tourist guide). This doesn't include the restaurants either. We enjoyed meals here a few times as there are many restaurants. The streets were decorated while we were there. I'm not sure if this is year round and there is also a lot of great street art and cool tiled restaurants and houses. An awesome area. Some great shopping as well..

Hate it!. It makes no sense keep on sending tourists to this ugly and dirt part of Lisbon. What do we find here? More tourists like us, looking at each other and completely lost and feeling stupid! You got to go up just to. . .come down? There is really nothing to see! During the day there are some narow streets to look at and a garden from were you can have a good view. At night, apart drunk young people, there are nothing to tell. Please don't send us to B. A! Lisbon has much more and much better things to see, taste and experience!

Lovely place . We was lazy to get to the stairs and we had the elevator up to Bairro Alto. Them once we was up it is a busy place and so nice . Music and dance, great restaurants and shops with expensive brands. Artists who performed at each corner of the street. Great view of Lisabon . Really nice

Love this Place..... The place to live and see in Lisbon, full of restaurants and small cafes, with lively streets and nice views. Barrio Alto its more than just a neighborhood, its a place of artist and represents a way of life. Every time we had a chance to pass through here we had a blast, either enjoying the small shows or encountering the occasional little restaurant. A great area to hang out for sure....

THE place to go for Lisbon's nightlife :). "Lisboa no seu esplendor"... Lisbon at its best...cant find other words to describe this place...Old towns are charming...a mixture of history and pop culture :)...nightlife here is crazy...but during the day is also a good place to chill, lots of stores,restaurants... :)
Beautiful Tram. The famous neigbourhood with the famous yellow tram. A must see when you're visiting Lisbon. The area is full of nice restaurants and pubs as well.

Very interesting!. It was great fun taking the street car and getting up there to see the view below. It is also great exercise to walk up there. It is a good area to walk around and explore restaurants and bars. Definitely need to spend several hours there to fully appreciate what this area has to offer.
Highly recommend going there!
One of the 7 Lisbon hills. Downtown, by foot from Rossio or by tram 28E, the famous tram of Lisbon, with the history and arts from the beautiful city.

Top location. Amazing restaurants. Even better nightlife. Located between 'Chiado' and 'Príncipe Real' (two of Lisbon's best neighbourhoods), Bairro Alto is the place to go if you like that nightlife experience. Plenty of bars along its narrow streets with lots of young people (locals and foreigners) socializing inside and outside the bars in the streets. It also has plenty and very decent restaurants, so it's also a good alternative to go during the day... or at dinner just before you "hit the bar".Very, very cool neighbourhood!

True Lisbon spirit in one small area. If or when visiting Lisbon, you want to walk throguh this part of old town. Small, narrow streets, freindly people, lots of foreign people. At night this area transformes copletely to a huge party where everyone are friends and you can see the good vibe from a mile away.

Traditional and Bohemian. For me the best area to stay in Lisbon. Traditional, modern fun and culture rolled into one. Great streets to wonder down with a fantastic choice of restaurants, later turning into welcoming bars. Friendly, cultured, Bohemian atmosphere suitable for all ages.
Historic must-go. A place full of history, nice people, beautiful architecture and a symbol of Portugal in general. Of course it is a MUST for whoever goes to Libon.

Nice walk at the side streets!. When you think of Lisbon, you definitely picture Bairo Alto. Traditional corners, nice little streets, all look so nice. Try not to be alone at certain places, specially when it gets dark, because they're a little "weird". Other than this, the whole area is beautiful!
Fun place. If you need fun in Lisbon then this place to be. You must have energy for visiting this place because it is all about fun.

If you want to know the real Lisbon you cannot miss a walk here. I think you know well a city mixing up with locals and seeing areas during day and night, you cannot miss a bit of authentic Lisbon walking around Barrio Alto, use comfy shoes and keep walking in every alley

a must-do in lisbon. most cities tend to have an area which seems to be unique to them, and the barrio alto is it for lisbon. steep streets and alleys make for a healthy walk but it's just so beautiful. and then at night it transforms into something different altogether.

Best place to start a night out!. Seems like everyone in Lisbon comes here at night as it gets extremely busy. Everyone's drinking in the streets and drinks are as cheap as €2 for a litre of beer. Erasmus corner is always full of international people of that's what you're looking for.

One of Lisboa's top 4 neighborhoods!. Barrio Alto is one of Lisboa's top 4 neighborhoods which include the Alfama, Baixa and the Chiado. All are unique and all are worth visiting. The good news is they are not as far apart as they look on a map. I was able to visit and enjoy all four in a single day.

Love The Vibe. It's business as usual during the day , but at night this area is buzzing , with cute little restaurants and tiny little bars...opening up as the sun goes down.The ambience is all about fun and happy drinkers spill out onto the cobbled streets with their drinks in hand ....no drama's about street drinking here....this is serious nightlife and is only a short taxi ride from the main tourist areas. Highly recommended for a fun night for all age groups.

Sardin Festival. The streets were full of people enjoying the Sardin Festival, on the streets, it was a evening of Street Walk with people in Colourful dresses, a must visit place to see the festive moods of Portugese people
Night Life. Very nice area to visit at night, very lively and loads of good bars to choose from. Very busy so only visited once.

One hell of a ride/walk. What a beautiful area, with charm, great restaurants and beautiful buildings and people. We spent 3 days in Lisbon and want to return. Looks and feels like SF with the bridge and hills and charackter.

Old but lively neighbourhood over the hill facing the river and Lisbon downtown. Either you're looking for a nice picture or a cute place to have a meal, or evenif you're in the mood to explore the inner streets and find old time grocery shops or drugstores, your time in Bairro Alto will be like an adventure. Make sure you go down Rua da Rosa, beginning to descend the street near Príncipe Real. There are several small restaurants where you can eat grilled sardines or squids, or a nice cup of tea or coffee.Alsotry to have a drink in the rooftop of the car park in Calçada do Combro. You'll have an astonishing view of all neighbourhood and river. If you are into fashion, you'll find many designers'ateliers. Just have your time there. You'll love it.

Hashish? . Annoying people who try to sell you drugs on every corner unless you are above 60. Otherwise a nice and very touristy place with lots of bars and restaurants. Come here if you want to be among other tourists and don't mind people try to sell you drugs.

The place to be in Lisbon city!. This is my 2nd visit to Lisbon & this area is definitely one of the best! It's narrow streets and corners continue to surprise you. Lots of hidden treasures around each corner. It really comes alive at night. There are so many quirky cafes, bars and restaurants-you really are spoilt for choice. You get a real feel for the true Portugese city life. Definitely worth a visit!
Great sights . Fantastic view of the city. Not far from the apartment I stayed in. Nice little seating area down stairs. Cool tram to take you down the hill.
Hilly but scenic. Definitely worth a visit, wear good shoes as it's very hilly and has some cobbled streets. Places to eat and drink a plenty.

Lively neighbourhood. Bairro Alto is, in my opinion, the nicest area of Lisbon. It is very lively at night, with loads of nice restaurants to choose from. Of course it can be quite noisy if you stay in the area, but you will never get bored!

Typical & beautiful central Lisbon. Bairro Alto is THE neighbourhood to visit and spend time discovering. The many sinuous streets going up and down jsut give you an authentic experience of the city. You'll cross plenty of tapas restaurants, wine bars and cafes if you need to stop to rest. Would also recommend enjoying the place at nightfall as this is when the area actually wakes up for nightlife entertainments.
culture of lisbon. this place is very incredible and shows the culture and history of lisbon. it is located in the centre of lisbon and have wide range of shops from clothes to wine.

Beautiful and Charming neighborhood in Lisbon. Bairro Alto is a cool hip neighborhood in Lisbon or Lisboa. There are lots of great restaurants and many monuments to see while strolling around this beautiful area.
Funky, fun part of the city. This is a great place to wander around and get lost in. There is a fabulous Thai restaurant called Suko Thai. We ate there twice during our week stay..

Lots of culture and Character. Lively area , lost of choices for restaurants , quaint winding streets and a great city view from the top ..not for the faint of heart to walk up the steep incline (take the tram which runs every 10 mins or so

A Must. If you are visiting Lisbon then Bairro Alto is a must. Getting there is a short albeit very uphill walk from the city centre or you can take the cable car for a reasonable price. Once there you will be greeted with some of the best views of Lisbon. Travel the winding streets, visit the small boutiques,restaurants and bars and get lost in the ambiance.

Full of character. Great place for wandering round in all the alleyways. Packed full of restaurants and bars but a totally different atmosphere during the day. Go both day and night to see the contrast. Try some of the old little bars during day full of locals which is a cracking experience and contract with the old pharmacy bar at night. Both great but totally different

Can't go wrong. Walk in and get lost amongst the windy roads filled with surprises around every corner. Bars, restaurants, shopping etc... On the weekends the streets are packed with partying locals. So if you want to meet locals, grab your cigs and check it out.

Good social place. If you are looking for a place where you can talk with your friends, meet new people, listen to the traditional Fado music and enjoy cheap and delicious drinks, this is your place. None can go to Lisbon and without going to Bairro Alto.
Full of character and hidden gems!. Loads of lovely quaint wine bars, cocktail bars, restaurants spilling out onto narrow streets. V quiet during day but comes alive at night.

Authentic Lisbon. This area of Lisbon is cool and quirky. The streets are narrow and authentic with lots of little "finds". There are some great bars and unusual eateries and we spend most of our evenings in this area when in Lusbon,
Definitely recommend a wander through the lanes

young people getting.drunk in the streets. I personally don´t enjoy going there, but it is a very popular place for youngsters. In the morning you find hundreds of plastic glasses of beer on the ground.

Easy, Central and Lively. Great place to stay in Lisbon especially if you're into nightlife. It can be a bit noisy if you're close to some clubs. However, my apartment was on the 3rd floor and I rarely heard anything. Very central and super easy to get to transit. Tram 28 went right in front of my house, plus it's a charming old burg.

Stroll Barrio Alto in Lisbon Portugal. Great place for window shopping. strolling. people watching. there are a couple of small restaurants on the sidestreets that have great cheap food if your on a budget. most afternoons, there are bands/singers playing along the streets.

one night in bairro alto. great place to have a drink or eat or party , people outside , music everywhere
we really enjoyed this hood

Vibrant, fun area. I had a walk around Bairro Alto in the early evening, it had a certain energy to it, the restaurants were busy, music coming from the many bars, lots of people traffic. It was great fun. I ate at one of the restaurants outside and it was nice to observe the goings on. I didn't get a chance to experience a full night out boozing there but it looked like a good place to start.
relaxing walking. In this neighbourhood you can find narrow streets, trendy shops, nice pubs and restaurants. We liked walking through this streets.

Amazing place - the real taste of Lisbon. If you are in Lisbon, it's a must to explore Bairro Alto. You can find lovely places on every corner, unique local bars and restaurants. Make sure you spend a few hours exploring the area - might be handy to wear comfortable shoes.

Bairro alto - place to go. Really nice place to visit with a variety of restaurats, pubs and even small shops with lots of things to buy. There is a huge variety of places to eat (from more posh looking to shabby ones) so everyone can find something for them. Be ready to walk a lot thou (uphill and downhill)...

Bairo Alto - Fado Cafes and Port Wine Institute. Take the fenicular beside the Tourist Office in the Rossio up to the Port Wine Institute for wine tasting & appetizers. Drop into Fado cafes for dinner and entertainment. Check out the Adega Ribatejo

Great shopping and wonderful Lisbon neighborhood.. We had such a fun day strolling through the streets of Bairro Alto, purchasing gifts in interesting stores with unique selections, and when we were exhausted, choosing one of the myriad cafes to have great coffee and pastries.

so so. It´s the place were you can find drugs and prostitution during the night.
I did not liked it... But during the day it´s good

Bairo Alto gives you a real sense of the true Portugal.. I love wandering up and down the narrow streets with their amazing tile buildings and intricately carved doors. Street singers add to the ambience. Life in Lisbon seems to be lived as much out on the street as it does in the many homes of the people. Charming is the word that comes to my mind!
Great neighborhood!. Nice place to hang out - esp around dinner time when all the narrow streets and alleys spring to life and the restaurants fill up.

You cannot ask for a better staff than at Bairro Alto Hotel. We spent three evenings at Bairro Alto Hotel June/July and it is a lovely hotel, but the most impressive part of the stay was the staff who went beyond the usual to be helpful. The people at the registration desk were also fun, the doormen had information we could use, the restaurant staff were very helpful with their English, but our favorite thing to do every evening after very busy days was to go to the rooftop restaurant/bar and enjoy. The view of the river is unobstructed, the drinks were perfect, and again, the staff was delightful.

Old fashioned and all the better for being so. Narrow streets, old fashioned shops and its wall to wall ‘character’, there is nothing quite like this in today’s ultra modern cities. Be brave and look inside some of the old fashioned shops you will find, you might be in for a few pleasant surprises. Jump on one of electric trams as they rattle along the streets.

Fancy a night out?. It is abuzz. Funky. Kinky. All in one and to every taste. Try it, explore. At least one. You may become a regular. If nothing else you will stumble into numerous traditional Portuguese cuisine places at very reasonable prices.

Barrio Alto, unique. Amazing place, the most unique in the city. It’s the heart of Lisbon, you got to go and spent some time there. Don’t be afraid to get in the local pastry shops, the food is amazing. I was struggling going up and down the streets, since it was raining at one point. Be careful if you hit the rain, the streets can be pretty slippery and dangerous. Barrio Alto is the place if you are professional or amateur photography enthusiast, there is a lot to see.
Great at day and night. Great place for the one drink or an all nighter. Range of different bars/mini clubs, great atmosphere.
The heartbeat of Lisbon. Lisbon shuts down pretty early in the evening. That is except for the Bairo Alto. Lots of nightlife and late night grub.

Go there after sunset. What a lovely district! When you go to Bairro Alto during the day, you'll find steep streets, but quiet streets. It makes you wonder: Where is everybody?And then, when it's evening, after 8PM, the windows of the houses open up, and all of a sudden there are bars everywhere! One tip: Eat in Bairro Alto, not in the big squares down-town, leave that to the tourists ;)For more information go to:http://luvo-photography.com/2015/07/07/a-series-on-lisboa-bairro-alto/And:http://luvo-photography.com/2015/07/09/a-series-on-lisboa-night-life-in-bairro-alto/Cheers!
Very trendy. A throbbing, thriving place to eat and drink. We went at 11pm and it was packed. Lots of bars, restaurants and various types of music spill out of the bars. Reasonably priced too.

Highlight of Lisbon's exploration. Probably the most enjoyable part of our trip in Lisbon. Walking around the pretty, mostly deserted, streets is a real pleasure. Picturesque views, tiny cafes will be found along the hike to the top of the hill, but do wear comfy trainers,, because the paved streets are not kind to ladies shoes. When you reach the top, it will get very crowded by people wishing to visit the castle. Just catch a tram to go back down....

Spend your time here. It's hard to put the finger on whats make Bairro Alto so good, but it got a feel that lacks in the rest of Lisbon. Bairro Alto feels more liberal and offers great restaurants, superb pubs/night clubs and the people there where the friendliest in Lisbon.

The real Lisbon. Hills &Funiculars, Parks and squares, shops, eateries and an atmosphere of a long established hilly city loaded with history and unique buildings, wonderful tile and balconies. This area feels like the real thing and noticeably less tourists and more locals. A wonderful spot to explore and at the end the viaduct from the Romans, really cool.

Looking down on a wonderful City!. This is a must experience in Portugal. It is unlike any other city neighborhood or community. If you get the low cost cities pass, you get a free and a bit of an adventure funucular trip up the steep incline to enjoy this happening part of the city. Young people are there to meet, great and imbibe in the culinary and specialty wines and drinks of the area. There are many restaurants to choose from. Walking around the alley streets enhances the feeling that you have discovered a special place. Do not miss it. It is as important as seeing Greenwich Village in New Your city, only a lot quainter. It is an experience not to miss. Don't be intimidated by the youth. Every one is friendly and just out to have a good time, and that I and my then 68 year old husband truly had.

Fun, lots of restaurants and bars, hilly. Lovely to walk around, tiny streets with restaurants and bars in various parts of Bairro Alto. We had a drink in a bar that had a huge sign over it that said 'BAIRRO ALTO' - nice little place. This area is filled with restaurants and bars, definitely a good place to check out! Lively, Portuguese neighbourhood.
Great for a stroll. Loved walking the barrio alto. It is a "lived in" neighborhood, just right for seeing the local environment. Enjoyable restaurants, shops and bars.

Buzzing and vibrant place for the young!. Great place to capture the essence of Lisbon but dont walk in your heels!! There are lots of small bars with people spilling out onto the road drinking and dancing, make sure you visit in the evening.

A fun night out. After reading reviews about restaurants and areas that were open late we decided to head to Bairro Alto. We took a cab there around 10:30pm. The area which consists of a series of streets is complete with bars, and restaurants. People from the bars hang out outside, and most restaurants have outdoor dining. It's fun, low key, and romantic.

Crazy, a lot of people, and noisy ….. This is life in Portugal, there is always people walking around the stress, making party or going to one party .. during the day you will find a lot of small alternative shops at the night a lot of restaurants and bars here. You can go to a good Fado restaurant or you can choice a students bar with cheap cocktails and live music. Important are - OPENMIND AND GOOD SHOES (no high heels)

Best neighbourhood of Lisbon. This is the best neighbourhood to visit: it is not overwhelmed by tourist. You will get a better feel of local life and nightlife. Good shopping and dining. Close to downtown, via tram 28 and great vista points.

Great at night for a walk. That's a lively and touristic neighborhood, full of bars and restaurants. Avoid the ones in the main little streets, with people calling you to enter... try to ask for a recommendation before going or read about them on the reviews. The area do have good places to eat, but before you go, just try to have some in mind, otherwise you'll be in a crowded overpriced one.

Beautiful Bairro Alto... Best experience...in Lisbon. A night time must to do when in Lisbon. Many good food outlets, but try to avoid the street foods, had bad experience and were too expensive. Try the Irish restaurant next to Rossi Trains station..

Great atmosphere in the evening. Bairro Alto is a great neighborhood for taking in nightlife, grabbing a bite to eat, or just roaming the streets taking in the atmosphere. It is touristy, but an enjoyable spot for the evenings after finishing up touring the city during the day. During the week we were there, we probably wound up in Bairro Alto four or five nights, and enjoyed ourselves each night. Energetic atmosphere.
Great area!. This was such a nice part of Lisbon - fab cafes, bars, restaurants, shops, boutique-hotels. Great vibe, safe and fun! Easy to just walk around and take-in/enjoy the atmosphere!

Great neighborhood for dinner. The streets come alive at night. Restaurants galore. Good food and lots of drink. Restaurants are very reasonably priced and you can eat outside and take in the ambiance.

Visit the area but do not eat there. The area is ok for a walk. There are parts of it which offer nice views and some streets have the occasional nice, little shop.The area mainly attracts people at night as it's full of restaurants, many of which outdoors.It's actually all a bit tachy with touts trying to get you into restaurants, false recommendations about how amazing food is at places where the person recmmending clearly takes commission. We tried two or three and the experience was always the same: cramped tables, rude service (literally rude), over priced, tried to charge us fir items we did not consime and so on. Avoid it

Amazing. Wallllllllllllll
This place is great , I got in love with the streets , with the people , with the food
Visit this please

Great views!. We came across this rooftop bar by accident and am so glad we did! It was a beautiful place to watch the sunset (even though we had to wait downstairs for a table and almost missed it so get there early!). The wine was great and very reasonably priced. Excellent service. Great place to have a chill evening and watch the sunset with a view of the bay. Go here!
Trendy fun area. This is super area to walk eat & shop. great atmosphere - lovely boutiques & cafes - can spend hours in this area.

Beautiful. The Bairro Alto area of Lisbon is a wonderful part of the city. It has many beautiful little streets with restaurants, shops and bars. It has quite a few gay or gay-friendly bars which generally open about 10pm.

Cool place to hang out.. Bairro Alto is the best place to visit when in Lisbon. Great stores and allot of nice restaurants and bars if you walk around. Of course some tourist traps also but select restaurant with your nose and you will be happy.
Like a village. Nice scenery! Its like a separate village, great little historical buildings. Try the old trams too, they are cool. One of them takes you up to the castle area, nice views on the way.

Great area!. The Bairro Alto is one of Lisbon's oldest, and most interesting, areas. Lots to see and eat! Take in the views of the city, walk through neighborhoods that are hundreds of years old, take in a great meal.

Charming part of the city with great restaurants. It's called Bairro Alto for a reason! It's a steep climb up into this part of the city, but definitely a worthwhile trip! This seems like the older, more authentic part of Lisbon with interesting shops and restaurants as well as charming architecture. We went to a great restaurant with Fado music that I would highly recommend: Canto do Camōes.

Walk around the neighbourhood at night!. Put time aside to walk through the neighbourhood at least once. Jazz bars, Pasteis de Nata cooking til 1am, excellent restaurants and just the general atmosphere are all amazing.

Narrow streets and nightlife... I like. What a place! At first you will be a bit scared of the narrow lanes and the dim lit alleys... but after a couple of nights there... i loved the place! It is very near to the city and all within walking distance. As u will know, Lisbon is a hilly city, so make sure you put on your walking shoes. There are so many bars for the young.. as well as "Fado" bars. Most of the bars close late... in fact very late. It might be a bit noisy t night (if you're staying there), but if you close the windows, it's ok.

Tram ride around this place was an excellent excursion besides going up and down on the narrow streets during night.. We thoroughly enjoyed going around the hills where lot of youngsters visit for dance and parties during night. Lot of pubs, restaurants and activities start after 11 in the night and goes on till early morning.
Nice place.. We are here a gurap and we enjoyed nice bars and good resturets. Is very good place. Is was very fun.

MUST GO!!! One of the most charismatic places in Lisbon. It's not only a trendy place nowadays, but it is also a place where the old meets the new.Here you can find a misture of different ages neighbours; you can find typical restaurants "Casas de Pasto" where you go for a quick/ cheap meal and eclectic restaurants where you can ear the "Fado"; new business directed to all sorts of people... museums, theatres, old buildings... fantastic landscapes over Lisboa... you can't miss it.If you have limit time, please just go there and feel the ambiance, the narrow streets, the kind people that cross by you on the streets.Be cautious, its a touristic place in Lisbon and you need to be carefull with all the pickpockets around...No way you can go to Lisboa and not visit Bairro Alto.Enjoy it!!! From a lisboeta :)
Gorgeous. Fabulous place, a gorgeous city, bright light, a great capital, the most beautiful in the world: Lisbon.

pretty and interesting. the whole area is filled with restaurants, landmarks and pretty art.It's perfect to go for a walk, specialy during the night while the lights are on. Super romantic for couples. The little train is a bit expensive tho, you can just walk to the top. takes about 10 minutes and a strong pair of legs.

On the Must See List. Bairro Alto is a neighborhood whose dominant features are the ancient steps that will torture your feet while climbing to the top. Of course you can stop off for a drink at any of the many bars and cafes along the way. There are easier ways to get up there but you probably wouldn't remember them after you were home.The lovely park at the top and the view across the city is worth photographing.

Most intense nightlife ever. This neighborhood really packs in the bars and restaurants and to great effect. Quiet and quaint by day (the buildings date back to the 1500s apparently) the narrow pavered streets come alive at night, with people drinking in the streets and a different watering hole every 10 feet (even on weekdays the party goes until 2 a.m.). However I found that the overall atmosphere was convivial and safe, unlike what it might be here in the States.There is something for everyone here, from tiki bars to hole-in-the-wall fado and everything in between. If you enjoy partying, it will be like Christmas every day for you here.

For a lively night. A grid of narrow streets, quiet during the day with the locals getting about their business. At night its restaurants and bars fill up with both locals and tourists. Every sort of food and drink is on offer at mainly excellent prices.

A perfect place for food and drink. This is a region in Lisbon where there are lots of narrow streets with even more bars and restaurants in every door. It seems to be an old district with corresponding character so it is probably no wonder it attracts crowds. Then again, this is partly what summer is about - mixing and mingling and simply having a good time. We had a dinner in some Portuguese restaurant and drinks in several bars nearby. After a hot day it was really refreshing. Even if getting to the place requires some muscle - "alto" means "high" after all. But it is well worth the effort.
Walk and take in the neighborhood. More streets to walk at leisure, shops, cafes, etc. galore. Sections turn raucous at night with the night clubs and bars coming alive.

Have fun with Alcohol. This place is a major place of consume so you can find there a lot of floating minds. Some even have intoxicated smiles on their faces. Make sure you leave the place before the night ends or otherwise you will presence the fatal reality of the plastic and glass garbage from the drinks. It's just immense. So if you are into intoxicants, go for it and have fun.
Best place in Lisbon for party. The best place in Lisbon to hang out with friends and enjoy the Summer Nights with a drink. Always crowded, always alive!

Fell the night life. The street night life, best ever in Lisbon... Intense, strong experience,suitable for youngsters urban Millenials that want to enjoy life. And then take the breakfast in the Hostel after missing the sleep over other things more important...( don't miss the sun rising over Lisbon hills)

Head out around 11pm. To see the Bairro Alto in full swing head out around 11pm-12am. The locals are out, travellers are out and everyone is having a great time. You can walk from bar to bar with a drink in hand, no problem. Bars are small and best suites for small groups so don't bet on getting seats for more than 4-6 people. Great atmosphere and vibe. Absolutely loved it!

A maze of tiny old streets!. Not too much going on during the day. We came across several concerts going on in plazas around, but they didn't start until after 4pm. Tons of eclectic restaurants and bars and would make a fun bar-hopping night. Many bars literally open at 11pm and close at 4 or 6am! Plenty of taxis cruising the streets!

Great district for going out. Bairro Alto is one of the best places for going out in Europe. You can find many lively bars and delicious restaurants and enjoy drinking and eating there for less money.

Bairro Alto, full of surprises.... Bohemian, some quaint boutiques, lively cafés and restaurants... brightly decorated streets and street art graffiti, stairs everywhere going up and down, up and down...elevadores to make your life easier: Elevador da Glòria will take you from the bottom to the top of Calçada da Glòria: brave little Tram built in 1885... gothic Convento do Carmo...in the footsteps of Fernando Pessoa...remarkable Elevador de Santa Justa...
Walking uphill in Lisbon. Before you head off I'd suggest enlarging your map! Tiny streets at all angles make finding places a challenge. Just go with the flow and you will get somewhere eventually
Nightlife. This part of Lisbon is full of club, bars, small and bigger restaurants, this is the center of Lisbon nightlife. The small streets are winding you can walk around watching the daily life.

Views and atmosphere - visit don't stay !. With loads of small restaurants and bars all spilling out onto the narrow cobbles roads, with tables and chairs, awnings, a-boards and people. A lovely vibe on a summer night (we spent many here eating and drinking and chatting to locals, tourists and students alike) I'd imagine it would be a noisy place to try and get any sleep, but safe, with a chilled buzz and a lovely way to enjoy warm evenings, I couldn't recommend a better place to spend an evening. Just be aware of the hills, steep slopes and sometimes slippery stones.
Great Night Out. The Atmosphere here is great. So many little bars and restaurants. OK it is quite touristy but there seems to be quite a lot of locals as well. A great night out
A particular district you must visit.. A definite place to visit, especially at night when the shops and clubs are open. Quite quiet during the day otherwise.

Party neighborhood. Bairro Alto is the place for party lovers. Many bars, clubs and restaurants and all the streets are full of people. Especially on the weekend. Don't go there before 11p.m. there is nothing happen. Afterwards crowded and lovely.

Nice walk or drive. A scenic and engaging walk . Great views and many quaint shops and seafood and beef restaurants. The views are great as well . Take a rental car , but you can also take a taxi or tour .

A good walking district.. We loved to stroll the streets of this interesting neighborhood. If you have time enjoy looking at the tiled facades of the buildings. Enjoy walking/strolling the streets and explore how life is lived. People do not have cloth driers. Thus they hang their clothes outside their apartment which ads even more interest to the buildings. Bairro Alto has various hotels that allow you to explore the city and night life on foot.

So and so. It was veeery crowded, dirty and, overall, too much from every point of view. Maybe for most of the young people it's the perfect place for a night out, but I was a bit disappointed. It's worth the experience though!
fun. worth checking out this area at night.. hills are tough but we used the elevatorfun area and full of restaurants and a great view of the city
Just walk. Walk,eat, drink and hold hands. Just enjoy the atmosphere. Felt safe at all times but my sister in law was pick pocketed. Can happen anywhere , be diligent but not paranoid.

Great Nightlife. We went on a Monday night so the area was not super busy, but it was still a lot of fun. The area is filled with lots of small bars, that you can order a drink from and then walk the small streets with. Very cool atmosphere and not too pricey, a pint of beer was roughly 2 euro. On a weekend I've heard the streets get jammed packed.
