A maze of places - food & shops. During the day this is a fairly unassuming place, but worth a walk round to seek out little shops and some interesting street art. Wait until after dark however and it's a mega choice of small restaurants and bars. The area feels safe to walk round and I am sure you will find a restaurant that suits your tastes.

Take your hiking shoes.... Great shopping in a unique neighborhood. The name means high town, I think, and that is an apt description. Lisbon streets and sidewalks are paved with cobblestones that are slippery, especially when wet. No leather soles...A good way to see Bairro Alto is to take the trolley up and to walk down the many pedestrian only streets.
Great Restaurants. Walk up and down the Bairro Alto street and choose from any of the amazing restaurants, check out some FADO, or just enjoy the hustle and buzz of the neighborhood.

Great place for a walk. Lovely architecture and tiled buildings. A taste of the real Lisboa. Elevadors to get up to Barrio Alto are included on the Carris card (6 Euros per day). Just need to zap your travel card!

Great time. One of the best party district I've been to. There is a lot of bars and clubs everywhere, you can easily find the place which you will like or you can have a drink in one bar and then go to another listen to the music and then check the third one. One night is definitely to little time to taste Bairro Alto.
Happening Scene!. Lots of bars, restaurants music, Fado clubs, people in streets speaking 30 different languages! Had dinner at Fado place and enjoyed ambiance!

The center of the city. Great neighborhood in the center of the city. A lot of night clubs, bars, beautiful streets... If you have one day in Lisbon, going to Bairro Alto is the first thing you should do.

An excellent experience to sit in the terrace bar. Visited Tuesday 7th October 2014. Bairro Alto Hotel terrace Bar on floor 6. Non residents are allowed to go to the small terrace bar for food and/or drink on the 6th floor from 12:30. A really lovely experience to sit sipping your wine overlooking the roof tops and the Tagus. Service is excellent and the prices, although slightly more expensive than other bars/restaurants, are not over priced and the experience is worth it.
Great Place for food. If you like good food and good drinks go there. And I don't what more scrib here, but I need scribe 50 words to complete this reviews.

Top location.. Top loaction, Average-good rooms, average restaurante. A pity that being in the heart of Lisbon, overall does not capture - not by far - the spirit and soul of Lisboa. The exception : the bar in the top terrace.

Best nightlife in Portugal !! . Go to Barrio Alto! Just go there. We went clubbing is some huge club at our first night it was great but you know... Nothing exciting. Than we discovered Barrio Alto. Since then we went there every night of our trip! The have great restaurants of all kinds, but what's really cool are the small little bars each with a different music or live show, so they have 3 or 4 blocks of everythinggggg any kind of music, local, hits, electro, hiphop, salsa, Irish, American rock, and more and more, alcohol is super cheap at the small places but can be really pricy in the more fancy places. Just go and explore yourself :-) if in Lisbon- must be in Barrio Alto, coolest Place! There's nothing like it

Cool place to stroll. When taking in the sights of Lisbon, you should come by Barrio Alto after an afternoon of shopping. A wide variety of trendy eateries. We selected Grapes & Bites for shared tapas and inexpensive wines.

Streamers, Views, and Good Eating. I walked to here from Alfama during the day. The views from the top are spectacular. There are many colorful, streamer-decorated, narrow streets as well as good restaurants for lunch. You'll see lots of evidence of a hopping night life when you pass the many shuttered bars and clubs. If you enjoy walking, go during the day. If you want to party, go there at night!
Fun place!. This place comes alive at night ... lots of bars and restaurants. We wandered around and found some lovely places to have a drink and watch the world go by!

bohenia has changed since I last looked. Lively but I'd describe it as run down. Good cheap food and welcoming staff. Night life is well lively but I might be getting old people urinating in the street doesn't do it for me! Maybe I'm just not bohemian enough. Cross the road and go to Chiado instead. Much nicer.

Such a crazy night! :). Want to taste the real nightlife in Lisbon?Go to Bairro Alto!Have dinner in one of many restaurants in this Bairro Alto. Lots of them have outdoor seating. It's great because this way you can feel the atmosphere of the area. It's so different. I really enjoyed my time here! Crazy!! :)Later, around midnight lots of people started to come and in few time the narrow streets were overcrowded with young people that come to have a drink and dance.Definitely a different experience! Must go!!

Parties and drunks. If you want to have fun and get drunk without spending much more than €10 this is the place to be. Bairro Alto is a very bohemian neighborhood full of students getting drunk and partying. You can get shots for €2 each, entering and getting out of the bars when you want. The streets are crowded and generally very loud.

After dark spot to be. Nightlife in Lisbon centers in the area with every option available.Some very upscale shopping during the day and lots of good coffee shops. A must visit while in this beautiful city.
quite and rooftop deck views. very quite small good service, and great location for walking and or trolley rooftop deck has a quite fantastic view of harbor

A Fantastic Hat Shop. The Bairro Alto is a great place for shopping and if you are after hats, then 'A Fabrica dos Chapeus' in Rua da Rosa is the place to go. There is a very wide range of hats for both men and woman for any occasion. The staff are so knowledgeable and helpful. You can get anything made in any colour desired and hats can be ordered online and shipped anywhere in the world. Highly recommended.
Night!. Lots of bars, reataurants, people, music, alcohol... A lot of fun, but also a lot of drunk people!It's nice to visit one night to experience it, but be aware of the drug dealers!
Beautiful. Great restaurants, bars and shops. You take the tram number 28 and you can travel though the whole old town and city Lisbon from above. It is beautiful!
Beers. Winding narrow rounds, bars and resturants on every corner, in evey building, nuck and cranny.If you want night life this is the place to head, and it was cheap.

Not all its cracked up to be. We went here on the assumption that it had the best places to eat at in Lisbon, but we found most places in the centre were overpriced and the food didn't look great. On top of this I didn't feel safe, we encountered several leering men making lewd comments and were offered drugs in a forceful way several times as we walked around. We ended up finding some nicer places on the outskirts of the area so I would suggest that if you're looking for a nice meal and drinks
Very touristic but. Trust your instinct and you will find some little gems, anyway Lisbon is filled of them if you really go out of the tourist path and you will fall in love

colourful. after reading the rave reviews of this small area of Lisbon i guess we were a little disappointed. Its got colourful ribbons hanging over the streets but in general it is a bit of a tatty area. worth a visit i guess to see the tram elevator which has some really smart street art alongside and the views from above the park.
best place to stay in Lisbon. perfect location, lively, plenty independent bars and restaurants, few tourist traps, think London's Soho

Super fun. Liked everything about the aerea.Amazing, eclectic, traditional, touristy, and fun bars, pubs, shops, restaurants, and lots of super wine tasting places. Just take the elevator to the top, and explore!

Keeps you fit. Took the tram up into Bairro Alto, it's a very steep climb. If you buy a combined bus, metro, tram ticket (about 6 euros for a day), you can use that. Some good views at the top of Lisbon, Convent is free of charge and there is another nice church. Walked down, steep but easier than going up.

Night life for every taste. Beautiful bairro (neighborhood) with an intense night life that combines top notch restaurants and bars. It is also a place where you will mix with a lot of tourist and a lot of locals, so it gets really interesting. As many other places in Lisbon, part of the fun is getting there by foot climbing the endless stairs and discovering secret corners and little streets. Chose either to walk around and go into a restaurant that catches your eye or reserve in one of many traditional/fancy/modern places you find here.
outstanding location. our pension/Hotel was here. see Pensao Londres review. excellent zone to be able to do on one's own, with just a street map.

Partying. Bairro Alto is the rights place to go in the evening and night! During the day, the streets seems like empty but in the evening the bars open and you will meet there everyone. You can enjoy some beer in the street or in a bar and go to the Erasmus Corner. All students know this place and if you want to dance there are also some clubs.

Charming walking through neighborhoods. Took the funicular up the hill. It might have been quicker to lean into the hill and walk up, but the old trams are interesting and we were photo-bombed by the funicular operator! Once at the top, just wandered around in and out of shops and churches

A little bit of this and a little bit of that. My wife and I really liked the feel of the Barrio Alto - it's sort of old and a little sleazy - in a good way. It really doesn't come alive until after 8 or 9 p.m. then all of these little bars and restaurants really come alive. From certain points you get great views of the city too. Fully recommend.
Amazing place. A place with old buildings full of history. It makes Lisbon a city of a "must come back". Love it, love it

A very typical Bairro of Lisbon.. This is, arguably the most famous Lisbon Bairro. It is a very old part of Lisbon and it famous for it's " Fado" houses (restaurants).A must see, if you are in Lisbon,Portugal.
Nice. I like the charme of the area with old buildings, little streets, a lot of cozy bars and Restaurants.

My fav. It is my favorite spot for night life and restaurants. The place comes back to life more in the evening. We were there one day in the morning and the place was not as charming as it is in the evening. Many bars and restaurants in the area, you can pick and choose, most of them are good. We had some good fun in Bairro Alto. On some busy nights you will have to wait for a table, I did not see many restaurants which take reservations.

Get caught in the mood. The Bairro is a must see in Lisbon. Packed full of restaurants and bars. It really starts to get going around 11pm. Great atmosphere.
A bonus is unlike coastal resort strips, you don't get plagued by dealers constantly offering a stream of drugs! Go, eat, drink and have fun!

The place to BE!!!. My partner and I rented a flat for the 3 days we were there not really knowing where we were going to stay. The mornings are nice and quaint and beautiful to look around and take pictures and just discovered the beautiful architecture the Barrio has to offer. The nights are a completely other story. ITS A PARTY!!! If you are a light sleeper this is NOT where you want to stay. Or if you care that someone is sitting on your doorstep having a drink then this is NOT where you want to stay. BUT if you are looking to stay in the equivalent of New Orleans then YES! It is so much fun. You can bar hop. You can get AMAZING food and shops around and it all goes on till about 5am. The area is beautiful and a must visit because it gives you a true feeling of old Portugal and at night its just the same with the flavor of the party. As always just be mindful of the streets you are going up and down since basically the town consist of alleys on a hill and some areas can get a little sketchy and also at night there are people dealing some stuff you may or may not want to buy. Overall though ITS A MUST SEE!!!

Excellent. If you don't like bairo alto there is something going wrong with you.You will find many stores available for smart shopping,drinking coffee and during the night amazing bars for all kind of tastes.Plus fado,jazz,blues whatever.An amazing place-neighborhood
nice place. Very nice place to go shopping if you like Vintage style,lots of small. Restaurants. And cafes,with lots of people.

Stunning I wish I stayed there and had longer.. I went there on a very rainy afternoon but loved loved loved the atmosphere. Its not as shiny as other similar areas in other cities e.g. Las Ramblas, Barcelona, but its all the better for that. People were nice as well.
Very interesting. It is very interesting if you visit this place at night. There are a lot of different clubs and bars.
Nightlife!. Lots of bars, restaurants, shops and huge crowd! There are many kinds of places to choose but most people just stay in the street.

bring your walking shoes. This is the "village" I look for in every city I visit. The twists and turns of narrow streets, the laundry hanging from balconies -- all feels more real than the lines at tourist attractions. Just know that Bairro Alta means high neighborhood, so you will be walking up and down cobblestoned steets. Worth the effort!

potuguese atmosphere with good night view. If you would like to enjoy the atmosphere of Potugal, here is the best place for you. In the morning, here is really nothing to see. But in the evening, here becomes a great place for hanging around. Even I don't drink alcohol, I still feel the potuguese atmosphere and happiness here. If you go to Lisbon, don;t miss it.The only bad thing may be you have to take care of your steps, the floor is not perfectly built up and the street is always quite steep.
Great area. Fab area to visit. Lots of little cobbled streets with wonderful bars and restaurants to spend all day in. Really pretty part of the city.

Fun place!. Lots of little restaurants and great little bars with cheap drinks to boot.A very safe place at night even though dark little streets. Easy to get lost, but everyone so helpful in guiding you back to your destination.

nigthlife. it is a great place for alternative and young people, everybody in the needle of the streets, lots os young people, nice music, if you like the sound you get into the bar and tip the players if you want
Old traditional "Bairros". If you like an excellent place to have a drink and meet other people, try this traditional "Bairro". You will never forget it! Enjoy yourself...

Atmospheric. A real treat to enjoy the vibe here. Centrally for bars and restaurants in the traditionally Fado music area it has much more. Varied places to eat, wide range of music tastes, we ended up in the Jazz Cafe. Wonderful to eat outside hearing all the different types of music. Suggested to take care when alone, you can get hassled but we didn't feel threatened.

Kicks off at night. In all tourist literature there are recommendations to venture to Bairro Alto for a good night out. Apart from some nice restaurants it's a general hubbub of twentysomethings standing around socialising. Great for stag and hen do's. We preferred to go dancing somewhere or do drinks and dinner at Praça do Comercio.Not my favourite place in Lisbon but definitely worth a walk and a drink or two.
lovely area in Lisbon. Beautiful old part of town. Lovely to get lost in, as we did frequently.This is the most central part of Lisbon, so a definite must-go.

Nightlife of Lisbon. Tradicional neighbourhood from the 16th century. If you visit it during the day it´s very calm, with restaurants and groceries shop and local people going by. If you visit it during the night it could be very crowded and noisy (in a good way) with a lot of people with their beverages on their hand, and hundreds of cafés, restaurants, bars and pubs open ´till late. It´s a MUST for nighttime lovers since the 80´s. You have tons of different choices, from jazz, blues, fado, rock, goth, house, reggae, etc... you name it!

Not really worth a detour at daytime.. Don't bother to go there by day -unless you're into such sights- as it's pretty dead and you will just see the downsides of such a place exposed in bright sunlight, i.e. Mildrew and decay, people sobering up in their own piss, feces smeared on the walks and fresh bloodstains on the pavement... But i didn't felt threated though even as a single travelling woman.
night time. Love the pubs, the prices, the music of live bands, the streets of multicultural beautifull people, and the barmaids. Don´t like the smell of piss in the ally.
Great Nightlife. Very Lively place that comes to life after dark, lots of restaurants bars etc, something for everybody
fun is in the air. great place to mingle with locals and other tourist. For a good time this area is a must. the drinks are cheap and the people friendly.

Excellent place. Don't let the "stay safe" section of certain websites or some of the worst reviews here put you off, as long as you ignore the hashish men, keep your wits about you and take care of your belongings (as you should do anywhere anyway), Bairro Alto is pretty safe and brilliant fun.I haven't seen it during the day, but it is a great nightspot. You can eat in many restaurants of all kinds and all prices, great food to be had. You can pub crawl through the multitude of bars, finding some gems with massive beers for under €2 (get a normal size beer for about €1). You can find many bars with life music and some great talent.Roam the narrow alleyways and explore as much of the Bairro as you can, you'll not regret it!
Walking Barrio Alto. This an area where you should walk. Narrow streets and little bars.You should go there by night.Very lively.Bring good shoos
Casual fun, bar hopping area. Fun to go out in groups, casual atmosphere, plenty of bars, lounges and restaurants to choose from. Good for bar hopping. Open late. Not romantic.

Great neighborhood!. This neighborhood is relatively quiet during the day, with shops and restaurants, but really comes to life at night. We heard there were anywhere from 100-250 bars that can please every taste. On Fridays and Saturdays, the streets get filled up like New Orleans during Mardi Gras and you are able to bar hop and drink in the streets.

Great nightlife . Bairro Alto is packed with bars and restaurants... I loved it, we kept hopping from one bar to the next, listened to some fado music, had good meals n drinks.. Def go there when you re in Lisbon

Interesting nightlife. If you don't like crowds this might not be something you will want to do. The streets of Bairro Alto at night are similar to Mardi Gras. Great bands and inexpensive drinks. You can walk around with your drinks and pub crawl until 4 am. In the past Bairro Alto was not considered very safe at night, but it appears that some gentrification has occurred and I felt it very safe.
Not my style. We went for fado music and restaurant ,the restaurant was really bad and went for a walk and a drink after.If you are above 40 years old,forget it try somewhere else.
Explore, enjoy!. Eat! Food and wine are incomparable and lovely! The people in the bars and restaurants are delightful.

Summer evening outside in the streets. We have been lucky that it was warm in the evening. All croud was outside in the street of Bairro Alto, beer or drink in the hand and just chatting with anybody who passed. Bar next to bar, life music all around the corner, that's how I imagine a nice day out. Hard to believe it was only a Tuesday evening. I can not imagine what the week-ends might be like... wauh!
the best night life in town. until 3am you can buy all drinks and dink in the street. many restaurants and bars with open doors to your desire. fantastique

Talk a walk and enjoy!. Ideal for friends who want to have fun and have a drink or a cup of coffee!
Also romantic in some points for couples.

High energy!. Great area for restaurants and clubs. Went to a great blues club, with good drinks and entertainment. We're a couple in our 50's but enjoyed several nights out there. Even late at night the area felt pretty safe. It was jammed with people! We walked 20 minutes back to our hotel via stairs, and escalators after midnight and never felt unsafe. Fun!

The Hip place in Town.. This neighbourhood is one of the hippest places in all of Lisbon. It has been around for a 1,000 years and it's the place to be to enjoy the great nightlife Lisbon has to offer. It's full of trendy restaurants and clubs.
The night heart of Lisbon. It's the heart of the town at night in Lisbon. It worth wondering at night it's exactly where you'll find everyone partying every night.

Not up to expectations.. Went up by funicular in the afternoon - apparently it livens up at night but during the day the streets are full of bags of rubbish. We also got charged nearly 5 euros for a tea and coffee, whereas everywhere else we only paid between 2 and 3 euros.
Perfect place to go out. Cheap drinks, great parties and all kind of atmosphere!You can find shots, beers, cocktails, etcYou can also buy pastry instead of salty snack when youi are "drunkgry"

Roof Top Bar. We did not stay in the Barrio Alto for our time in Lisbon. We only went to the hotel to visit the Hotel Roof Top Terrace Bar.The sole bar tender was very polite, informative, helpful and help us relax on the roof top Terrance bar.The prices were reasonable considering we are in a capital city and similar to London prices if a little cheaper.The view is excellent over the estuary and the suspension bridge in the back ground. There was the usual ambient chill out music playing in the back ground.Access is easy from the square and very near Sao Roque and tram 28 stops.Well worth a visit.

Great atmosphere and nice bars. It is really nice to hang out in Bairo Alto, you can meet al sorts of people and also get really cheap booze. I would recomend it to anyone in Lisbon, looking for a good time.

Nice place to walk about. We are not really overwelming by the place. Lots is tourists, nothing really justifies the hipe. But is a visit you should do, because everybody at your place I'll ask you abouti, but don't expect much. Restaurants there are overpriced and not so good. Lisbon is much more that this...

Best part of town. When you are in Lisbon you have to visit this historic part.
Small streets with bars an restaurants some with live Fado music
gret experience
Bairro Alto. Fantastic squares, narrow streets, bars & restaurants flowing onto the streets ... Unique book shops, designer shops & quirky products. Very earthy & creative artisan community.

great neighborhood. Everybody must visit the streets of Barrio Alto, although its steep slopes.
The views from miradouro de St. Pedro de Alcantara are magic.

This is Lisbon!. what can we say about Lisbon without talking about bairro alto?typical houses and streets, local and foreign people, different shops, great views and drinks.This place is magical during all day: If you want to go during the day and explore the small and local shops or just even look around at the architecture and paintingson the walls you can.Or you can go by night, explore the best bars and best drinks, listen to some outside music or just chill with friends this is the place!I just love being around
Listen to some acoustic music in a shady square. Lovely feel here...bit more boho. We enjoyed the variety of shops and bars there are here, not very commercial ones though.

nice place to wonder around and eat. Lots of very nice and typical restaurants!! also clubs for Fado lovers and trendy shops. Take elevador da Gloria from placa de restauradores to save time climbing the hill!!

Nightlife. Bairro alto is a picturesque working class quarter dating from the 16th century that has traditionally been the city's bohemian haunt of artists and writers. Its grid of streets is quiet during the day, but is transformed at night into the city's vibrant nightlife quarter. Behind colorful and graffiti-ridden façades is a variety of traditional and international restaurants, tourist-packed Fado Houses, and a multitude of bars and alternative shops that stay open until late at night. Throughout the week, and especially on weekends you'll find people of all ages, backgrounds, and lifestyles bar-hopping through the cobbled lanes or standing outside with a drink in hand.A must see

Best food we had in Portugal. We made our way to Bairro Alto by metro and Funicular to the lovely view from the top at night overlooking Lisbon. The best food we had on our entire 2 week trip was at Faz Frio Rua Dom Pedro V 96. It was not well identified on the front of the bldg. but it is on the right as you're heading right past the overlook. You will see the 96 on the bldg. We had their amazing seafood paella. We had to wait for it to be prepared as you do with paella anywhere, but it was well worth the wait. While in Lisbon, we had been saying no to the bread and butter but because of the long wait, we decided to keep it and eat it with our wine. A great decision because it was so good. This is a very small restaurant and although there were only two people when we arrived, it was packed when we left. We talked to locals celebrating their anniversary and they had been many times (a good recommendation). We also talked to the owner (he has owned it for over 20 years) and knew we were at the right spot. Great!

Fun neighborhood to explore. As with much of Lisbon, this neighborhood has lots to see and explore other than the main touristy sights, and we underestimated the time required to really take it in. Honestly I wish we'd allowed for more time in Lisbon in general, as the city offers way more than some guidebooks lead you to believe. I liked wandering around, seeing the churches, poking in the cool shops (tile shops, used bookstores, etc.), and when walking down the Rua da Misericordia, reading the info and looking at photographs of the Carnation Revolution in 1974 that led to the end of Salazar's Portugal. Do yourself a favor and spend an afternoon poking around here, though I'd suggest starting at the top and working your way down - the streets are steep!!* If you like my review, I appreciate you clicking the 'helpful' button; those of us who take the time to write reviews live for those and it motivates us to do more :) *

Fascinating late night neighborhood. Wander through the scruffy narrow streets of the Bairro Alto by day and you might think it is not very appealling at all. The buildings look old and run down, graffitti on the walls, fly posting on the shutters and a selection of last nights garbage on the side of the street. Go there after 10pm at night and it is an entirely different vibe! The whole place comes to life, the graffitti covered front doors are thrown open, revealing bar after bar after bar. The dingy looking shop fronts turn out to be inviting looking restaurants with tables outside and music is coming at you from all angles. Everyone is having a good time in what appears to be Lisbon's daily street party. The bars though numerous, are little more than single rooms a few feet wide, so the party happens on the street. Grab yourself a mohito in a big plastic cup and wander about until you hear some tunes you like. There really is something for everyone in this area, whatever food or music you like. Its a great atmosphere. Bars wind up around 2am.

Good place for night and drinking..... I went there in first weak in August ,, I spend some time there, I was happy coz I were enjoying my life according me . Than I got Bairro alto for night life ,, I went there with friends ,, we did enjoy there too much.. There is many restaurant which provide good food. Some Indian ,Italian , Portugess traditional restaurant and seafood restaurant ,,that was my best restaurant ,,and nice place for enjoying as well as for getting good picture , and memorable time for your live,,, i will recommend that place to my friend when then will come to enjoy Thierry holiday in Lisbon ,,,

Pub after pub. Great spot , nearly too much choice. A bit of everything of everyone up there and would rate on of the best pub areas and definitely the biggest I've ever been in. Wear comfy shoes as everything is on a hill

Fun!. Half asleep during the day, but really comes alive at night. Quirky little shops, just as quirky bars, and lots of life in the street. Probably as touristy as the rest of the city centre, but this is the place where it doesn't matter. I hate touts, but strangely, this is the place where I don't care about that either. The highlight of Lisbon!

Expire old Lisbon. Stairs, narrow lanes, steep streets, winding paths, unexpected squares and beautiful views. That's what you will find in the high quarters Bairro Alto and Chiado in Lisbon. One moment you stand on a cozy square with full terraces and the other moment you walk by a narrow, lane along dilapidated buildings. Take a tram and enjoy all of this very old part of Lisbon.

Bast place for night life lovers ,,,. I went there with my hubby and friends , this place good for couple but I think that place was not good for kids in night ,, we didn't go with kids ,, anyway,, we did enjoy there too much as well as we took dinner there ,,come back hotel after enjoying our night life ...

A little gritty but fun. A bit grittier than the Alfama but much to see both day and night. Easy to walk to and then it is just wandering the streets. Full of restaurants and shops. Don't miss the restaurant, Stasha!

Center of all. Lisbon as it was,if you want to experience true Lisbon together with Alafama this is the place to look for. This is where everything happens,numerous restaurants offering all kinds of meals,fado music on every corner,street performers and lots of fun. This place lives 24 hours, you can always find something to do here. Best to experience it at night time when you can enjoy it at most.

Very cool neighborhood day or night. Picturesque neighborhood with delicious views of the river from atop the hill. By day, various cafes and restaurants offer local dishes; by night, this is the premier social center of Lisbon. You can find young people, families, tourists, locals, all coming together to experience one of the countless pubs, bars, restaurants, fado houses, etc.

One place not to be missed in lisbon!!!. This is one place that just cannot be missed for nightlife. There is something for everyone, food if you just want to eat, bars if you want to drink, and every kind of music. Most of the drinking is done on the streets. The atmosphere is vibrant and exciting.

Going out. Tons of bars and restaurants of all kinds to I go out at nightLots of people strolling in a beautiful bohemian atmosphere The only sad thing is the tash I the morning...people throwing their plastic glasses and empty beer bottles on the ground Need both more trash bins and good education...

Great place and lovely city view!. To arrive there is not easy at all, I mean if you want to take the adventure to arrive there by foot I wish you luck! I leave my lungs on that path BUT it really worth the effort. Once you are there you will be in a very neighbourhood with an stunning view of the city, lot of places to have a drink, to eat or just seat in a bench listening some Fado in the street.
For party goers. This is where the night life is. There is even an Irish pub! The bars a small but a lot of people just socialise outside. Be wary of pick pockets.

Bairo alto great street. Nice view, good vibes , happy people, bars and good music. Lots of youth partying life! I went there with 2 of my cousins and meet nice young people from over the world. I recommend the girls among you to wear comfortable shoes and not high hells!!!

Let's party !. This is THE place to party ! With a melting-pot of nationalities, this is the ideal place to meet international people, to enjoy a drink in a bar (or several bars), because this district wakes up at the end of the afternoon, and becomes a real party area ! All the bars are open, you can take your drink away, try another bar, talk outside with people !Perfect place to dance, to tlak and drink ! (On the other hand, the bars close around 2h, and so that you have to move to the Docks !) :-)

Nice area to enjoy the real way of living in Lisboa. Liked the nightlife in all the little bars and restaurants, nice atmosphere! We had an apartment is this area, which made us feel at home!Nothing I disliked!
didn't get it. supposedly its the party place for 500 years… however, it was full of kids drinking beer in the middle of the street. not my favourite place to visit.

Place for drinks and meet people!. At night this is the busiest area in town. Packed with bar and people, bairro alto is where you find local and tourists from all around the world. I do recommend to go to Mahjong Bar, is super cool!

One big party zone in the night. Quiet during daytime, but in the late nights its party all over. Please stay nearby (like in Casa Balthazar), and you just need a couple of minutes to walk home after visiting a restaurant or a cosy wine bar.

Boring area at night. I had an in advance impression of a live neighborhood full with galeries, pubs and nightlife. Instead, I found quite a dar and and only a few visitors in it. Not worth vising again.

Wonderful neighborhood. Cafes, restaurants, shops, and cobblestone streets. Visit Cork & Co. and A Vida Portuguesa. Central to most of the sites. Near Alfama, not too far from Belem.Watch out for dog poop in the streets.

The place to be in Lisbon.. Bairro Alto is full of atmosphere - bars, music, restaurants - Fado!!!! I loved the little narrow streets. Everything is so magically different up there. Not much of an atmosphere by day but at night - it just comes to life. During our holiday in August I felt it got quite chilly here late at night. Many of the better restaurants were distributing blankets!!!!!

Typical Nightlife!. Bairro Alto is a very typical neighborhood in central Lisbon with many bars, restaurants, Fado's house etc.It´s a unique experience because Bairro Alto has narrow streets and typical portuguese architecture.
The place to go out at night. The place to go out at night - we can hang around through dozens of bar and clubs because all are extremelly fun.

What an interesting area!. Quiet in the mornings, cosy during the day, charming in the evenings and crazy at night. These streets are schizonfrenic and very cool. It´s genuine and a bit run down, but hey-thats the charm with the party blocks of Lisboa.Walk in, dance out (at night)!

Lovely Area. We spent a lot of time in this area during our trip. It has a large number of places to eat and drink and is always heaving with tourists. It comes alive at night and there is always the sound of live music playing.While you are here you should enjoy some of the restaurants where you can sit outside and watch the night come in, then head to the bars that come alive after 10. Nice restaurants for couples seeking a romantic evening in the fresh air.
Very interesting - go at night!!. Awesome area with loads of happening bars clubs and restaurants. Really fantastic vibe and lots to see eat and drink.

What's it about?. The Bairro, or neighbourhood, as it is popularly known amongst Lisbon teenagers, is the place for hanging around after 11 at night for drinking beer and shots and just talk in the middle of the street. The bairro has some very good restaurants, however, try to get in and out before 11. Tourists who stand out are a good target for young pick pockets so beware. I would pass it up, although interesting, it is not worth the trouble as there are other excelent examples of old town Lisbon, such as Alfama, Graça or Mouraria, a pluricultural tical bairro.

Going up and down and all around!. Lot's of restaurants, bar, places where you can listem to Fado singer and eat. Of course these places are for tourists but prices are fairly ok and so is the food. You also have scenic views, stairs from here to eternity and when you think you are already up there, well think again you are not. There is also little shops and people who still lives in that neighborhood. You need to visit it when in Lisbon.

A MUST - Diversity & Fun define Bairro Alto. Fantastic place to go and grab a drink in one of the many available bars and just hang out in the street speaking with friends. Can be a bit crowded in the main streets and filled with people from different nationalities and styles. A good place to go between 22h until 1h, more or less. Fairly safe and you shouldn't have any problem in terms of thefts. Very frequent to see police patrols in the streets. If you are driving I recommend parking in "Luis de Camões" square park. Very close to Bairro Alto.More info here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bairro_Alto

Very interesting - go in the daytime. The neighbourhood is fascinating. If you just read travel reviews, you might think it is a bit sketchy. You can see it starting to sketch up in the evening, so unless you are into that, go towards home/hotel after dinner. Here is what the neighbourhood is great for:1) Scenic views2) Independent shops (chain stores are nearby in the Chiado district)3) BOOKSTORES!!! Books everywhere and prices much better than in, say, the UK or Germany.4) Wine bars and Fado restaurants

One of the best places to go out at night in Lisbon. During the day you don't have much to do in Bairro Alto... but from 9:00 pm all people starts to go there and from 11:00 pm there are tens of thousands of people there to dinne or just to have a beer.

A must see for anyone who likes fun. If you like to have a good time --- you MUST visit Bairro Alto. Whether you are into restaurants or bars, this place has amazing versions of both.
100% worth seeing for anyone visiting Lisbon.

The place to be a night!. Bairro alto is the place to be at night, here they have hundreds of restaurant, small boutiqs and clubs. The district is crammed with houses everywere and small cobblestone streets. Its outdoor seating and socialising everywere and always people partying late nights are normal here. Many good fish restaurant, great wine and good caipirinha.

Not that impressed. Maybe because its more tourist-oriented, I was not that impressed with the Barrio Alto scene... definitely worth a visit and we had a very good lunch, but for the 'real Lisbon' we would stay in the Alfama neighborhood next time...

Very Pleasent neighborhood. A pleasant place. Full of excitement and people of all nationalities and groups. With plenty of live music and plenty of bars and restaurants with sidewalk table. An environment very full life, but it was the summer season

Walk around for a place for dinner. good place to walk around to experience the old city of Portugal and choose a place to have dinner in.
Its pretty busy in the morning and at night

If you are young & like to party this is for you.. An area that's pretty run down with graffiti.. Some poor & some amazing artwork! It's a now trendy area where the young live with the old who have been in this area for years.At night time this area is the scene of the largest party in Lisbon nightly! People are everywhere all over the small streets up the hills partying, socializing & drinking on the streets! Simply go into one of the pubs or clubs.. Grab a drink and hit the streets to people watch! Make sure to enjoy some Ginja AKA a penalty shot!
Central. This area was good for relaxing walks, visiting cafees, restaurants and skopping. We like the area for beeing very central, but there is trafic in the area.

Sounds of FADO to the RAP. This is the best place to: WALK . FLIRT . DRINK . EAT . DANCE. LOUD . LOVE . TALK (if you can...)Here you can leastean sounds of all styles of music. Since FADO...chill out... jazz... rap... in two words: GOOD MUSIC!!!!!I'll be back all weekend!!!!!!!!!!
Nights in a great atmosphere. Lots of restaurants and bars, great choice for the evening, very close to the centre of Lisbon. Not dangerous.

Charming. Bairro Alto was left relatively untouched by the earthquake that destroyed much of Lisbon. We visited during the day, taking the tram up the hill. On alighting you have pretty gardens with wonderful views over Lisbon. There's a nice bar here. It's easy to walk around the bairro along quiet cobbled streets and admire the tiled buildings. There's also a heavily decorated church which is worth a look. A pleasant way to spend an afternoon and likely a different experience from the evening party atmosphere.
Great atmosphere. Very busy at night. Lots of restaurants and bars. Careful of the uneven surfaces of sidewalks and streets if you have been drinking too much.
Urban, great atmosphere in the evenings. Just grab a drink from a bar and go outside and blend with the people! A glass of sangria 1 €, wow! :D

The place to be after 9:00 pm. This is the place to have a good time every day after 9:00 pmEvery day of the week the streets are full of people having a good time. Lots of restaurants with every kind of food you can imagine,Places where you can sit and drink a cup of wine or a cold beer in a hot sumer day, heard great Fado.

Overrated IMHO. A few trendy/design shops - not offering anything particularly interesting - mainly design items that were trying to echo NY, LA, London youth culture or urban chic - rather than anything original

Alcohol abound. You can smoke inside, and drink outside. In fact, the bars can give you your cocktail or beer or whatever in a plastic cup so you can bring it elsewhere to continue drinking. If you like alcohol, and like expploring/chilling in the streets while you do so, you'll like Barrio Alto.
Buzzing nightlife and Fado music. The Bairro Alto is a classic area for Fado music and nightlife. Strol the narrow streets and review the menu's of the buzzing restaurants.
Disappointing. Great place if you want to drink and eat with all the tourists, but not much more than that. If you are seeking authenticity, Alfama is better.

Almost Perfect. I stayed here for 4 nights in mid-July and thoroughly enjoyed it (this was me second time staying here -- the first was about two years ago). I was in Room 310 (which I think was classified as a Deluxe Room). It was quite nice and roomy, though the bathroom was very cramped and only had a tub shower, which I do not really like. A friend was in a Suite (306), which was very nice indeed if you can afford it. I like everything about the hotel -- the staff was helpful and friendly, the breakfast was fine, and the location could not be better. The rooftop bar is a real highlight with an amazing viewed toward the river -- but be warned that at peak times it can get very busy and a table may be hard to come by and the service can be a bit slow as the staff get deluged with drink orders. It is difficult to imagine that there are many better options in Lisbon. I will be back.
Nice area to relax and shop. We stayed right in the city center.. and it is really close to this wonderful area. Lots of cafes where we can relax after a whole day of exploring the city.
Charming and what a view!. Looks like a postcard. White buildings and clay roofs. A great little gem. Make sure you wear flat shoes as lots of bumpy roads.

stunning, lively, amazing. Just got back from a fantastic long weekend away in Bairro Alto, the restaurants and bars are lively and full of locals and holiday makers, met some great people, even though we didn't speak Portuguese, you could get by as most waiters and bar staff spoke English and also taught us phrases to get by.Couldn't walk anywhere without stopping to take photos such a pretty place even with the graffiti, some buildings had amazing artwork sprayed onto them. Loved going out at 11pm every evening and stopping for tapas at 2am you can always find somewhere to eat and drink at all hours, favourite restaurant/bar The Decadente in Rua de Sao Pedro de Alcantara turned up at 12am and was seated outside, food was fantastic and the best cocktail 'Mr Smith'. Already planning our next trip but will definitely book a week as a weekend was just not long enough to take it all in!
Bohemia meets Fado. Good for promenading, slow drinking, eating, and being rocked by live or Jockey'd music. Best to do the last three together.

party central. no matter your age if you enjoy a night out on the town with continuous entertainment it seems as though this neighbourhood has stolen the title for one of it not the best areas to party in Europe now. Old school Lisbon still has style.

Great place to go out at night!. Bairro alto is one of the best places to go out at night in Lisbon. It's a trendy place where you'll find a lot of locals and tourists as well. There is always a good combination of both. You have "tons" of bars and restaurants from cheap to high end. Must do in Lisbon
Very lively!. Lots of restaurants, bars and wine/tapas bars. Lovely to wander round for the evening. A good mix of ages.
Great night life. Loads of bars in this area, ranging in prices from the very very cheap small bars, to the more classy rip off ones.
Wander and Enjoy. We spent a lot of time wandering this neighborhood. At night the bars spill crowds into the streets.
Great place to be at night. The variety of restaurants, the narrow streets, the atmosphere and the Jazz Club. We particularly liked Grapes and Bites and BA Wine bar.
Bustling Party Central. A mecca of good bars and restaurants around every corner. A must for visitors to Lisbon.Only negatives are the amount of street touts selling flashy tat and hats.
Astonishing.... We went there around 11pm, people were everywhere, decoration and lightings were amazing, we felt as if it was a carnival!! Great atmosphere...
Hustle and bustle at its best. The choice of restraints and bars is immense, the streets are quaint and the atmosphere is second to none

Beautiful streets of Lisboa!. Barrio Alto is beautiful! Its all hills so keep that in mind! But
you get awesome views of the city and coast.
Also, at night you can find everyone hanging out in the street drinking, talking, and dancing. My favorite place to hang out in Portugal

don't miss. If you like city walks/strolls - don't miss this neighborhood , located on one of Lisbon steep hills . If you are lazy - use the little tram /Gloria elevatore starting its way up the hill near Restauradores station . You can try and climb the hill on foot on the railtrack stopping to take a breath every now and then , observe gigantic Street Museum Artworks , mount the observatory Miradouro Al Cantara , stop there for a cold beer , Once you're at Bairro Alto take a stroll in the small crisscrossingalleys and in the lovely Jardim Principe Real small park , surrounded by small fleamarket and fruit counters .Don't miss entering the building opposite the park (Praca Principe Real 26 ) to see a beautifull renovation work and enjoy a glass of wine in the patio of the Le Jardin Cafe Bar Restaurant like we have enjoyed . Looking at the menu and the prices of this establishment , we decided to have dinner and listen to Fado the following evening , but we failed to show up beeing too tired .In short - make sure to be in Bairro Alto
Vibrant feel. Great place for an afternoon drink in de largo carmine square, great music by local street bands, don't be afraid to till them too :)
always nice. the place to go out and have drink or something to eat always niceeasy to find your way around and always new experiences

A very cosy but alive part of Lisbon!. Last year I was in Lisbon for a few days with friends and one of the things we did more than once was going to Bairro Alto at night. Bairro Alto is THE spot to party, drink, chat or get familiair with the locals. With dozens of bars and clubs this is the place to be if you want to go out there and dance the night away (or just have a good time in general ;) ). The Portugese love to party and drink outside the bar or club. It's part of their culture, so don't freak out if know ones inside.

This is the place to go. If you want a different experience in Lisbon, this is the place to go. The small and narrow streets are filled with good restaurants and small shops, and there is a mood of relaxivity. Enjoy!
Nice place, a lot of bars. Nice place with a lot of bars open all the nignt, looks like Trastevere in Rome. BUT cocktails much cheaper, than in Italy. And many bars are smoking area.
Nice place for a drink. We went for a walk and a drink in the area. We found a nice small place that served good cheese and wine. Nice!

...so lively!. Well... you can not miss it even if you try! Full of restaurants, bars, clubs, fados...etc, it the heart of the nigthlife -or just for a night walk- of lisbon. Very safe and very very interesting!
Beautiful!. You should definitely go there to feel the atmosphere of this city. Just go there and enjoy sun, nice views, cosy streets and lovely cafés!
lots of character in this great part of town. Great fun exploring this part of beautiful Lisbon. Plenty of shops, restaurants and bars. A great way to spend an afternoon

Brimming with life!. This area comes alive on friday and saturday nights! Narrow streets filled with bars, amazingly large number of people, very international and not expensive at all. If you are in Lisbon, this place is definitely worth a visit. I like to call it the "fun district".

A must see... and see again... and again.... There's always something to do in Bairro Alto, and after two months in Lisbon I never got bored of it. By day, poke around bizarre antique shops full of everything you never knew you needed. Head to a restaurant for dinner (any kind of food you happen to be craving), and then to one of Bairro Alto's dozens of bars. The Erasmus Quarter is the cheapest bar area, but this is Lisbon and nothing's priced exorbitantly. The bars tend to be small, so spill out onto the street with your drink (it's legal) and meet people from all over the world, as well as locals. If you can remember the night, you'll certainly come home with a story or two from it.

Explore during the day, dine here at night. It's charming area with a variety of shops and restaurants. Several of the restaurants provide live entertainment (Fado) and there are wandering street musicians that also perform, which adds charm to the area.
Wow. Great to see by tram and on foot. Old World charm combined with modern conveniences. Many opportunities to take great photos.
very nice view of the city. It is nice to walk around - we took the elevator to avoid walking up - it was a long waiting line .Then we walk around and down
Great fun. Loads of little bars and restaurants; thousands of people. Bit TOO busy sometimes (e.g. hard to move around etc).

Nice to explore. Bairro Alto is very enchanting to see, but the nightlife definitely brings out the higher prices and tourist traps. Restaurants seemed significantly higher priced here than in other parts of the city.

District has it all. This was our first stop in Lisbon and our last stop before we left. This district has it all that we expected to see. There is old architecture and renovated structures; traditional tapas restos/bars and those with contemporary menus. The streets do not all look the same having a lot of visual diversity as you travel through this area. It has traditional stores as well as retailers with items suited to tourists. We easily found value and quality in many tapas/bars and restaurants. There are delis, pharmacies and grocery stores all along the way. We found the Lisbon culture to be very alive in this area with festivals and parades during our stay. A MUST for at least 2 days when in the Lisbon area.

Not my scene. Went looking for music but was disappointed. found it dirty and seedy and not much on. The Alfama area was much more pleasant with the sounds of fado on most streets and much cleaner too.
Great place. Just another gem in the city, everything is always beautiful in e European countries I find! Just another area to visit, but every where is worth checking out.

One big street party!. Great neighbourhood to let your hair down and swill a few cheap drinks...prices circle the euro mark for most beers,wines and dashes! No point arriving early as most places only open their door after ten or eleven but will go until 2/3! Only downside is the guys selling "drugs" on the street, they're not dangerous but their hassling can take away from an evenings fun and frolics!

The best place to party in Lisbon. The best place to party in Lisbon, I do not recommend to dinner there.Best time to visit is friday or saturday night, I passed there in Saturday at lunch time and everything was closed.

Very Nice. The area had a lot to do and see. Obviously not being from the area it was all new to us and exciting to ne somewhere you had not been, however since you are here you have to visit Bairro Alto area

Definitely worth wondering around. Nothing particularly noticeable, the whole neighbourhood is a gem. The environment is very relaxed, there are many cafes, restaurants, bars, stores, interesting streets, etc. People are very friendly.

Everything you'd wish for... and the chaos that goes with it. Wherever you are on holidays with your partner or a group of friends, Bairro Alto is the place to go. If not for the experience itself. But Bairro Alto is so much more than just a neighborhood. It's good food, great bars, great music, huge amounts of people to mingle with and the essence of what Lisbon's nightlife has been for the past few decades.You have design hotels. Old fashioned hotels and hostels. High end and gourmet restaurants. Fast food joints. Small bars with a balcony only that nearly just serve people standing in the street. Bars with live music. DJs. Fashion. Haut Couture. Street fashion. Arts. Crafts. Culture. Design. You name it, it's there. And most are open until late, usually 2am.Of course if you want the goods, you have to suffer. The traffic is chaotic starting from late afternoon. Parking is almost impossible even with several indoor parking lots. Best choice is to go by public transportation. And afterwards you can just walk your booze off and go down to Rossio and grab a late night Mac.

Vibrant, lively, great food and drink. This area of Lisbon is the place to go for food and drink. Lots of streets of bars and restaurants for all tastes and budgets.It gets busy with both locals and tourists alike, and you can spend a couple of hours just walking around this area trying to decided on where to eat or drink.It has a great atmosphere and we found some lovely little places where we were able to spend a few a hours sampling good Portuguese food. There is no point going through the day - it is deserted. It only opens and livens up from about 8pm onwards.Some of the streets are very steep. narrow and have cobbles, so it is not great for those unable to walk far or who have mobility issues, but if you can manage it, you should come here.

Lively and fun. A great little bit of the city for some caipirinhas and beer. Lots of live music and a great atmosphere when the night gets going (at around midnight!)As with anywhere like this there are tourist trap bars and restaurants that are pretty mediocre, but if you wander round and suss it out you'll find something you will enjoy.

Very interesting sightseeing. Nice spot to walk around any time of the day.
Very interesting sightseeing, pavements, houses.
Prepare your legs and don't be lazy nor afraid of getting lost. This is the best part.
Besides this, at night any bar is a nice experience.
Place for nightlife!. Great restaurants and pubs. The place is buzzing with people at night. A must do if you want to enjoy the nightlife of Lisbon!

Excellent area for eateries. This section of town has many. many excellent restaurants in a compact area. Overlooking the city on one of the 7 hills around Lisbon. Take a taxi as it is a very steep climb to get there.

Mugged, pick pockets, nasty people.. Day one was fine, a lot of walking, people in shops with no English for directions. We arrived at our apartment, Akisol Bairro Apartments, and the oven wasn't working, the apartment was 4 flights up on the most steep stairs I have ever seen, and the street was dangerous and ghetto-like. Do not go here if you don't enjoy walking for hours. Pick pockets are everywhere, and they dress up like tourists with a camera around their neck and a tourist map, and will come up behind you in broad day light and steal anything and everything they can. On the second daywe requated for our oven to be fixed but we were told later (later never came) so we went to the main part of town and we got more of a feel for the city, and seemed to enjoy it that bit more, apart from having to watch your bag the entire time. Drug dealers are on every corner begging you to buy from them, these can also be distractions for pick pockets, you will never feel safe. On the final night the oven was fixed but worse was to come. Not at a late time my boyfriend walked to the shop which was >5 minutes away and came back over two hours later with a cut on his head, a sprained elbow and wrist...he had been mugged by some of the locals. He was dragged down a side street, after being tripped up and threatened, and after the ordeal he was sent in an opposite direction by the muggers, and was lost. They took his wallet which had no money in it as he was going to an ATM first to get us both out money for the airport, so both of our bank cards were gone also. The only thing he had was the key to the apartment and his phone with no battery life, and after finding some police men who only offered him a lift to the centre of the town, and taxi drivers who kept driving. When he eventually found someone who would help him, they took the phone number off the back of the key and rang our landlord and he finally came back to the apartment. The landlord was not happy abotu the phonecall, and gave out to my boyfriend for "being drunk and lost", when this was not the case, and ignored the cut on his head and limp arm by saying he was "heavily drunk and only lost his wallet". Do not go to these apartments, and be sure you want to risk visiting this town, maybe a day trip to the city would be best.

Uptown district with great food and shopping. My girlfriend and I stayed in this part of town during our visit to Lisbon. It's a great district full of high-end designers (if that appeals to you), boutique shops, cozy little eateries, and anything your heart desires. If you like window shopping, make sure to visit Rua Garret, the equivalent of Fifth Avenue in Manhattan but with more Old World Charm. Pop into the local bakeries and try pasteis de nata, a creamy, sweet egg tart that crumbles in your mouth. There are also plenty of open public spaces like Praca Luis de Camoes where you can enjoy the European architecture and people watch as you take a break from all the walking. Whatever your interests are, this historic district will satisfy your cravings.
Nightlife. A place where you can eat or have a drink. There are a lot of places to try. Fun is garanteed all night long.

This is the place to go in the evening. Want to enjoy a great fado evening at a local restaurant? The Barrio Alto is the place to go. Great choice, very nice atmosphere, numerous unique places. We just loved it.

Feels like in Rio. Amazing neighborhood, very artistic, turistic and feel yourself like in Lapa's and Santa Tereza's neighborhoods, of Rio de Janeiro. You can easily see the influency of Portugal in Brazil on this comparison.
GREAT SUNSET at Barrio Alto Hotel Terrace. If you are in the are dont miss this terrace for a drink or tea!!! The pleasure of the view, the lounge music and the drink are unforgetable.

Average.... Bairro Alto has the largest cluster if restaurants in Lisbon and hence, the place comes alive at night. However, most of these restaurants are pretty ordinary so one needs to choose one only after reading some reviews and hope to have luck on your side. There are a couple of good places for Fado. Overall atmosphere in the evening is quite lively.

Bar/Cafe District. There is plenty of shopping to be had here in the day and some cultural locations but this place comes alive at night. I feel sorry for the residents of this district who must not get very much sleep.This area is easily reached from the Rossi station and it has its own substations. Small winding street make for difficulty if you are not paying attention.

Great place to visit. We went for a walk and so enjoy walking and site seeing see houses of Fado,were people go to listen the well known songs call Fado.very famous places for night life of music eat and drink.Most people go to this place to know and listen to the kind of songs and music all very sentimental.

Alive at night, dead by day. We wondered through during the day and couldn't believe there was anything of interest there. But at night the shutters open up and the buzz of independent bars/cafes/ Fado music is wonderful. I found my favourite corner in the whole of Lisbon in a bar a bit like a living room- just room for two underneath the stairs. You will find your own niche here- just keep wandering.

the night life of Lisbon. Bairro Alto is a really cool place to visit, it happened that I visited it during the preparation Saint Antonio festival which is on the 13th of June, I regret that I had to leave on the 11th because apparently the parties are incredible on the 12th! the decoration on the streets were already there. I did the pub crawl with wild walker tour, and we visited many pubs and a club at Bairro alto, it was very cool ambience, if you like to go out at night, then this is the place to be when you are at Lisbon

Bar heaven. If you want to get high, climb high. The clue's in the name of this lively district of eating, drinking and fun. It's an after eight sort of place, but doesn't sleep until the early hours.
Something for everyone. Lined with cafes and cozy pubs and bars, this one is for the party animal as well as the laid-back traveller Lisbon. In any case, a must-visit.

A must visit. If you're in Lisbon and looking for a bar/restaurant, then Bairro Alto is the place to go. A short walk from the main square, the place has incredible character and offers a myriad of eating places to choose from.
bairro alto. It is the best part in town! If you want to have coffee-it is great, if you want to have dinner or drink in the evening or just walk around - it is great!

Lots of bars, pubs and restaurants. It was quite lovely seeing all of the nightlife and the streets decorated for Santo Antonio festivities. Old neighbourhood with alot of charm, little streets and typical portuguese houses.Lots of people, so it was a bit difficult to find a restaurant for 5.
Bit of a disappointment. Tends to wake up after dark. Go there in the morning or afternoon and it's gone to sleep! Just a centre for bars and clubs. Old, a little run down but safe enough.

Lisbon Bohemic Life. Bairro Alto it´s one of the most beautiful neighborhoods from Lisbon old downtown. It's an amazing place full of life. During the day with tradicional commerce and typical food shops, by the night it's full of alternative bars, place's to hangout, share good vibes and meet new people!!

Lisbon's Liveliest Neighborhood. If you make one stop before a night out in Lisbon make it to the Biarro Alto! Here you can join in the lively nightlife of fellow revelers as you weave in and out of the maze of tiny bars and pubs. I'd seriously recommend the Majong bar to start with for some intimate chilled music before you ascend on the bedlam that is the rest of Bairro Alto!

"Good life". Good restaurants (until €20 is a good price), great bars; And if you want (listen) to know what is FADO, it´s a good place to "see" (means listen). It´s coming the good (warm) weather... so, it´s a place to visit after a good journey in a beautiful city like Lisbon.

Great place to go at night. Is one of the most typical placas in Lisbon! At night all spots are occupied by People and bars. I suggest to go thursday, friday or saturday night. The restaurants are very expensive and with low quality. You can eat better in nearby placas like 'príncipe real'. It. is better after dinner, between 10pm and 3am.
Nice area. The streets are interesting and in this area you can find a lot of restaurants and bars. The prices for the restaurants are in average between 8 and 20 EUR.

The place to be Friday and Saturday nights. Lots of excellent restaurants and bars !!!Definitely the place to go for Lisbon night clubbers to have a drink before going out to clubs.In summer nights , you can just stay out in the sidewalk (very narrow streets) having a drink and watch people go by.

Easter 2014. Thought it might be a bit rough but was very pleasant. Narrow streets with lots of little restaurants and many tapas bars. Great for the young or young at heart. Good for one night for us (4o's)as there are many other locations with great food to try
Loved it. Stayed in Bario Alto and really liked it. Very good little area. Good restaraunts and centrally located. Safe and walkable.
Great area to see fado. Great area to shop....go to cafes and at night see fado singers. Sr. Vinho my favorite Fado house. Can get pretty lively at night and noisy so be careful.

A picturesque section of town. Bairro Alto (the 'Upper District') is an old and typical area of Lisbon. Since it is on a hill, street & lanes go up & down, some are made of stairs. These days, there are many bars & restaurants in this part of town. It might be a good idea to go up with the incline (the funicular) and decide to visit this picturesque section on foot before walking back downhill.
nice place to shop. you can shop till your hearts content in this area. very nice area, next to everything. nice small parks all over, street performers.

Get Your Drank On. Great place to visit at night. You can buy a drink in one place and take it to another. The narrow streets and old world architecture make it a fantastic place to check out and see.
Cosy neighbourhood. The old and cosy neighbourhood of Lisbon, which is perfect for a stroll in the evening and for dinner and drinks.

Wonderful. Passing by very narrow streets, enjoying the old atmosphere, seeing real Lisbon people living in this place make the Upper city one of the best places worth for visit. And to "catch" of whole old atmosphere you have to take historical tram line and enjoy this atmosphere from it.
Nice to hang out and eat. Here you can go and have some nice drinks and good food. This part of the city is really really nice, especially at night.

Make sure you take the funicular. This is a great area to wander around day or night. There are lots of restaurants and the views are fantastic. Take the funicular up and then you can take the elevator down. The elevator is expensive but it's a quick way back down.

Cultural centre of the city. GO there after 10 and you will see the entire area comes alive. We were roaming there at 1 Am and we could see people walking around with a drink in hand and people having fun. There are a lot of places to fill in your tummy after a drink/rounds of drinks. Make sure that is there in your To-Do list in Lisboa

Upscale and Mid Scale. Interesting area of Lisbon that abuts Chiado district. Many small shops along with designer brand shops. Restaurants offer a variety of choices, including many panaderias and lunch stops. We stayed in an apartment in the area and liked it.

If you are looking for the New Orleans of Europe.... This place is a bit quiet during the day, enough tourists in and out, but at night, past 11pm, the place turns into a zoo.People come out in crowds, and every door/window all of a sudden becomes a bar.The streets are packed and people are allowed to wander up and around the area with their plastic cups of whatever they are drinking. A tip would be just to bring your own as it'll be cheaper and the mini markets are open late to sell beer for much less.I do not suggest you booking accommodations in this area unless you do want to go out and party from Thurs-Sat nights.The noise is loud and it keeps being loud til about 3/4am.It's great tho as it's got a great vibe and if you are looking for a party, then Bairro Alto at night is for you. Not sure what it is like Sun-Wed night tho... so it may be a bit dead then.

Fab night out. The Bairro Alto is a fantasic area of Lisbon for food and drink and would recommend a visit one evening during a trip to Lisbon. We were staying out of the centre and got there by Metro which brings you out at the bottom of where all the rows of streets and bars are. The streets are full of small bars and restaurants, drinks are slightly cheaper than at other parts of Lisbon. A lot of the bars play live music and to a very high quality. I have no idea what time the bars close, we went home about 1.30am and everything was still in full swing.

Great Nightlife!. I've only been here at night but it we came back every night we were in Lisbon. It wasn't too far from our Hostel so we would just walk over. Once you get to the Bairro Alto area at night you can see that the alleys are completely packed with people. The bars are all next to each other and the crowd is real cool. The drinks are cheap, bars are full and the people are friendly! The bars vary from hip hop to live bands, you will find something you like! You have to check it out while in Lisbon, Have fun!
Fun area, tons to do, locals and tourists alike!. Fun walking around - plan to walk uphill as you start the evening so that you can end at the miradour on the top!

Very deceiving!. Nothing there during the day...at night it's rammed full of bars and people. brilliant nightlife. Also if you cross the road where the number 28 tram travels, there are more bars on the fenicular track

Number one district to flaunt your shopping credentials.. This is the 'numero uno' district for picturesque hilltop views. this area has interesting small workshops and cheap eateries plus a rave lifestyle. Its the opposite of Bairo A,the elegant district where my femme naturally gravitated to with a lot of affluent Lisboetas do their shopping. Further on,is the Estrella with popular gardens and a huge dome to ogle while taking the appropriate caffeine hit. Great place to launch yourselves into a visit to the sensational ruins of the majestic 14th century Sao Roque. Super tiles and painted ceilings.
Fun. Lots of fun, cheap drinks, good bars - student feel to it. Would recommend. All bars are internationally friendly. Slightly hard to find, but most taxi drivers will know where it is.

Nice to discover strolling form one street to the next. Do not miss the park from which you can see the whole city. You will discover many little cafés, and boutiques that are different from the main stream.

variety... this place is a must when in lisbon... there is a variety of places to suit everyone's needs.. I love that everything is close, if you get bored with where you are you just skip over to the next bar.. may look a bit scary but the portuguese people are truly one of the friendliest I have ever come across... a must try is the gin in choc cup if your a drinker, the fado is awesome, the mojitos is also a good choice... the list continues... I miss it already. ")
The place for nightlife. Good bars and restaurants. Easy access by tram, subway and taxi. The 'O Fado' dinner & show was very nice, in spite of a little expensive.

Alternative Lisbon is here. The Bairro Alto is Lisbon's equivalent of the Left Bank in Paris, or Camden Town in London. There are quirky cafes and bars on almost every corner. The is a feeling of having gone back in time to an era of "Hippydom"
Fun and lively bar area. Would recommend to grab a wineglass and a cheeseplatter at places like Grapes & Bites or B.A Winelovers and then go roaming the area of narrow streets and small bars

A guaranteed right night. Bars, Restaurants, Bars and more bars. There's a little something for everyone in Bairro Alto. My friends and I spent three nights wandering the streets of the Bairro, meeting other travelers, drinking in the streets, eating some great dinners, and overall loving our lives in Lisbon. I'll definitely be back to these winding streets my next time is Lisboa.

Fun nights out. It was busy at night in the bars and restaurants from about 10pm, we met lots of friendly people had some good nights, the elvador Gloria just on the opposite side of the street to the hard rock was very sweet, and the fee gives you 2 rides over different days

Nice place. Bairro Alto is a very nice place for cafes and restaurants. With its narrow streets, paved with stones, with its views (miradouro) of the city, it is very beautiful and specific for Portugal. We had dinner there one evening, and we enjoyed the food, the service, and the area.
Fun place to visit. Great place go go at night because it has the most nightlife in Lisbon. You can listen to Fado music and a ton of places to eat and drink.

Nice for night time. A bit quiet during the bay but a good atmosphere at night. Loads of lively bars and restaurants to try out. Most people order their drinks inside then stand out on the street drinking and chatting.

Great views of Lisbon.. From what I had read I expected Barrio Alto to be like the French Quarter in New Orleans--one big party. There weren't many people there during the day and later in the evening there were many more people but not the roudy party scene. Not that I like the roudy party scene-- I don't but that's how Barrio Alto was portrayed. Maybe I didn't stay late enough in the evening. Barrio Alto is very quaint and has some terrific views of Lisbon.

Best wine bar ever.. BA Wine Bar of Bairro Alto. We had our own wine server and the local cheese and bread were wonderful. No wonder is the number One rated restaurant in Lisbon. Doesn't open until 6:30pm and you absolutely have to have a reservation.

Favourite. This was by far our favourite neighborhood with much life, action and great people watching. Trams, traffic, cafes and the buzz of Lisbon life is here. Along with Chiado, this place is great day or night. Beats Alfama hands down if you like energy.

Lovely relaxing square. A busy area but there are lovely quiet squares and gardens where you can sit with a drink and look at the views from the height of Bairro Alto - strongly suggest going there and trying the Elevador Gloria.
Vibrant. Excelent neighbourhood of Lisboa, with tipical bars and international buzz.I recommend the Lost In terrace and La Lisboeta bar

Where the night life is in Lisbon. Good for its restaurants and bars, the Bairro Alto is mostly known for its nightlife and for the restaurants that play "fado".
A good solution for dinner and a possible drink aftewards, but be prepared to potentially encounter some people who have had a few too many...

Outdoor Drinking. A perfect place to grab a cheap beer and walk around. Throughout the streets there are many small bars with crowds of people outside of them. At almost every place you can get a half liter of beer for under 1.5 Euros. Its great to grab a beer and walk from bar to bar as you see different styled bars that entice you inside.

shopping and food. Some great little shops, though a bit pricey on the whole. Some great restaurants and cafes, and a really good vibe. Easy access to tour buses and the rest of Lisbon. Steep hills in places

Fun in crowded streets. I always like going to Bairro Alto, it's lively streets are always interesting. People get their beers in Bar and then just stay on the street, which makes a really nice atmosphere. In Summer it can be a bit too crowded (many tourists!), but that's the time to explore the bars that are not in the center, but in the 2nd or 3rd row of streets...Some good (but touristy) restaurants are in the area as well.Don't go there before 10PM if you only go for drinks.
Interesting palce. If you want to see how common Lisbon's people live, just visit Bairro Alto. There is much to see, narrow streets, local bars...
Great historic part of Lisbon. After eight oclock you can find all kinds of nice cosy restaurants and bars ...great vieuw over the city

Now that what I call the best pub crawl in Western Europe. With more than one square mile (or 1.5 kms) of pubs, bars, restaurants, shops, concert venues, galleries and plenty more to do and see, Bairro Alto is the eternal sunshine in Lisbos's nightlife. Heaps of bars and pubs change every year, there's always the dodgy characters trying to sell you fake drugs and the odd prostitute around the corner, yet this place is teeming with life, atmosphere and nice stuff to do. I've been going there for 25 years, asnd never cease to discover new spots (or the good old one, from a friend). A definite must for any person even with a fleeting (or more) for nightlife. Hundreds of venues crammed into a few quarters give you the certainty of being able to find one of your liking. Hint: Locals often just go inside to order drinks, life in Bairro Alto happens mostly outdoors...

Nice area with hopping nightlife. Loads of bars and restaurants in this area, all very small and very cheap, with different vibes in each, some with live music, others more like clubs and some more relaxed pub type places. If you're going on a night out in Lisbon this is where you go basically, the place is absolutely hopping after dark.
Best bars & restaurants. Lovely area to explore with quirky bars, restaurants & shops. Brilliant views over the city. Lost in bar, beautiful hidden haven.

Night Time trawling. Bairro Alto is a an eclectic mix of bars and restaurants theat wake up after dark. easy to stroll around and stop off here and there. People very friendly and there were no hassles

Winding streets of the Bairro Alto. We spent a few days in Lisbon and loved walking the streets of Bairro Alto -lots of little restaurants, some of which have fado, ice cream shops, retail stores and the charm of it all is the narrow cobbled streets that makes you realize that you are in a very old city with all the mod cons that your heart desires. Extremely quaint!!
nice walking. walking too and through the Bairro Alto will burn those calories gained from the good food of Lisbon.

Wonderful views!!!. As you get off the cable car stop at the park and look down the city for few minutes then run and explore the lively quaint small street of Barrio Alto you can enter and have dinner and fado at any one of the many restaurants in the area.

Many a good restaurant in this area.. The night out area of Lisboa. Equally beautiful during the day. Tends to be packed on the weekend. Less of course during the day. Many restaurants and bars. 100 Maneiras is in this area and a highly recommended restaurant. Also has the church of Sao Roque. Which is insanely beautiful. Great boutiques with buyers with great taste and a good eye. Unique. An area I kept returning too. Especially for the view from the mirador.

Style over substance. If you want an authentic Portugese experience then this is not the place for you. The menu tries to be too clever by half and offer tourists what it thinks they want. I don't know about you but I certainly would never think about visiting Lisbon with all it's heritage and fantastically fresh fish that is available and then order Pasta or Risotto or Confit Duck.
